loans.name: Norma Del Carmen

texts.es: Norma Del Carmen se dedica a una pulpería. Es una mujer trabajadora y lo ha demostrado por medio de sus negocios que ha sabido manejarlos muy bien. Con fondos propios fue que ella estableció este medio de vida. Uno de sus mayores desafíos ha sido el tiempo, pues ella tiene que estar al pendiente de su negocio, por lo que no es fácil ya que es algo agotador. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, granos básicos entre otros.
texts.en: Norma Del Carmen runs a grocery store.  She is a hard-working woman and she has demonstrated this through her business which she has known how to run very well.  She set up her business with her own funds.  One of her biggest challenges has been time as she has to devote herself to her business.  This is not easy as it is fairly exhausting.  She is requesting this loan to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, detergents, basic grains and other products.

loans.use: to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, detergents, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and lives with five family members. One of them works.

Wissam has been an owner of a market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2000 loan in order to renovate and redecorate his market and add more shelves. He is aiming to earn more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and redecorate his market and add more shelves.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is a 28-year-old married woman with two sons. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Ngoc and her husband run a business making soft rice noodles. Ngoc would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing rice in bulk. 

She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk to make soft noodles.

loans.name: Merina

texts.en: Merina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with six children and two of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She operates a retail shop at home. She has been in this business for the last 10 years.  She works seven days a week .She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of rice, sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap.  She generates additional income through rental rooms. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business into a wholesale shop and to build more rental rooms. Her major business challenges are seasonality, on and off electricity and transportation. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more suagr, salt, soap and rice

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 51 years old. She is married and has four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cristina has a nipa-weaving business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a loan for PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of nipa to weave.

Cristina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Cristina would like to expand her business to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of nipa to weave.

loans.name: Mavesi C B O Group

texts.en:
James takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, James had an excellent maize yield harvesting 7 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, James was only able to harvest 1 ½ bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. With income from maize sales, James will pay for major annual expenses such as school fees and livestock investments.

James is the facilitator of the Mavesi CBO group. As with the majority of farmers in Western Kenya, James and his fellow group members are farmers who rely on maize for income and food security. James and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Mavesi CBO group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land. In the photograph above, James is pictured with his group members. The field officer appears on the far left of the photograph. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to James and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sabiran's Group

texts.en:
Sabiran is 50 years of age, still an active lady in her works. Besides managing her household works, she operates a quilt-making business. She is renowned for her work in her community. She fills the quilts with cotton to make it useful. Many clients come to her from her community to give her the raw material. She prepares the quilts for them and earns a reasonable amount of income, which helps utilizing it in managing the household expenses. 

Sabiran's husband is involved in selling seasonal fruits. He is a very hard worker and goes to the fruit market early in the morning to purchase fresh, good quality fruits for selling. He is a very dedicated and honest person and doesn't sell the low quality fruits to his customers. His customers prefer buying fruits from him due to the freshness of the products and his reasonable rates. 

Sabiran is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. He will intend to use this loan in purchasing fresh seasonal fruits in bulk quantity for selling. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will become more profitable after an investment.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for fruit selling business.

loans.name: Jinnefer

texts.en:
Jinnefer is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Jinnefer is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools & pay for gasoline for the motorcycle.
Jinnefer has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jinnefer hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline for the motorcycle

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Habiba requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials to repair her fishing boat.

Habiba has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Habiba would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es: La Sra. Eulogia es cliente desde hace dos años, ella se dedica a la venta de mantas de alpaca y vicuña, ella compra por kilos la lana en bruto y después lo hila, posteriormente da a tejer lo cual paga en mano de obra, la señora vive con el esposo que trabaja en un taller de carpintería, ellos tienen tres hijos de los cuales dos ya colaboran en el hogar a la vez que estudian, el hijo menor es quien continua estudiando y acompaña a su mama, es una familia muy unida y con el esfuerzo de ambos construyeron su vivienda propia, con el dinero del crédito comprara lana ya que tiene un pedido que entregar de mantas, La Sra. Eulogia se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Ms. Eulogia has been a client for two years. She devotes herself to selling blankets made of alpaca and vicuña wool. She buys the unprocessed wool in kilos and then spins it, and then gives it to be woven and pays for the labor. She lives with her husband who works in a carpentry shop. They have three children of whom two now help out at home while they also go to school. The youngest child is the one who is still in school and accompanies his mom. It is a very close-knit family and through both their efforts they built their own housing. With the money from the loan she will purchase wool since she has an order to fill for blankets. Ms. Eulogia is happy and grateful to the institution for the support she has been given.

loans.use: to purchase wool.

loans.name: Abul

texts.en:
Abul is a 38-year-old married woman with five children, and three of them are in school. 

She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan, for two years.

Abul is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Yin (pictured here) is a construction worker and his wife, Yet is a rice farmer. And he also assists his wife in rice farming when he is free. The couple lives in suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers and they have seven children-one son and six daughters. Five are married and live separately and others are garment workers. 

Yin is asking for a loan of $700 to buy pipes and water pumping machine to spray his rice farm.

loans.use: To buy pipes and water pumping machine to spray his rice farm.

loans.name: Abdulhakim

texts.en: A hardworking man, Abdulhakim is 42 years old, married, man and has four children who live in Taiz,Yemen.  He has a house for 10 years. he inherited his house from his mother. He would like to expand his house so; he applied for a loan of 200000 YER from AMB to buy cements and irons for his house.

loans.use: to buy cement and iron for his house.

loans.name: Ayidote Group

texts.fr: AYIDOTE est un groupement de vingt neuf personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Hountchekon Armandine (qui a gardé le calendrier de remboursement du groupement dans sa main), est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un certain Mathias. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Hountchekon Armandine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Hountchekon Armandine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quinze ans que Hountchekon Armandine mène comme activité la vente des mèches et des savons à son domicile. Hountchekon Armandine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Hountchekon Armandine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Hountchekon Armandine sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupement AYIDOTE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
AYIDOTE is a group made up of 29 members who live in the same neighborhood.  The group's representative, Hountchekon Armandine, is 46 years old and married to a man named Mathias.  In the photo, she is the one holding the group's repayment schedule in her hand.

Hountchekon Armandine and her husband have two children, both in school and their dependents.  Hountchekon Armandine live with her children and husband, and shares with him the various expenses associated with raising the family.

Hountchekon Armandine did not attend school.  She has been selling hair extensions and soaps from her home for about fifteen years.  She is passionate about her work, and this activity allows her to meet her needs as well as those of her children.  She buys her goods from a market in Benin.

Eager to satisfy the needs of her customers,  she is requesting a first loan, along with the other members of the AYIDOTE group.  Thanks to this loan, the members of the group will be able to better meet their customers' expectations and to increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and soaps.

loans.name: Kisilo

texts.en:
Kisilo lives in Magodi, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Kisilo is married and has six children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for forty-two years now and they are currently growing an orange orchard on their farm. Kisilo is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey for food.

This is Kisilo’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Kisilo’s hope for the future is to improve his crop production.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Aitcheme Group

texts.fr: AITCHEME est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Joséphine2 (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 55 ans. Joséphine2 n'a pas fréquenté l'écol. Joséphine2 est mariée à un certain Simon. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Joséphine2 vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Joséphine2 et son mari. Pour cette raison, Joséphine2 vend des plateaux d’œufs et des glacières depuis trente ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Joséphine2 s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Joséphine2 sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe AITCHEME, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des plateaux d’œufs et des glacières.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods and etc.

Josephine has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods and etc

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias has been a salesman for about 40 years. He sells all types of household products from a market where he has had a stand for over 20 years. His son also works in his stand selling chickens and vegetables. They have been able to diversify their product offerings by reinvesting their products into their business. They are requesting this loan because they want to speed up this process and make a large investment that will boost their business. They are interested in purchasing plastic storage containers and kitchen supplies. Elias still has 2 children who live with him and are going to school. He hopes he can pay for them to attain higher educations.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in plastic storage supplies and other items to sell

loans.name: Karamfilka

texts.en: Together with her husband Karamfilka V. has been breeding cows for more than 7 years. They both found themselves unemployed and decided to start this farming business. The beginning was hard but now every year Karamfilka and her husband enlarge the capacity of their farm and the number of animals they breed. Now they need $1200 to buy three cows.

loans.use: To buy three cows

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is married with four children, three in primary school and one still at home. He started his business early this year. The business is located at Malaba Town along the Uganda road. He sells manufactured retail goods and cereals.

Patrick operates the kiosk hand-in-hand with his wife. He is a pastor at his church (Victory Churches International). He started his business in order to raise his living standard. His capital right now can be estimated at three hundred US dollars in stock. He gets his stock from nearby wholesalers and cereals from the farmers.

With a loan of $250 from PEMCI, Patrick intends to increase the stock and cereals for his kiosk and hence improve the returns from his business. Through his business, Patrick has been able to provide for his family, educate his children, and also keep his wife busy. Recommended for support by Kiva partners.

loans.use: Boost the Stock of his Business

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina is 40 years old and a single mother of a 17-year-old son. She lives in her mother's house, which is located 3km from the center of the city of Encarnaicon. Carolina has worked for 12 years as a chef, earning a fixed salary, at a prominent hotel situated 200 meters from her residence. She was the only source of income in her family (her mother could not work due to her age and her son was a minor). However, Carolina was able to save, and 8 years ago, she opened a grocery store in her home. Her mother and her son help her. She sells all types of common products, like sugar, olive oil, milk products, beverages, and ready-made foods, which she prepares herself.

Her biggest concern has always been her son's education. Thankfully, her effort and dedication has helped her pay for the education of her son, who, in the coming year, will eventually attend the university. Since the cost of his studies will only continue to increase, Carolina hopes to advance her business so that she can obtain greater profits. For her to be able increase her sales, she must increase her stock. For this, she asks for a loan of 275 dollars to purchase products like sugar, olive oil, canned goods, and sweets in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Carolina tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo varón de 17 años, vive en la casa de su madre, que se encuentra ubicado en un barrio distante, a 3 Km. del centro de la ciudad de Encarnación. Carolina trabaja hace ya 12 años en un hotel importante que se encuentra a 2 cuadras (200 mts) de su domicilio, como encargada de cocina, en donde posee un salario fijo, como ella era la única fuente de ingreso en la familia, (ya que su madre ya no podía trabajar por su avanzada edad y su hijo que era aún menor), Carolina pudo ahorrar y abrió hace 8 años, una despensa en su casa, donde la ayudan su madre y su hijo. En su despensa vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, aceite, productos lácteos, fideos, bebidas así como también comidas rápidas que ella misma elabora.

Su mayor preocupación siempre fue la educación de su hijo, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado pagar los estudios de su hijo que el próximo año ya podrá cursar el probatorio para la Universidad. En vista de que los gastos del estudio de su hijo van aumentando, ella desea ir progresando y ampliando su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias; para ello tiene pensado aumentar sus ventas aumentando su stock de mercaderías, por lo que solicita un crédito de $ 275 que lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor de azúcar, aceite, productos enlatados y golosinas.

loans.use: To purchase product, like sugar, olive oil, canned goods, and sweets, in bulk

loans.name: Sokina

texts.ru:
Sokina O. has been selling underwear for 17 years. She is a widowed mother of one child. Sokina has a high school education. In 2003, when she received a $70 loan from MicroInvest, Sokina’s business assets totaled $100. She used the loan to expand her business and make improvements around the store. Sokina used the extra profits to send her son to college. Sokina doubled her business assets and plans to open a new retail spot for her son.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Очилова Сокина занимается реализацией нижнего белья вот уже. Вдова имеет одного ребёнка, образование среднее. Начала заниматься торговлей нижнего белья 17 лет назад, поскольку все заботы о семье лежат на её плечах. В 2003году она получила займ в размере 70$, тогда её активы составляли 100$. Постепенно после получения займа и целевого использования она увеличила ассортимент товара, расширила место деятельности. Получив прибыль от торговли, она устроила сына в Университет. Сейчас её активы увеличились в два раза, и в будущем она планирует открыть торговую точку для сына.

loans.use: Open a sales location for her son

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta is 44 years old. She belongs to the Community Bank Las Saposoínas and lives in the San Martín region of Peru, in the province of Huallaga, Saposoa district. Her business is located on the street Jr. Lima No. 597 in the city of Saposoa. Violeta and her family sell all kinds of prepared food, and during the evenings they tend to their business selling grilled chicken.

Thanks to the support she receives from her husband and her children and her good service Violeta has successfully grown her clientele. She now even receives institutional orders for special events.

With this loan of S/ 1000 (Peruvian sols, equivalent to $333) from Manuela Ramos, which she will repay in 6 months, Violeta will buy soft drinks by the dozen, in many different brands, sizes and flavors. She will also buy live chickens in crates of 10 which she use to prepare her grilled chicken, along with the other ingredients she needs for the daily preparation of the food. In this way she'll give her business an important boost and provide a better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Violeta tiene 44 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Saposoínas, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia del Huallaga y distrito de Saposoa, su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Lima No. 597, en la ciudad de Saposoa y se dedica, junto a su familia, a la Venta de todo tipo de comida y por las noches atiende como pollería.

Gracias al apoyo de su esposo, sus hijos y a la buena atención está logrando tener mayor clientela, ya que incluso tiene pedidos algunas instituciones para eventos.

Con reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 1,000.00,($ 333.00) el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará gaseosas por docenas, de diferentes marcas, sabores y tamaños, pollos en javas de 10 unidades para la preparación de sus pollos a la braza y demás insumos para la preparación diaria de las comidas y de esta manera implementar su negocio y dar mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, chicken and food ingredients in wholesale quantities.

loans.name: Filomena Rosario De

texts.es:
Filomena is 54 years of age. Her husband is a landlord who has retired from the SOBOLMA Company and receives a monthly pension. He is currently working for this company, but no longer receives any social benefits from it. Filomena, her husband, and two children live in their own home. This family depends solely on the income from the father’s retirement fund. They pose no financial risk since they are under the protection of a private company. Filomena will use the loan for the purchase of lumber ($480.00 USD) and she will buy roofing shingles for her home expansion with the remainder of the money. This is her fourth loan with our institution, which she has paid punctually. She currently has no other debts in the financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Filomena es una señora de 54 años de edad, su esposo es rentista y recibe mensualmente ingreso por su jubilación en la empresa SOBOLMA, donde actualmente sigue trabajando pero sin derecho a beneficios sociales. Filomena, su esposo y sus dos hijos viven en su casa que es propia. Esta familia sólo cuenta con el ingreso de jubilación que percibe el padre de familia. No comtemplan ningún riesgo al ser dependientes de una empresa privada. Filomena con el crédito comprará madera por un valor de $us. 480.- y lo restante utilizará en la compra de tejas para la ampliación de la vivienda. Este es el cuarto préstamo con nuestra institución, mismo que pagó de manera puntual, actualmente no tiene otras deudas en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: Construction of one bedroom

loans.name: Silvia Irene

texts.es:
Silvia C. is a lady who started her business selling vegetables 16 years ago, with a small amount of working capital from her husband. The need which Mrs. C. faces is that she is the mother of four school-age children, and her work does not provide enough for all the household expenses nor to support her little ones. This is the reason that day after day she makes her best effort to try to survive, as she is now a single mother and does not receive any financial support.

In spite of her situation, she has received credits from Ceprodel, which have benefited her to the extent that her sales have improved satisfactorily and in addition, even though she is in a difficult situation, she has been able to maintain her family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia C. es una dama que inicia su negocio de venta de verduras hace 16 años con un pequeño capital de trabajo producto del apoyo de su esposo. La necesidad por la que atraviesa la señora C. es que por ser madre de cuatro hijos en edad escolar el trabajo que desempeña no le cubre con los gastos del hogar ni para mantener a sus pequeños. Por este motivo es que día a día hace sus mejores esfuerzos posibles para tratar de sobrevivir ya que es madre soltera y no recibe apoyo financiero de alguien en especifico.

A pesar de la situación que atraviesa, ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel los cuales le han beneficiado de manera que sus ventas han venido mejorando satisfactoriamente y además aun en medio de su difícil situación ha logrado mantener su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Doeu

texts.en: Mrs. Doeu S., 48, owns a plot of land growing a variety of vegetables, making on average about $2 a day. Her husband Mr. Sreng Sran, 53, is a blacksmith and makes about $12.50 a day. This couple has 6 children, three of whom live away from home. To increase the growth of the blacksmith business, the family must purchase additional blacksmith tools. This loan will help them to increase the income of their family and which will help finance their younger children’s education. ( His son is pictured because Mr. Sreng Sran is unavailable).

loans.use: to purchase steel equipment

loans.name: Paz Anabell

texts.es:
Paz Anabell lives in El Sauce, city of León. Her home is in this town and she needs to support her family because she is a single woman. For this reason she works in farming and also sometimes washes clothes when people ask her to.

For a long time she didn't have electricity in her house since the community she lives in is far away from the urban area. In order to solve this problem, she has requested the installation of a solar panel in her house and is asking CEPRODEL for help in order to get a loan that may allow her to pay for her debt and finish paying for the solar panel. This will allow her to have non-interrupted electric energy at her house that will allow her to iron, has light during the day and at night.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

La dama Paz Anabell es residente del municipio El Sauce en la ciudad de León teniendo su casa de habitación en esta localidad y con la necesidad de mantener a su familia ya que es una dama soltera que se dedica al negocio de agricultura y además en ocasiones al lavado de ropa cuando se lo solicitan.

Por mucho tiempo ha atravesado la situación de la inexistencia de energía eléctrica en su comunidad ya que se encuentra muy alejada de la zona urbana. Para solucionar esta problemática ha solicitado la instalación de un panel solar y busca apoyo en CEPRODEL para obtener crédito que le permita salir de esta deuda y así lograr pagar el panel y tener acceso sin problemas a la energía en la que la puede aprovechar para planchar, iluminarse y hacer uso de la luminaria por las noches.

loans.use: Payment for her house's solar panel

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a forty-year-old married father of three children. His wife is a seamstress. Samuel has been selling auto parts of different kinds for over twenty years. He rents a space from which he sells various shock absorbers and fenders. The proceeds of his loan will allow him to purchase more products from overseas (Europe, Korea). In Ghana, there are no auto parts stores but there is a high demand for parts as the taxi networks are the main transportation option. He sells his wares in an area of Accra called Abossey-Okai that is a conglomeration of hundreds of entrepreneurs who each sell specific auto parts. Samuel is a member of the lending group Not Yours. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: Samuel would like to import more shock absorbers.

loans.name: Ketut Alit

texts.id:
Ketut Alit C. lives in Jl. Mertsari Suwung Denpasar with her husband and their 5 children. They rented land and built a clean and fine house on it. They sell building materials in a store, 3 km away from their home. They have had 2 trucks to carry sands shoveled from Karangasem (±60 km), and hire 6 employees, as drivers and workers. The income they earn is used for financing their children tuition fee.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Saat ini klien tingal di Jl.Mertsari Suwung Denpasar. Dia tinggal bersama suami dan 5 anaknya dengan meneywa tanah dan membangun rumah diatasnya. Keadaan rumahnya cukup bersih dan sehat. Tempat usahanya hanya berjarak 3 km dari rumahnya. Adapun jenis usahanya adalah sebagai penjual pasir bangunan. Saat ini dia mempunyai 2 buah kendaraan untuk mengangkut pasir yang diambil dari Karangasem (±60 km). Saat ini dia mempekerjakan 6 orang karyawan sebagai sopir maupun sebagai kuli angkut. Keuntungan yang didapat dipakai untuk biaya sekolah anak-anaknya.

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra A., age 38, is married and the mother of two. Her main business is selling 'pagne' cloth (colorful fabrics) and boubou (traditional clothing) in the Agoè district in Lomé. She is a traveling salesperson and sells from district to district, such that she travels 12 km per day on average.

She is a loyal client of WAGES and once obtained a loan that enabled her to increase her sales figures. After a prompt repayment of her first loan, she requesting a loan of 500,000 francs CFA to buy 35 pieces of traditional pagne cloth.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 38 ans, Madame A. Abra est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de pagne et de boubou dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle est une revendeuse ambulante et vend de quartier en quartier ce qui fait qu’elle parcourt en moyenne 12Km par jour.

Elle est un client fidèle de WAGES et a une fois obtenu du crédit qui lui a permis d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires. Après un prompt remboursement de son premier crédit, elle sollicite un crédit de 500.000FCFA pour acheter 35 pièces de pagnes traditionnels

loans.use: To bjy 35 pieces of traditional pagnes

loans.name: Mariame

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mariame S., is 54 years old and is divorced with 7 children. She plans to use this loan to strengthen her business of producing and selling artisanal soap in order to improve the lifestyle and health of her family. She plans to repay this loan after six months and in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Mme Mariame S., divorcée et a ayant 07 enfants à sa chargeest agée de 54 ans. Elle compte avec ce prêt renforcer son activité de production et de vente de savon artisanal afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. elle compte rembourser ce prêt au bout de six mois en une seule échéance .

loans.use: Production and sale of artisanal soap

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.ru:
Uguloy Q. lives in the city of Yavan. She is married and has 4 children. She has been in sales for the past 10 years. She sells children clothing and various national fabrics and shawls. She works on the Tidjorat market. Her business is successful, but most of the profit is spent on the family. She would like to increase the size of her store in order to bring in a larger variety of goods. This will allow her to attract new clients. Uguloy's business allows local inhabitants to purchase the needed goods without leaving the town. She will be able to achieve her goal of expending her business if she is given a loan for the duration of 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Курбонова Угулой проживает в городе Яван . Замужем , имеет четверых детей. Занимается торговлей. Уже 10 лет . Торгует детской одеждой и различными национальными ткакнями и платками. Работает на рынке «Тиджорат». Бизнес развивается успешно , новся прибыль уходит на содержание семьи. Теперь она хочет увеличить торговую точку для того . чтобы завезти различный ассортимент товара. Это позволит ей привлечь новых клиентов . Кроме того ее товар пользуется спросом , поэтому она помогает местным жителям приобретать необходимый товар , не выезжая за приделы кишлака. Все это она сможет реализовать только если она получит кредит сроком на 10 менсяцев.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Mrs. Lach Yen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people in Chrolong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province make up the village bank. Mrs. Lach Y. is the group leader and she is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. She is a 45-year-old widow with five children who are all attending the local school. Mrs. Lach Y.'s family now lives in poor conditions. In order to improve her standard of living, Mrs. Lach Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income with this new loan. 
All of the members have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main policy because they are most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
NOE C. M. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit.  Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

EL SEÑOR NOE ES UNA PERSONA DE MEDIANA EDAD PERO MUY RESPONSABLE CON GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE, SU ESPOSA LA SEÑORA MAYRA ES PENSIONADA, POR MEDIO DE ESTE PRESTAMO QUE SOLICITAN QUIEREN REALIZAR EL PROYECTO DE COLOCARLE VITROPISO A SU CASA; DE ESTE MODO LOGRARAN UNA MAYOR COMODIDAD PARA ELLOS Y SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Noe is a person of middle age but very responsible who looks forward to success. His wife, Ms Mayra, receives a pension. With this loan Noe and his wife want to install tile in their home. This will allow them to realize a greater comfort for themselves and their family.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile

loans.name: Nabeela Javed-Ul-Hassan Group

texts.en:
Nabeela baji is the wife of J. and lives in the city of Riwind, Pakistan. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 8 years. Nabeela baji is not educated because her parents could not afford the expense. She has no children. Nabeela baji’s husband is an electrician by profession. For the past 6 years, Nabeela baji has had a thread making business. She buys old and warm sweaters from old markets at cheap prices, removes the thread out of them and washes them for resale in the big markets. It is time intensive work.

Nabeela baji is applying for a loan to buy a thread making machine so that she will be able to make more thread and earn more profit. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rashidan baji is requesting a loan to buy warm sweaters to make thread to sell. Tanveer baji is requesting a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen baji is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy a thread making machine.

loans.name: Muoy Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Muoy Ly O. was born in 1976 and she lives in Kraing Bonteay Village in Takeo Province. Muoy is 32 years old, the mother of three children who are all attending the local school, and she breeds pigs. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for her business. Her husband, Mr. Tel Orn, is a traditional medical seller who can make a small income to support the family. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: Muoy would like to buy more piglets to breed for her business.

loans.name: Grupo Bolivia Group

texts.es: Grupo GRUPO BOLIVIA se integra mediante una asociacion D. comerciante que esta ubicada en pleno centro D. la ciudad D. La Paz, llamada  "Feria D. Boliva" por lo cual se creo el nombre del banco comunal, entre las socias existen diferentes tipos D. negocios como ser el D. la presidenta la señora Mirianh quien se dedica a la venta D. perfumes el resto D. los socios (as) se dedican al actividades como la venta D. ropa, calzados, cosmeticos, libros y computadoras. El mercado esta lleno D. personas que te ofrecen productos D. consumo pero ellas ofrecen calidad y variedad D. productos a bajos precios es por eso que no temem a la competencia. El destino del Crédito es para la compra D. mercadería y para la mejora D. sus puestos D. trabajo ya que el cliente exige mejores condiciones para atenderlo en mejores condiciones. Los socios (as) tiene experiencia en grupos solidarios por los trabjos en otras entidades financieras pero contando con muy buienos antecedentes crediticios la Fundación agrocapital les brina la oportuinidad D. mejoras su calidad D. vida y la D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The Bolivia Group was created through a merchant association located in the center of the city of La Paz called Feria D. Boliva (Market of Bolivia) which led to the name of the Village Bank. The group members participate in various types of businesses like that of the group president Miranh who sells perfume. The other group members work in such activities as the sales of clothing, shoes, cosmetics, books and computers. The market is full of people who offer consumable products but these women offer a variety of high quality products at low prices so they don't fear the competition. The purpose of this loan is to purchase merchandise and to improve their work stands since their customers demand to be attended in better conditions. The group members have experience in support groups since they have participated in other financial entities; since they have a good credit record, the Agrocapital Foundation offers them the opportunity to improve their and their families' quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kholmat

texts.en:
Kholmat N. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and five children. He has been breeding cattle for more than three years, and he is trying to improve the breed in order to increase his prices. He invests time and money in the feed and medicines that the animals require. He enjoys this work, especially getting milk from his cows, which he sells in local markets. Kholmat keeps going, thanks to the help and enthusiasm of his children and his wife, who helps him with caring for the animals. Now, Kholmat needs a loan of 2500 Somoni (US $725) to purchase more cattle to expand his business. With your help this will be possible.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets (including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to expand business

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Vân  năm nay 45 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có hai con đã trưởng thành. Năm 2003 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào công việc dệt chiếu và xưởng mộc của chồng. Hiện tại đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị với tổng thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 8.000.000d để đầu tư mua thêm gỗ phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất đồ mộc của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Vân is 45 years old. She has three children - two of which have grown up. In 2003, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed funds to invest in the business of weaving mats and into her husband's woodwork shop. Right now it is also the business that is the family's main source of income in the amount of 3,000,000 VND per month. This upcoming loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 8,000,000 VNd to buy more wood for her family's woodworking business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Matata

texts.en:
Matata J. is a micro-entrepreneur. He runs a loaf shop at Kisiwani in the Buguruni ward of Dar es Salaam. He purchases the business items wholesale from the bakery producers and sells retail to customers in his shop. He is sometimes supplied as an agent.

He has been in the business for six years. Income generated is used to meet his family's daily demand. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business stock.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
Dilshod H. is a hard working and determined man. From the time he was very young, he was characterized as an excellent student. He finished his studies, but with the difficult economic situation in the country, he could not find work at any company.

Dilshod decided to invest his small savings, to start his own business selling rice at the market. Now it is the sole source of income for his family, including his wife and four children.

Due to the high demand for his products, because of their excellent quality, size and flavor, Dilshod has decided to apply for a loan of $ 700 to buy more goods for selling. This will allow him to earn more and improve his living.

------------------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International. Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History... Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and its lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase rice to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en: Suzanne O. is a 23 year old mother of one child aged 3. She is married to a mechanic and runs her own salon. On good days, she will see as many as 20 customers, while other days (like the day before this interview), she will only see 5. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to expand her business and purchase items like hairdryers and chemicals. She heard about K-MET through a neighbor who started coming and says that she knows many people have been helped by both the health training as well as the Nutri-flour program that K-MET runs.

loans.use: To buy hairdryers and chemicals.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 50 years old and married with six children. She sells provisions both wholesale and retail to her customers. Esther hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell.

Esther is the leader of a lending group under LAPO microfinance. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Джумаева Фарогат – кредитор в Микроинвест с 2007 года. Она работает техничкой в областной больнице. Кроме своей работы она занимается продажей нижнего женского белья. Получив очередной кредит, она планирует съездить за товаром в Истаравшан на оптовый рынок. Фарогат смогла использовать кредиты, благодаря чему у неё расширился товарооборот. На снимке Фарогат  в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Farogat J. has been a loan customer of MicroInvest since 2007. She works as a cleaning woman at the regional hospital, and sells ladies lingerie on the side. Since she has received her next loan, she plans to make a buying trip to the wholesale market in Istaravshan. Thanks to the use of credit, Farogat has been able to increase her turnover. She is pictured on the day her loan was dispersed.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of ladies lingerie

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: El Sr. Dionicio M. M. Tiene la actividad de mecánico de reparación de chapas, bisagras y levanta vidrios de automóviles, el mismo solicito un créditos para la compra de herramientas nuevas para su taller que atiende por mas de 10 años en la zona el cual es el medio de sustento para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Dionicio M. M. is a mechanic that repairs the bodywork, hinges and windshields of automobiles. He solicits a loan for the purchase of new tools for his workshop which he has run for more than 10 years in his area. This is the primary means of income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purpose of the loan is to puchase new tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат - молодой мужчина 1977 года рождения. Женат и отец 2-х детей. Шухрат занимается производством лепешки а его жена продает их на рынке "Панчшанбе". В июне у нас отмечается большой праздник "День примирения" и закрываются все границы. Шухрат закупает муку у оптовиков в запас, чтобы застраховать себя, если завоз муки на время приостановится. У Шухрата есть свои постоянные клиенты, которые берут лепешки под реализацию и рассчитываются сразу после реализации. Шухрат кредитуется у нас с 2008 года. Он всегда целенаправленно использует свой займ. Шухрат очень благодарен нашей организации за поддержку малого бизнеса населения.
texts.en:
Born in 1977, Shuhrat is a young man, who is married and has 2 children. Shuhrat is involved in making flatbread, which his wife sells at the Panchshanbe market. In June, we will be celebrating a big holiday, called Day of Peace, and all the borders will be closed. Shuhrat buys flour from wholesalers for reserve, in order to insure his supply in case flour supply would temporarily stop. Shuhrat has loyal customers, who buy flatbread to resell and pay right after the sale. Shuhrat has been our client since 2008. He always uses his loans purposefully. Shuhrat is grateful to our organization for supporting small businesses.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour to make flatbread

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
La señora Tania, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Puerta”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y 01 niña, que aun depende de ella.

Lleva 04 años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar su taller de confección de vestidos y teniendo habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos, decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.
 Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.
Uno de sus sueños y meta por lograr, es implementar mas su taller de confección con maquinas industriales modernas.

En la actualidad continua con sus confecciones de ropas y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su taller para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Tania, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Tania belongs to the communal bank group "Virgen de la Puerta”, which meets in the Bellavista District of Bellavista Province, Department of San Martín. She is 33 years old and lives with her partner and 1 year old daughter.

She has been in business for 4 years. Little by little, she started generating an income and saving money. Since she knew how to sew, Tania did not hesitate opening her own tailoring shop. With the support of Manuela Ramos, she started her business in a good location where she could attend to her clients. When it comes to her sales, she works according to her customers’ orders. One of her goals is to expand her business by adding modern industrial machines.

She continues to design clothing and has many loyal customers who frequent her shop with their orders. Known as a kind-hearted person, Tania attends to each client personally.

With this loan of 3000 soles, she will buy various types of fabric, scissors, hand sewing needles, sewing machine needles, pins and buttons.

Today, Tania is a very accomplished woman who has the drive to realize her other dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her and other women start and grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, yarn and needles

loans.name: Ахрорходжа

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Ахрорходжа мужчина 23 лет, женат, имеет одного ребёнка. Он мастер по евроремонту квартир.  Его работа сезонная, поэтому он имеет постоянный дополнительный доход с бизнеса откорма и продажи скота. Для увеличения скота Ахрорходжа решил получить кредит в «Арванде». Его устараивают условия организации  и он скоро получит кредит

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Ayabavi Kafui

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et est mère de 04 enfants. Pour aider son mari à assurer la formation scolaire de leurs enfants, elle s’est lancée depuis 2001 dans la vente de produits génériques de toute sorte. Pour renouveler son stock de produits pharmaceutiques, elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES. Elle est très connue dans son quartier Akodessewa à Lomé.
texts.en:
This is a lady who is married and the mother of four children.  To help her husband ensure their children are educated, she got started selling all types of generic pharmaceutical products in 2001.  To renew her stock of pharmaceuticals, she's requesting a WAGES loan.  She is well-known in her district of Akodessewa in Lomé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina F. (0) is a 32 year-old woman living in the town of Leloto-Leauvaa.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, Christina is starting a business raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Christina has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately $100 tala WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Christina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Christina is now requesting a new loan of 1000 tala WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  This will be the 1st loan taken out by her from SPBD.  Christina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des engrais

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy U., 42, and her husband, Mr. Saroeun Vun, 45, live lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. They have two sons and two daughters. Two of them are garment factory workers and other two are in school. The couple has been married since 1988.

Mrs. Chanthy U. is a tailor. Her husband has been raising cows for 10 years. She doesn’t have her own transportation and she spends a lot of money for traveling costs very often. Therefore, she is requesting her second loan in the amount of US$ 500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Abdoul Haddi Boulkassoum

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoul Haddi Boulkassoum M. est un homme marié de 30 ans et père de 4 enfants qui vit avec son épouse et ses enfants chez lui même dans le  quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de  Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après des études coraniques au village natal, il s’intéressa à plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus telles faire le berger et l'éleveur toujours au village et cela  pendant plus de 5 ans. Afin d’élargir ses horizons il décide de venir s’installer en ville où il appris pendant quelques années, auprès d’un ami le commerce  d’achat et  de vente de chaussures. Avec une expérience de 5 ans dans cette activité, il maîtrise bien son activité et est très apprécié et sollicité.
Dans le souci de renforcer ses activités, il décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier  prêt qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter des chaussures,  à Bamako, Lomé et au Burkina Faso. 
Avec une clientèle  composée de toute la population locale, les fêtes religieuses et les fêtes de fin d’année constituent les périodes où il réalise beaucoup plus de ventes  généralement au comptant. 
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA  
Il ambitionne dans les années à venir ouvrir une boutique de vente de chaussures à Bougouni.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoul Haddi Boulkassoum M. is a 30 year old married man and father of 4 children who lives with his wife and his children in his own place in the Hérémakono Nord neighborhood of the town of Bougouni (in the third administrative region of the republic of Mali). After studying the Koran in his birth village, he became interested in several revenue generating activities such as being a shepherd and breeder. He remained in the same village for more than 5 years. In order to broaden his horizons he decided to come live in the town where he studied for a few years, near a friend, doing business buying and selling shoes. With 5 years of experience in this business, he runs his business well and is very appreciated and in demand. With the intention of strengthening his business, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his first loan that he intends to use to purchase shoes in Bamako, Lomé and Burkina Faso. With a clientele composed of all of the local population, religious celebrations and end of the year celebrations make up the periods when he makes many more sales, generally in cash. With this loan, he counts on making a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA . In the years to come he aspires to open a shoe store in Bougouni.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Rentsen

texts.en:
Rentsen B. is 19 years old, and she lives with her retired mother in Kharhorin, the capital city of the ancient Mongolian empire, which is where she has lived since she was born.

B. operates a jewelry-selling business in her town. She is a young entrepreneur; in fact, she just recently started her business this past July. More specifically, she sells a variety of jewelry, most of which are made of silver. She is working hard to grow and establish her business in her community; however, her product inventory is low, and she has little available capital to purchase new items to sell. B. considers herself a shy person by nature, but she works diligently to succeed with her business and to improve her business skills. She has a great deal of hope for her business' future. B. is requesting a loan in the amount of 500,000 tugrug (approximately $375 USD) to purchase wholesale silver items for resale purposes.

XacBank was founded in 2001 and listed its first Kiva loan in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but it also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale, and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the maturity of their loans. This practice not only allows borrowers to realize a financial gain, but also encourages them to save money.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing additional silver items

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
S. Shoira is 32 years old and lives with her husband and their four children. She works every day, starting very early in the morning, hoping to set aside enough money to improve her family's living conditions and to achieve her goal of having all four of her children successfully finish school and enter university.

Her business is located near her house. She sells children's clothes. Thanks to the support of her spouse and through her own efforts, Shoira has been able to expand her business, which began with very little inventory and in a small space, and which now has a bigger space and a larger clientele. With this loan in the amount of 4,000 Somoni, she will buy a greater variety of clothing for sale, specifically by adding women's clothing to her inventory. By offering a loan to his dedicated entrepreneur, you can be an important part of the growth of Shoira’s business.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To add women's clothing to her inventory in order to increase her range of goods for sale

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica sells secondhand clothes at retail prices to her customers. The demand for her secondhand clothes is high because there are people in her community that cannot afford new clothes. She hopes to own a boutique in the future.

Monica lives in Warri, Delta State. She is married with five children and she is 45 years old. She is a hardworking woman and with this business she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members.

Monica hopes for a loan of 170,000 NGN to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Benice

texts.en: Benice sells kerosene at retail prices to her customers. She is 33 years-old and married with a seven year-old child. Her husband is a policeman. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is an honest and faithful Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) client. Kiva partner LAPO is committed to improving lives in Africa, particularly in Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase kerosene.

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es:
Giovanna es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga.
Giovanna es soltera, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, es técnica en enfermería, Giovanna tiene una botica llamada Jhomar en un local alquilado, además vende artículos de regalo y de tocador, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Giovanna necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos.
Giovanna sueña con ampliar su botica y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Giovanna, 38, is a member of the Amauta Huamanga communal bank. She is single and has two children. She is a technical nurse and has a drug store called Jhomar in a rented locale. In addition, she sells gift and beauty items every day. Giovanna needs 2000 soles to buy medicines. Giovanna dreams with enlarging her drug store and building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicines.

loans.name: Eulalio Noel

texts.es:
El Sr. V. T. tiene un taller de electricidad automotriz en su casa de habitación, el va a ocupar este dinero en la compra de materiales que le hacen falta para su trabajo.

El quiere comprar una caja de herramientas que contenga copas de diferentes medidas y tamaños y de todo tipo de llaves, Su taller  comenzó de muy joven cuando él trabajaba con un señor, fue entonces donde él aprendió, lo que hoy en día le trae el sustento a su hogar. 

El espera con este crédito poder comprar todos los materiales necesarios para así poder hacer sus trabajos de una forma más rápida y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Señor V. T. has an automotive electrical shop in his home. He will use this money to purchase materials he needs for his work. He will buy a toolbox containing sockets of various measurements and sizes and with all types of wrenches. He started his shop very young when he worked for a gentleman, where he learned what now supports him. He hopes, with this loan, to be able to buy all the things necessary to do his work faster and be able to earn more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools for his work: 2 solder guns, a grindstone,  a set of wrenches

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 28-year-old single man. After graduating from university with a computer major, he opened a computer shop in 2005. He’s specialized in selling and repairing computers and his business has developed remarkably over the years.

Today, Mostafa needs to enlarge his business and he's asking to borrow $1,200 to buy a number of used computers at good prices. He will repair and sell them to make a good income.

loans.use: To buy a number of used computers

loans.name: Ismatillo

texts.en:
O. Ismatillo is a 56-year-old married man who lives with his daughter and owns a small farm. Ismatillo is a schoolteacher by profession and since he earns little, he also runs a business of raising and selling cattle. He has fifteen years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is profitable, Ismatillo has become a very successful businessman.

Ismatillo has a friendly family which is always trying to help one another. Thus, his wife and daughter help him with his cattle raising business. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning them, feeding and pasturing. 

Now Ismatillo wants to expand his business and buy more cattle, so he applied for a loan of $1500. He promises to repay the loan in time and thanks all lenders for their support. With your help Ismatillo can get ahead.  

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Alfredo Nicolas

texts.es: EL SEÑOR ALFREDO VIVE EN LA ZONA MARISCAL SANTA CRUZ, EL SEÑOR TUVO HACE UNOS AÑOS UN ACCIDENTE DONDE PERDIO UNO DE LOS OJOS TRABAJANDO EN UNA EMPRESA PRIVADA REALIZANDO LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD DE RECTIFICADOR DE MOTORES, AL VERSE PERJUDICADO EL SEÑOR DECIDIO ABRIR SU PROPIO TALLER, ES ASI QUE HACE SIETE AÑOS EL SEÑOR ES DUEÑO DE SU PROPIO NEGOCIO, EL TIENE MUY BUENA MANO DE OBRA EN SU TRABAJO ES POR ESO QUE LO BUSCAN DE DIFERENTES PARTES DE NUESTRA CIUDAD, ESTA CASADO Y TIENE HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, SU ESPOSA ES AMA DE CASA, POR ESTA RAZON EL SOLO MANTIENE EL HOGAR, EL DINERO DEL CREDITO LO UTILIZARA PARA LA COMPRA DE UN TORNO MECANICO PARA UTILIZAR EN SU TRABAJO, EL ESTA MUY ALEGRE DE TENER UNA TASA KIVA YA QUE LE INSENTIVA A PAGAR Y POSTERIORMENTE SEGUIR SACANDO OTRO CRÉDITO. ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA Y ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Alfredo lives in the Mariscal area of Santa Cruz. He had an accident two years ago and lost an eye while working in a private business repairing motors. After he was injured, he decided to open his own shop doing the same thing. He has had his own business for seven years. He has good workmanship and for that reason is sought out in different parts of our city. He is married with three small children. His wife is a homemaker, and he is the sole support for the family. The money from this loan will be used to purchase an engine lathe which he will use in his work. Alfredo is very happy to have a Kiva rate as it provides an incentive to pay and to later take out another loan. He is a responsible and hardworking person, and is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an engine lathe

loans.name: Matlyuba

texts.ru: Махмуродова Матлюба проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст, 38 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается тороговлей. У нее магазин, где она продает продукты питания. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Matlyuba M. lives in the Gissar district. She is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. She has a secondary education and is involved in retail sales. Matlyuba has a store, where she sells food products. She has been in this business for 6 years. She is requesting the loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Deysi Milagro

texts.es:
La señora Deysi Milagro C. tiene 39 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Efrain Velasquez quien labora como albañíl en la zona de San Lorenzo. Deysi tiene una niña que depende de ellos al 100%.
la señora C. trabaja en su pulperia en donde vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta familiar vende arroz, frescos, pollo,  carnes, queso, manteca, harina de maiz, etc.
utilizara el prestamo para la compra de abarroteria.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Deysi Milagro C. is 39 years old. She lives in a common law union with Efrain Velasquez who works as a bricklayer in the area of San Lorenzo. Deysi has a daughter who depends on them 100%. Sra. C. works in her convenience store where she offers all the common staple goods such as rice, soft drinks, chicken, meat, cheese, butter, corn flour, and the like. Sra. C. plans to use the loan to purchase store inventory; she needs the additional income to cover her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of convenience store inventory (bread, corn flour, cookies, soap, toothpaste, etc.)

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Mrs. C., 30, lives in the rural area of Phnom Penh city. Her husband operates a motorcycle sale trade, and they have three school-aged children. 

Mrs. C. earns a living as a farmer by planting rice and vegetable crops. In addition to her farming business, C. is also a rice trader who orders rice in bulk for her stock. Since Mrs. C. lacks capital, she is pursuing a loan in order to buy mature rice to store for a while and then sell to earn income.

loans.use: To buy rice.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Justina es soltera, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Justina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras. Además Justina viaja a Lima llevando quesos para comercializarlos.
Justina necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abarrotes.
El sueño de Justina son comprar una moto para que su hijo trabaje.
texts.en:
Justina, 33, is a member of the "Las Gaviotas" (The Seagulls) communal bank. She's single and has two children. Justina has a grocery store set up in her home where she sells general groceries and vegetables. In addition, she takes cheeses to Lima to sell. Justina needs a 1600 sol loan to buy groceries. Her dream is to buy a moto so that her son can work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Chhoeun N. is a 32-year-old farmer who lives in a commune located in Kampong Tom Province. She makes about $1 per day from selling vegetables that she grows. She also receives about $2.50 per day from her husband’s fishing.

This couple has given birth to three children, two of whom are students and one who is not enrolled in school, and all are dependent on them. Chhoeun N. requests a loan to purchase a boat for her husband to use to fish along the river.

loans.use: To purchase a boat.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra M. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Mahida-eton, Brgy. Sampinit, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fish vending business. Her husband, Juvelin M., who is 35 years old, works as a fisherman and a carpenter to earn his living. He also helps with his wife's business activities. They have a 3-year-old child. 

Myra joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Myra has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000 - increasing the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her fifth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000. With the loan, she intends to purchase a pump boat so that she can continue to save for their future and for their child to complete his education. Myra M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase a boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for labor expenses and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying four doors for her new house

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en: Orlando S. is from the town of Villa Rose, Cabarroguis, Quirino. He is 48 years old and is married with eight adult children. Orlando owns and operates a business making and selling charcoal. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.
