In 2010, Orlando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Orlando is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be his second from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Kol

texts.en:
Kol S. is 34 years old and is a resident of Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. She currently contributes to the family's food needs by working in the garment industry. She is married and has six children, four of whom are single and live in the family home.

To help support the family's living conditions, three of her single children are employed. Her husband used to work as a taxi driver but currently he works as a fisherman.

The family's living conditions are not so good because their house is often breaking down. Therefore, Kol S. would like to ask for a loan in order to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda M., 36, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Mauro M., a welder.  Erlinda is the mother of six children, two of whom are already working and settled down with their own families.  Another two are enrolled in college, one is in high school, and the youngest is in elementary school. By the grace of God, Erlinda has managed to support her older children's education up to the college level. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of her remaining children through college. Erlinda herself has been a college student and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Erlinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a bottle of shampoo, some cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at a wholesale price and selling them at a retail price.  Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She does a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a Php8,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Erlinda dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her busines. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship group to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Chheang's Group

texts.en:
Twenty four people make up this group located in Slab Ta Aon village, Kandal province. Chheang S., who was born in 1980, is a married woman and was selected as the village bank president.  Each member of the village will use their portion of the loan to support  their various business purposes.

Chheang S. earns her living as a beautician in the local village while her husband, Mr. Sreng Chamroeun, who was born in 1981, works as a construction worker. With B. of their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support the family. For her beautician business, Chheang S. will use the funding through AMK to buy more beautician supplies to support her business activities. 

This couple has two children, who are seven and four years old.

loans.use: To buy more beautician supplies to support her business activities.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne A. is a married lady with five children. Her husband is a self-employed electrician. Her business is located at Pipeline, in a residential area, and she is served by the Kitengela Branch. 

She owns a Salon that is well-known by the name Weavers Salon. Her target market is women and children (girls). She has been in this business for two years now. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are a lot of competing businesses in the area and  customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business going well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more hair treatments, oil and hair-dryers to meet customer demand. In the future, she hopes to grow her business by owning a big salon and opening a beauty college. She describes herself as hardworking, flexible and business-minded.

loans.use: to buy hair-dryers, hair treatment and oil.

loans.name: Look To We Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Look To We” group. They are small-scale businesspeople in Waterloo small town, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders in order to seek a loan of SLL 3,200,000 in order to boost their respective businesses. 

Isatu A. K. is the leader of this group. Isatu was born in Makeni city. She is married to a businessman and they have five children who are attending primary school. Isatu sells fertilizer and pepper seeds. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She will use her share of the loan to buy a large quantity of fertilizers, pepper, and “krain krain” seeds.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of fertilizers, pepper, and “krain krain” seeds

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 36-year-old married lady.  She is blessed with four children who are in school.  

For a living, she runs a grocery store.  This is her eighth year in the business.  She is a hardworking lady who hopes to venture into another business in the future.  

She has requested for 20, 000 KES to buy fingerlings as a way of diversification.   

She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy fingerlings for resale

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: B. Lawrence is an individual client from Kihihi. He is 49 years old and married with four children aged between three and thirteen. He is a salary earner and is requesting a loan to pay his children’s school fees since he cannot draw his salary to clear the school dues. Lawrence is also involved in agriculture – he grows food crops for sale on a small scale and he hopes to expand this further in future.

loans.use: To pay his children's school dues

loans.name: Welington Mauro

texts.es:
Welington Mauro T. V. tiene 32 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañera y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL BATAN se encuentra ubicada 90 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla esta conformado por 21 socios que se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Welington se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz desde hace mucho tiempo. Compra sus productos en el Cantón Bucay y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y dar mejor nivel de vida a su familia.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Welington Mauro T. V., 32, lives in a common law relationship with his partner and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has four children.

Members of the El Batan communal bank, located 90 minutes from the Chillanes office, which is part of Chillanes canton.  The bank has 21 members who are short cycle crop, like cocoa beans, manioc and maize, farmers.  They have been in this line of work for a long time.

Welington has been a cocoa bean, manioc and maize farmer for a long time.  He buys his products in Bucay canton and sells them in the Chillanes market.

He is asking for funds to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his cocoa bean crop.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  

His dream is to continue working to provide his family with a better standard of living.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: For farming supplies and fertilizers for cocoa bean crops.

loans.name: Yesu Ammala Kamwokya-Kampala Group

texts.en: 60 year old Tedora K. belongs to Yesu Ammala Kamwokya Group-Kampala. She has been running her rentals business in Kamwokya for 30 years. The rentals were constructed with savings from her retail enterprise transactions. Tedora says honesty and being steadfast and determined are all factors that have been momentous to her as she operates. Her retail shop is still in existence, but her focus is now on the rentals. Monthly, her profits are to the tune of 1,000,000 Shillings. Tedora is happily married with five kids and she says with this loan she is going to renovate her rental structures.

loans.use: To renovate her rental structures.

loans.name: Mrs. Nuon Som Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who are living in Prasat village, Takeo province, make up this village-bank loan. Mrs. Nuon S. is a village-bank president who has been selected by the other members, all of whom will use their portion of the loan for different purposes so that it can improve their families' lives. 

She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land in which to grow rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Bun Toeun Thai, is a driver who gets a low salary to support his family. Although they try to work a lot, they can only earn a little money. So to improve her family, Mrs. Nuon S. is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. 

She has seven children, one of whom is a driver, while two are employed in garment factories, three are students, and one does housework.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Antonia Monserrate

texts.es:
Antonia de 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora que siempre le ha gustado tener su propio dinero. Comenzó con su negocio para ayudar con los gastos familiares de su casa y ayudarla a su mama con los gastos del hogar. Poco a poco ha incrementado su lista de clientes a quienes les vende en su pequeño local almuerzos. 

Trabaja desde muy temprano haciendo la comida hasta las 14h30 cuando se le acaba los platos que preparo para vender. Hace diferentes comidas típicas del Ecuador. En los almuerzos que vende incluye sopa, segundo y jugo por un valor muy económico. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar con su comedor pero para ello quiere comprar con el préstamo víveres como arroz, legumbres, carnes para poder hacer mas comida.
texts.en:
Antonia, age 35, is a hardworking woman who has always enjoyed having her own money. She started a business so that she could help with her family’s household expenses and her mother’s expenses. Antonia gradually increased the number of customers to whom she sells lunches in her small restaurant.

She works from the early morning hours preparing food and then sells her dishes until 2:30pm. Antonio prepares traditional Ecuadorian dishes. The lunches she sells includes soup, a side dish, and juice for a very affordable price.

Antonia has many aspirations for her business. She wants to keep her diner in operation by using this loan to buy ingredients such as rice, beans, and meat for preparing more dishes.

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, and meat

loans.name: Reyna Luz

texts.es: La Sra. Reyna Luz N. ella es trabajadora activa del colegio Público “San Cristóbal”  San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene  Veinte años  de trabajar para esta institución como docente ,es casada actualmente tiene dos  hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  ocho créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna Luz N. is a hard-working woman who works as an elementary school teacher at San Cristobel School in San Rafael del Sur.  She has been working as a teacher in this school for twenty years.  She is married and has two school-age children.

Reyna Luz has had eight loans from CEPRODEL and has used each one to buy building supplies such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc. in order to extend and improve her home.  Ceprodel's loans have been very useful to her as they have enabled her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy gravel, cement, sand and blocks

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 38 years old and married to M. J. who operates a sweetmeat selling business. He operates his shop in the market and is well known for his good quality sweetmeat. Razia is a housewife who stays at home and does her housework. She takes her responsibilities very seriously and makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family. She is the mother of a son and two daughters. All of them study by attending a local school. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy required ingredients like milk, sugar, cooking oil and dry fruits etc to make good quantity sweetmeat. This will help him sell more and earn a better profit. 
Razia hopes that after this investment, her husband’s business will be in a more profitable position and it will result in a better financial condition for her family. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. She lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city in Punjab Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of Muhallah Rehmania for the past 10 years with her family in a two-room brick house.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for making sweetmeats

loans.name: Julito

texts.en: Julito P. is from the city of Santa Cruz, Tangub City. He is 36 years old and married. To make a living, Julito owns and operates a pedicab transport service. Julito has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Julito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julito has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Julito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Josimar Emilio

texts.es:
Josimar Emilio G. C. tiene 21 años, es soltero vive con los padres, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se reúnen en la ciudadela 24 de Mayto está ventanilla se dedica a actividades comerciales como la vetan de perfumes, ropa, bisutería y otros son comerciantes de carne.

Josimar se dedica a la comercialización a la compra y venta de carne de res, las compras las realiza en Santo Domingo y los vende todos los días en el local de su casa. 

Solicita el crédito para adquirir los productos y tener los productos en una tienda,  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y los precios altos. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Josimar Emilio G. C. is 21 years old, single, and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He doesn't have any children.

The 'ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA' community bank is located in Ventanas canton.  The members meet in '24 de Mayo' neighborhood.  They work in commercial activities such as selling perfumes, clothes and costume jewelry.  Others sell meat.

Josimar buys and sells beef.  He makes his purchases in Santo Domingo and makes his sales every day from his home.  He is requesting this loan to buy products and have them in a store.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his business such as competition and high prices.  His dream is to expand his business.

Josimar enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: to acquire products and have them in a store

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es: El sr. Porfirio vive en el municipio de el Torno, es nacido en el departamento de Cochabamba, capital Valluna de Bolivia, hace unos 23 años que se vino a la ciudad de santa cruz, su actividad principal es chofer propietario, es decir transporte de personas(taxi) en la ciudad, como segunda actividad se dedica a la cría de cerdos; su esposa con la cual tiene una hija es de ocupación enfermera, es cliente antiguo de la institución, por lo que se siente contento por el apoyo y agilidad del financiamiento, hace unos 30 años que se dedica a la actividad del transporte y 1 años a la cría de cerdos, con el dinero del crédito comprara cerdos para engordarlos y después ponerlos a la venta para su segunda actividad, es una persona muy responsable y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Porfirio lives in Torno municipality but is originally from the department of Cochabamba, the capital of the valley region in Bolivia. He came to Santa Cruz city 23 years ago. His main work is driving a private taxi in the city, but as a secondary business he raises pigs. Porfirio's wife, with who he has one daughter, is a nurse and also an old client of this microfinance institution. Porfirio is happy to have the support and flexibility offered by Emprender's financing. 

He has been working in transportation for 30 years and has been raising pigs for a year. With the loan funding, Porfirio will buy pigs to fatten and sell as supplemental income. He is a very responsible person and is grateful for the support provided by Emprender.

loans.use: To buy pigs for fattening (secondary business activity).

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old and single. He lives with three family members; two of them work.

In 2008, Ahmad opened a market selling all kind of food and vegetables. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1500 loan to rebuild and enlarge his shop. He is aiming to develop his work and to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To rebuild and enlarge his shop.

loans.name: Maria Sonia

texts.es:
La señora María Sonia V. Domínguez, vive en unión libre con el señor  Federico Pérez Gómez, con quien procreo dos hijas: María Fátima de cuatro años y Estefani  de tres años de edad, ella vive en un lugar llamado Ribera Morelia municipio de coapilla Chiapas.
     Ella es a segunda vez que solicita un préstamo y es para invertirlo en la compra de ropas, como son: para luego venderlo en las comunidades cercanas de su ribera, en esta actividad lleva pocos meses en donde  se siente contenta ya que le está yendo bien  en s pequeño negocio.
      Nos comenta que en  esta actividad se inspiro  ya que también quiere apoyar a su esposo con sus ingresos  de su hogar  y así también poder mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que para ella es muy importante  el bien estar de su familia.
      Lo que más desea en la vida es que su negocio crezca para independizarse sola, que con el tiempo sus hijas crecerán y desea apoyarlas en su educación para así sean personas con futuro.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Sonia V. Domínquez lives in a common law union with Mr. Federico Pérez Gómez and had two daughters with him: María Fátima, 4 and Estefani, 3. She lives in a place called Ribera Morelia in the Coapilla township, Chiapas.

This is the second time she’s requested a loan and it will be used to buy clothes to later sell in her adjacent communities.  She’s been doing this activity for a few months and is happy because she is doing well in her small business.

She comments that she was inspired to go into this business because she wants to help her husband with income for their home in order to also improve their quality of life because her family’s wellbeing is very important to her.

What she most wants in life is that her business grows so that she can be independent, that her daughters grow up and she wants to support their education so that they will become people with futures.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Segundo Marcelo

texts.es:
Segundo Marcelo tiene 35 años, es soltero vive con los padres en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. No Tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad El rayo, parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 25 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa se dedica a diferentes actividades como: agricultura, ganadería, comercio, crianza de animales, albañearía y aserradero.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, cebada, arveja, trigo. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para la agricultura. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es trabajar tener mas terreno para ampliar el negocio.

Le gusta ver televisión y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Segundo Marcelo, 35, is single living with his parents in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.  He has no children.

The NUCANCHI KAWSAY communal bank is located in the community of El Rayo, Guanujo Parish, Guaranda Canton 25 minutes from the Cooperative’s office.  The members are in a variety of occupations like: farming, cattle raising, commerce, small farm animal raising, bricklaying and saw mill.

Segundo farms corn, barley, peas and wheat.  Purchases take place in Guaranda’s market and sales happen at the wholesale market in that same city.

He is asking for the loan to buy supplies.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are insect infestations, diseases and weather variations.  His dream is to work and have more farmland to enlarge the business.

He likes to watch television and play sports.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sherbets, minutas and popsicles, as well as tires for his small cart.

loans.name: Vivena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vivena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Vivena is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fish net and other equipment for her fishing business.

Vivena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to earn and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fish net and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy different types of bags for her business

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina de 67 años, es la propietaria de un negocio de panadería, que  está ubicada en su vivienda. Maria inició su negocio desde hace más de 21 años, cuando su Mama se dedicaba anteriormente a esta actividad en el hogar y desde ese momento ha crecido, fue con el paso del tiempo que Maria decide hacerse cargo del establecimiento. Esta es la razón por la cual acude al crédito con el cual comprará de harina, huevo, mantequilla, leche entre otros. Su meta más adelante es tener un local propio para lograr una mejor comodidad en su hogar.
texts.en: Maria Cristina, 67, is the owner of a bakery located in her home. Maria started this business more than 21 years ago. Her mother used to do the same thing at home and it has grown from the moment it started. Over time, Maria decided to take charge of the business. For this reason she needs a loan to buy flour, eggs, butter, milk and other things. Her goal for the future is to have her own store space so that her home will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter and milk, among other things.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, age 33, earns a living by selling second-hand clothes. She has been operating her business for almost two years and she employs one person to assist her. She and her husband have two children, both enrolled in school. 
 
Catherine hopes to buy a piece of land in the future. She has requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes, bed sheets, and curtains to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy clothes, bed sheets, and curtains to offer for sale

loans.name: Celso Luis

texts.es:
Celso Luis tiene 42 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres e  hijos de 15 y 20 años en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

Celso se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.
 
Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla, abonos y fertilizantes. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es comprarse una finca.

Le gusta jugar vóley, además las fiestas como el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Celso Luis is 42 years old, single, and he lives with his parents and children, aged 15 and 20, in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar.

The communal bank "Nueve de Abril", meaning "April Nine" is located in the Parish of San Jose del Tambo, belonging to the canton of Chillanes. The members of this group are agriculturists who cultivate primarily corn and cocoa.

Celso cultivates corn and cocoa. He buys and sells his products in the market in San Jose del Tambo. 

He requests a loan to purchase seeds, manure and fertilizers. The loan will help him to supply his financial needs and to improve his agricultural activities. He faces challenges such as the drop in prices of the products which he sells, as well as middle-men. His dream is to purchase a plot of land. 

He enjoys playing volleyball and he likes to attend feasts such as Carnaval.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Uzma's Group

texts.en:
Uzma is married and her husband is a vegetable seller. He operates his shop in the community market and sells good quality fresh vegetables to his customers at reasonable rates. Uzma supports her husband financially by doing sewing work. She learned this art from her mother and now she earns a reasonably good income every month. This income helps her pay utility bills and the children's school fees. She is the mother of four children. Her eldest son is a butcher and sells chicken meat and the others are studying in a local school.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables that will allow him to make better profits. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past eight years. Uzma is confident about the positive growth of his business after the loan investment. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.
  
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Uzma.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal  vegetables to sell

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo de 44 años cuenta que su negocio de papelería, impresiones y fotocopiado, nació con la intención de poderse capacitar él y su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus tres hijos de 9 a 20 años de edad, para tener un mejor nivel de vida, independencia y utilizar sus habilidades y conocimientos de una manera productiva. Fue así como empezó estudiando una carrera a distancia a través del internet, compro su primer computador y posteriormente una impresora, donde se le facilitó imprimir módulos de estudio, copias para su familia y para la comunidad que requería de sus servicios dando curso a su altruismo innato; posteriormente lo convirtió en su negocio y decidió ampliarlo, iniciando contactos con personal de gestión humana en la universidad donde estudiaba virtualmente, así mismo empezó a ofrecer los módulos a sus compañeros de estudio, logrando hacerles una oferta más económica en su carrera universitaria. No satisfecho con esto se puso en contacto con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, a través de  su asesor para recibir asesoría y apoyo en crédito para ampliar su negocio de una forma organizada; comprar papelería en volumen, vitrinas, y otros accesorios con los que potencializaría su capacidad comercial y con este objetivo conseguir  en un futuro, que la universidad a distancia apruebe su publicidad en los medios virtuales y hacer realidad su sueño de crecimiento. 
Gerardo es un hombre muy disciplinado y activo, trabaja como empleado en un almacén de cadena, está estudiando a distancia y desde hace 5 años tiene el negocio descrito. En su negocio refleja estados financieros que muestran el buen manejo de su negocio, con resultados de liquidez pues no existe endeudamiento, así como  su rentabilidad expresa un valor positivo de acuerdo con el tipo de actividad que ejerce y sus ingresos son provenientes de dos fuentes importantes: de su negocio y de su trabajo como empleado de una empresa.
En la actualidad sus buenas relaciones con su entorno ha impresionado, generando la recomendación de la universidad en la cual estudia,  para que se vincule con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el fin de lograr capital para que amplíe su infraestructura, con la finalidad de darle un contrato de impresión de módulos por semestre para los estudiantes. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, pues necesita comprar papelería al por mayor y un computador para ampliar su infraestructura de acuerdo a los requerimientos  que hace la Universidad para lograr el contrato que Gerardo persigue
texts.en:
Gerardo is 44 years old. He is married and has 3 children that range in age from 9 to 20 years. He says that his stationary, printing and photocopying business arose from his desire to take care of himself and his family, have a better standard of living, independence and use his skills and knowledge in a productive fashion. That was how he began studying for a career remotely via the Internet, bought his first computer and then a printer, where he could print out study modules, copies for family and the community which needed his services and gave an outlet to his innate altruism. Later he made this into his business and decided to expand, making contact with the human resources staff of the university where he was studying online and began to offer the printed modules to his fellow students, making their college career cheaper. Not content with this, he contacted the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, via its advisor, in order to receive advice and economic support in expanding his business in an organised way, buying stationary in bulk, cabinets and other accessories with which to realize the potential capacity of his business and in the future achieve the goal of having the distance learning university adopt his online advertising and realize his dreams of growing his business.

Gerardo is a very disciplined and active man. He works in a chain store, studies by distance learning and has run the business described for 5 years. His business financial statements reflect his good management, liquidity, as there is no debt, and profitability expressed as a positive value as is normal with this type of business. His income comes from two major sources: his business and his job as a company employee. 

Today, his good relationship with his surroundings has impressed the university at which he studies and brought about their recommendation for him to join the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to obtain the capital to expand his infrastructure. The end goal is to obtain a contract to print modules every semester for the students. This is precisely the reason he is approaching credikiva as he needs to buy stationary in bulk and a computor to expand the infrastructure of his business in accordance with the university's requirements so that Gerardo gets the contract.

loans.use: to buy stationery in bulk and a computer to expand his infrastructure.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old, married and has six children who are in school.  

He runs a butchery to earn a living. He has been in the business for over 10 years and has employed one person. He does farming to earn extra income for his family. He hopes to grow his business for more income generation.

He has requested for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a bull for slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a bull for slaughter.

loans.name: Lilliette Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lilliette de 28 años de edad, originaria de Managua, pero vive en Estelí, es madre de dos hijos, ella es comerciante se dedica a vender ropa de vestir, ella estudio Administración de empresa. Inicio a los 25 años de edad, decidió crear su propio negocio así emplear los conocimientos adquiridos en la universidad, lleva tres años con este negocio del cual sobrevive ella y sus hijos.
Realizo el crédito para comprar inventario de ropa de diferentes estilos y medidas con el objetivo de ofrecer nuevos y variados  productos a sus clientes poder atraer a mas clientes, mejoras sus ventas pues unos de sus propósitos a realizar es poder poner otra tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Lilliette is 28 years old.  She is originally from Managua but lives in Estelí.  She is the mother of two children.  Lilliette sells clothes.  She studied Business Administration.  Lilliette started working at the age of 25.  She decided to create her own business so that she could use the knowledge she gained at University.  She has been in this business for three years and, through it, she supports herself and her children.

Lilliette requested this loan to buy inventory (clothes in different styles and sizes).  Her aim is to offer new and varied products to her customers so that she can attract more customers and improve her sales as one of her goals is to open another clothes store.

loans.use: to buy inventory (clothes in different styles and sizes) with the goal of offering new and varied products to her customers

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, single and lives with four family members. One of them works.

Mohamad has been an owner of a toy shop since 2008, selling all types of toys and games such as learning toys, riding toys, bikes and gifts. He has more than three years' experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting $2400 in order to renovate and redecorate his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and redecorate his shop.

loans.name: Astamaya

texts.en:
Astamaya is 50 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 25 and 20.  In 2001, she established her furniture making business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy wood and lumber.  In the future, Astamaya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way.  Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture.  With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames and cabinet sets.  With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor.  This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buy wood and lumber.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: César de 49 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos, pero por problemas con su pareja, se separaron. Ahora él vive solo, en una casa propia en el distrito de San Pedro de Cajas. A pesar de los problemas familiares, César sigue con trabajo, que es la artesanía, en distintas modalidades por ejemplo confecciona: alfombras de piso, ruanas de alpaca; además hace decorados y manualidades. Para elaborar sus textiles, cuenta con 6 telares de distintos tamaños. “Este negocio es muy rentable por que para elaborar las ruanas invierto 48 dólares por kilo de lana de alpaca y por kilo obtengo 4 ruanas, las que vendo a 160 soles cada una”, detalla. Además de utilizar lana de alpaca emplea las de ovejas y sintéticas, pero no tienen mucha demanda. Paralelamente a ese oficio, fabrica fuegos artificiales, cohetes, castillones, bombardas, etc., los que vende como precio mínimo a 1000 soles, “gano muy bien, pero tiene sus riesgos, sino se sabe calcular bien la cantidad de químicos puede producirse un incendio y explosiones”, cuenta César. Kenyi su hijo de 13 años siempre va a visitarlo, él es el que el ayuda en sus labores, por esa razón, César anhela tener otro negocio de cerámicas y locerías para brindarles a sus hijos menores una mejor educación. Mediante su ayuda, César podrá adquirir por primera vez un crédito de MFP, por su parte se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. César agradece de antemano el apoyo. Una de sus metas es abrir una tienda de cerámicas y locería, para ello comprará mercaderías de la ciudad de Huancayo y las venderá a los turistas que visiten su zona. Además invertirá en la compra de lana de alpaca y algunos insumos para elaborar castillones.
texts.en: César is 49 years old and has 7 children, however due to problems with his partner they separated. He now lives alone in his own house in the district of San Pedro de Cajas. Inspite of his family problems, Cesar continues to work as a craftsman, in different mediums. For example he makes: floor mats, alpaca ponchos as well as decorations and handicrafts. To make his textiles he needs 6 different looms of differing sizes. "This business is very profitable because to make the ponchos I invest $48 per kilo of alpaca wool and produce 4 ponchos per kilo. I sell them as 160 soles each," he says. In addition to using alpaca wool he also uses sheep's wool and synthetic wool, but they are not in high demand. Parallel to this work, he makes fireworks: rockets, skyrockets and roman candles, etc., which he sells at a minimum price of 1000 soles, " I earn very well but it has its risks as if you don't know how to calculate precisely the amount of chemicals needed you can cause a fire and explosions," says Cesar. Kenyi, his 13 year old son, always comes to visit him. He is the one that helps him with his work, for this reason, Cesar yearns to have another business selling ceramics and china to give his younger children a better education. With your help, Cesar will be able to get a loan with MFP for the first time. In turn, he agrees to be punctual with his repayments. Cesar is grateful in advance for the support. One of his goals is to open a ceramics and china shop and for it he will buy merchandise from the city of Huancayo and he will sell it to the tourists who visit his area. In addition he will invest in the purchase of alpaca wool and a few consumables with which to make his fireworks.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool and also handcrafted objects.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is living with his parents in the village of Turod Norte, Cordon. He is 33 years old and still single. He has run and managed the family's rice fields for almost ten years with his patience and dedication to improving his rice farming business. He is requesting for a loan amounting to PHP 35,000, allowing him to purchase some farm supplies needed to improve his agricultural business. This loan would really help him in making his rice production more profitable.

Ernesto hopes that his yield for next crop season will increase so that he could provide for his family's needs. He believes that he could be a successful farmer someday, though he is facing some hardships in maintaining his rice field.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies needed to improve his agricultural business

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson has been in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the past 11 years. He is 28 years old, married to Anastacia and they have one child. Besides his motorcycle business, Wilson also has quarry from where he extracts stones for construction.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy another quarry since there is a high demand for building material due to the rising growth rate of Naivasha town and its environs. This has seen many investors establishing huge businesses like shopping malls and tourist hotels. 

In the future, Wilson hopes to establish a stable mining factory and become a renowned construction and building entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy another quarry

loans.name: Colete

texts.en: Colete is 22 years old with two children aged 6 months and 4 years. She is married to a motorcycle taxi driver. She owns a general store, which she has run for 1 year. Colete would like a loan to buy sugar, salt, soap, and other goods to sell in her shop. Any profits will be used to provide for her family. She dreams of running a big and prosperous store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Geralyn is married with 5 children. She is 37 years old and has 2 children who are in school. 

Geralyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Geralyn has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy bamboo, binders, and fishing nets.

Geralyn has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, binders, and fishing nets.

loans.name: Rosa Narciza

texts.es:
Rosa Narcisa  tiene 50 años de edad, ella vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente.

En su tiempo libre disfruta de leer;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que le gusta mucho son los “Tallarines Rojos”. Rosa estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar  secretariado. Ella es casada, su esposo también trabaja muy duro para salir adelante, el trabaja  transportando  algas marinas, Rosa nos dice que él es su brazo derecho y aunque  algunos días no están juntos debido al trabajo de su esposo ellos siempre están unidos y se apoyan en todo, juntos tienen 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden entre 24 y 19 años a los cuales con esfuerzo y sacrifico están sacando adelante ya que se encuentran en la universidad.	

Rosa se dedica al venta de bebidas (gaseosas, agua, etc.),  se dedica a este trabajo 6 horas diarias, su padre la animo a tener esta clase de negocio. En un día Rosa puede atender  alrededor de  15 a 20 clientes diariamente y esto le permite ganar hasta S/. 90 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar  hasta S/.660  lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales para los gastos del hogar  y para  invertir en el negocio, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio debido al  buen trato que tiene con sus clientes y por el carisma que tiene.

Esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio, esta mejora podrá ayudarle a tener  más variedad de productos para ofrecer y con ello  tener mejores ingresos y así poder en algunos meses  ahorrar para poder cumplir  su gran sueño: “Tener una Bodega".
texts.en:
Rosa Narcisa is 50 years old. She lives in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, around four hours south of Lima, the country's capital. Ica is celebrated by Peruvians as "La Tierra del Sol" ["The Land of the Sun"]. It is also known for its frequent earthquakes (8.0 in 2007 and 6.9 in 2011), its production of grapes, asparagus and olives, and perhaps above all, as the source of the traditional national beverage of Peru: pisco. The borrower's home and business are located in this hot and arid place. 

In her free time, she likes to read. As is well known, Peru is noted for having the most delicious food in the world, and one of the dishes that Rosa likes a lot is "Tallarines Rojos” ["Red Noodles"]. Rosa attended school up to the fifth year of secondary school. She would have liked to study to become a secretary. She is married, and her husband also works very hard to get ahead. He works transporting marine plants. Rosa reports that he is her "right arm," and although some days they are not together due to her husband's work, they are always united and support each other in everything. Together they have 2 children, aged 24 and 19, whom they are helping to get ahead with great effort and sacrifice: both are studying at the university. 

Rosa works selling beverages (soft drinks, water, etc.). She dedicates herself to this work for 6 hours each day. Her father inspired her to go into this type of business. In one day, Rosa can serve approximately 15 to 20 customers, and this allows her to earn some 90 Peruvian soles per day; on a good day she can earn up to 660 soles. This helps her take care of some extra household expenses and also invest in her business. She believes that her business is going well for her thanks to the good treatment she gives her customers as well as her friendly personality. 

She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since with the help provided to her she will be able to buy merchandise for her business. This improvement will help her offer a greater variety of products and earn a better income. Thus, in a few months, she will be able to save up enough to fulfill her great dream: opening her own store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is aged 27 and has been in farming for five years, producing eggs, onions and carrots going to the local market in her home area of Kitale, Western Kenya where she does her farming. She also operates a grocery business in the market to add to her farming income.

Esther has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the venture will provide her family  with milk for daily consumption as well as earn income from the sales to provide other basic needs. She hopes to improve her farming too with the income from the dairy business.

Esther says animal diseases remain the major threat to their businesses.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Benito's Group

texts.en:
Benito, Dagoberto and Policarpio live in Cerro Niño, a community that is 3 hours by a dusty road away from the nearest commercial center (where this picture was taken). All of the 30+ households in this community are too far away from the grid to get electric service and depend on ocote pine for lighting and activities. Ocote sends out polluting smoke and provides poor lighting, besides being a health, security and environmental hazard due to smoke emissions and deforestation. 

Dagoberto is 58 years old and his wife is very excited on acquiring a solar home system and providing their three children with an inadequate environment for studying in their home. Dagoberto works in the field, mainly with sugar cane. He processes the sugar cane by grinding it and sells the liquid sugar in the near commercial center. He processes it with a yoke and cattle, and Dagoberto mentioned the best time to do this is 3-5 a.m. because working the cattle during the day causes exhaustion in the animals due to the heat. It is very common to have to work during the night in the summer and with poor lighting that ocote pine gives, many community members have had accidents. He is very excited on acquiring a solar home system to be able to work with quality lighting to process the sugar cane, and his wife believes it will improve conditions for their kids to study, and commented on the importance of reducing the smoke caused by his current lighting sources.

loans.use: Benito, Dagoberto and Policarpio acquire a solar home system to increase their working hours and stop depending on ocote-pine for lighting.

location.town: Cerro Cuero, Santos Reyes Nopala, Oaxaca

loans.name: Abdul’S Group

texts.en:
Abdul is a farmer by occupation and resident of Lung village in district Gujranwala in, Pakistan. He lives in a semi constructed house along with his wife and children. 

Abdul and his group members have a small land holding in the vicinity of Lung village. They grow rice and wheat in their fields but their yield per acre remained very low in previous years. They therefore, consulted agriculture experts who recommended laser leveling of their fields and cultivation of recommended varieties of rice crop to maximize the yield. 

Unfortunately the group members do not have the money to afford the necessary upgrades; therefore, they are eagerly looking for a loan to finance their required developments.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel etc.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Melanie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana has a small restaurant that she runs out of her home. She has had about 8 years of experience in the restaurant business. She started this operation off by just selling chicken and chicken wings. She has made it into a full fledged restaurant during the weekends, but because of capital restrictions cannot sell during the week. She has also made space in her home to be able to seat people, but she is also in need of tables and chairs for the business. She hopes that the loan will help her overcome these barriers and continue to develop her business. She has five children, only two of which still live at home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy more tables, chairs and food

texts.en: H. K. is a 47 year-old married woman. All her children are married and live separately from her. However, one of her children helps her to run the grocery store everyday. She sells household goods which she buys from the Sepatan market. She wants to use the loan to buy more goods.

loans.use: Buy goods to expand her business

loans.name: Alice Imanyala

texts.en:
Alice sells silver fish, dried Tilapia fish, and green vegetables. She started her business in the year 2003. She operates her business at her community’s local trading centre.

Alice is an active member of her local church’s women's group which deals with poverty eradication. Through her business, she has been able to assist her husband in educating their children, providing for other needs, and bringing services to the community.

With a loan from PEMCI, Alice plans to increase her maize stock and also purchase beans during this coming harvesting season.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
A mother of three, Roseline P. manages a small grocery store out of her home in Trou-Du-Nord, Haiti. Through her business, she supports her husband’s income by providing essential products to her community, such as canned goods, sugar, eggs, and locally grown vegetables. With this first loan, she will expand her current inventory to better serve her neighbors.

Note: Roseline is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Expand her inventory with essential grocery items

loans.name: Uliya

texts.en:
Uliya owns a small clothing sales business at an outdoor market in Pavlograd, central Ukraine. Uliya is an experienced entrepreneur, having own her business for 10 years. She tries to maintain a good selection of clothing in her kiosk that would be in demand by passing shoppers. Uliya’s business is a large source of income for her, her husband, Victor, and their 16 year old son. She  makes  $700 profit in a typical month which is a good middle class income for Ukraine.

Uliya has requested a loan of $1200 to purchase new inventory of 50 men’s coats before the upcoming cold season. We are happy for this opportunity to continue assisting Uliya as she works to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase men’s coats

loans.name: Ni Putu Puri

texts.id:
Most women in the village own Pig farming business. So is Ni Putu Puri who chose to raise pigs as main family income, besides husband's income as construction worker. Ni Putu Puri bought 2 fattening piglets with a loan from Dinari for Rp2,000,000 (about US$220). Ni Putu Puri bought 2 fattening piglets for Rp500,000 (about US$55); the rest for feed capital. Every day Ni Putu Puri started work at 8:00 AM. First Ni Putu Puri cleans the stall then feeding. Ni Putu Puri fed 2X/day. Sometimes Ni Putu Puri add greeneries as additional feed. Until harvest, Ni Putu Puri spent Rp1,500,000 (about US$165) for feed for 6 months. Bruto income received about Rp2,600,000 (about US$290). So nett profit received by Ni Putu Puri is Rp600,000 (about US$66). With that profit she could help to pay for household expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ibu-ibu yang hidup di pedesaan sebagaian besar memiliki usaha beternak babi. Begitu juga dengan Ni Putu Puri yang memilih usaha beternak babi sebagai mata pencaharian keluarga yang utama disamping pendapatan yang diperoleh suaminya sebagai seorang buruh bangunan. Ni Putu Puri memiliki 2 ekor penggemukan yang dibelinya dari uang yang dipinjam dari Dinari sebesar Rp.2.000.000,-. Ni Putu Puri membeli 2 bibit babi dengan harga Rp.500,000,-. Sisanya untuk modal pakan. Setiap hari Ni Putu Puri memulai pekerjaannya mulai jam 8.00 pagi. Pertama-tama yang dilakukan oleh Ni Putu Puri membersihkan kandang setelah itu baru memberi makan Putu Puri memberi makan 2 kali perhari. Untuk selingannya Ni Putu Puri memberi hijauan sebagai makanan tambahan. Sampai panen Putu Puri menghabiskan modal pakan Rp.1.500.000,- selama 6 bulan. Penghasilan kotor yang diterima Rp.2.600.000,-. Jadi keuntungan bersih yang diterima Ni Putu Puri Rp. 600.000,-Dengan keuntungan ini bisa dipergunakan untuk membantu semua pengeluaran rumah tangganya.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan

loans.name: Gladys Fredesvinda

texts.es:
Gladys Fredesvinda lives in Urbanización Libertad in the city of Trujillo, in the province of Trujillo, in La Libertad. She is 50-years-old, she finished high school, and she has 3 children who still depend on her. Since her husband rents a car to offer taxi services and his income is minimal, she saw the need to work to help with the family expenses. This is why she started a business selling beer with money her sister lent her. Later, through the invitation of a neighbor, she joined the interim group, Cielo (Sky), where she received her first loan of 300 nuevos soles. With this money, she bought 5 boxes of beer to increase her sales. She saved her resources and little by little purchased baby clothing to sell on credit to people she knew.

With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy clothing for babies and children because she already has several orders for the holidays. Gladys dreams about having a store in a large mall in the city and also in seeing her daughters become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Gladys Fredesvinda vive en la Urbanización Libertad D. la ciudad D. Trujillo, Provincia D. Trujillo, Departamento D. La Libertad. Tiene 50 años D. edad , estudió secundaria completa y tiene 3 hijos que aun dependen D. ella. Debido a que su esposo alquila un auto para brindar servicio D. taxi y su ingreso es mínimo se vio en la obligación D. trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. D. esa manera inicia un negocio vendiendo cerveza con un dinero que le prestó su hermana. Posteriormente, por invitación D. una vecina, ingresa al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Cielo” donD. recibió su primer préstamo D. S/.300.00, con este dinero compró 5 cajas D. cerveza para incrementar las ventas. Fue ahorrando sus utilidades y poco a poco iba comprando ropa D. bebé para vender al crédito a algunas personas conocidas . Con este préstamo D. S/.500.00, el cual pagará en cuatro meses, comprará ropa para bebés y niños porque tiene varios pedidos para estas fiestas D. fin D. año.

La señora Gladys sueña con tener una tienda en un centro comercial granD. D. la ciudad y también con ver a sus hijas profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for babies and children

loans.name: Lily's Group

texts.en:
Yorina, Maribel, and Lily are members of the community bank Musuq Wasi, which means "new house" in Quechua. They live in the Santo Domingo neighborhood and belong to the Jesus Nazareno district within the city of Ayacucho. In their community bank they have learned to be punctual and responsible, to save, how to educate their children, and about good nutrition.

Yorina is 22 years old. She has run a small grocery store for the past three years; little by little she has been able to add more products. On the other hand Maribel is 27. She is married and has four children. Maribel raises guinea pigs, which are considered a delicacy. In addition she grows carrots, spinach, and lettuce, which she sells in Ayacucho. She started raising cuy six months ago and now sells them to different restaurants in the region. Lily is 28 years old and lives with her partner and two children. Lily also grows vegetables and raises cuys. She started raising cuys one year ago with only three and now has 180 which she sells in the city of Ayacucho.

Yorina, Maribel, and Lily need loans of 600, 750, and 300 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying sugar, rice, cookies, chocolate, candies, medicines, seeds, fertilizer, and food for the cuys. They plan to use their savings to build a house and add capital to their business. Their dreams are to own a home, that their children receive good educations, and that their businesses continue to grow.

loans.use: Yorina, Maribel, and Lily need loans of 600, 750, and 300 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying sugar, rice, cookies, chocolate, candies, medicines, seeds, fertilizer, and food for the cuys.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.en:
Huseyn is a 33 year-old, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. There, he settled in the Fizuli region, in the Kayidish village, a village which is built for IDPs.

This man is married and has one child. He has now run this business for the past five years. Now, this man needs a loan of $850 to buy a calf in order to help improve his cattle breeding.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita T. C. runs a general store in the town of Picota, San Martin. At the store, which is in an excellent location, she sells goods of primary need. Rosita's clients are happy that they do not need to travel across the town to the main market to buy goods.  

Rosita is 38 years old, married and has two children. She started the business 3 years ago, because she wanted to help her family and gain some independence. Now she can save money for her children’s education and give them more opportunities in life than she has had.

A member of Manuela Ramos and the community bank Los Claveles, Rosita is requesting a loan of s/ 1700 to be repaid over 6 months. With the help of the extra money, she will buy oil, sugar, and rice.

loans.use: Purchase of oil, sugar, and rice for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is twenty-five years old and an unmarried young woman. She has been selling grocery products, such as spices, vegetable oils, palm oils, pastas, peanuts batter, and rice, for the past six years.

She wants to use her loan to buy more groceries. She wants to use proceed from her operation to expand the store, because it is currently small.

Ruth is a member of the "Our Helper" group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru:
Jurabek H. lives in Shahrinav. He is 36 and is married with 2 children. He owns a truck and works as a truck driver. He has been a truck driver for 10 years. Currently, his truck is in need of repairs and Jurabek needs money to pay for the repairs. Jurabek’s job as a truck driver is the only source of income for his family. It also allows local people to use his services at an affordable price. He plans to repay his loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Халимов Джурабек проживает в Шахринау. Возраст 36 лет, женат и имеет 2 детей. Работает водителем грузового такси. Имеет грузовой автомобиль.Работает уже 10 лет. Произошла поломка ходовой части и теперь ему необходимо его отремонтировать. На это ему нужно получить кредит. Его деятельность является единственным источником дохода его семьи, а так же помогает населению пользоваться данными услугами в своей местности по доступным ценам. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purhcase spare parts for his truck and pay for repairs

loans.name: Silvia Carolina

texts.es:
Silvia learned to raise chickens by observing her parents and she decided to start her own business. An entrepreneurial woman, she began with two small chickens two years ago. Currently, she has more than 40 chickens; however, now she wishes to purchase turkeys in order to fatten them so that they will weigh more and their selling price will be greater than that of chicken. Currently, Silvia is pregnant. Her child is the reason why she is more motivated than ever to raise not only chickens but also turkeys. In this manner, she will have better income and provide a better quality of life for her child.

She needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay in three months, in order to purchase turkeys and begin to fatten them since, in five months, her town's festivities begin as will demand. With your help, Silvia will grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia aprendió a criar pollos observando a sus padres y decidió empezar su propio negocio, ella que es una mujer emprendedora comenzó con dos pollitos hace ya 2 años, en la actualidad ya son mas de 40 los pollos que tiene pero desea ahora comprar pavitos para engordarlos, pesan mas y su costo de venta es mayor a la del pollo. Actualmente Silvia esta embrazada, espera a su primer hijo razon por la cual esta mas motivada que nunca de ademas de la crianza de pollo añadir la de pavo, para asi tenr mejores ingresos y darle mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar pavos y empezar a engordarlos porque en 5 meses inician las festividades del pueblo donde aumenta la demanda. con tu ayuda silvia hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase turkeys.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is married and has six children. Two of them are in school. Georgina earns income selling maize, beans and gari (grains of cassava) in the local market to support her family. She has been involved in this business for five years and now wants to expand her operations and sell larger quantities of goods to other traders. Georgina therefore needs a loan to increase her inventory of different grains and thereby avoid price hikes in off-season. She is a member of the group called Gospel Light whose members agree to provide a guarantee for each other to repay their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of gari, maize, beans, etc.

loans.name: Mirjana

texts.en: Mirjana is a young woman from the town of Derventa.  She is waitress at a local coffee shop, and can earn around 500 KM (375$) per month.  She recently began a hobby which she is ready to turn into a profitable business.  Mirjana has started to do ikebana, the Japanese art of flower arrangement, and wants to sell the arrangements she makes to people to use for weddings and other events.  She is requesting a loan of 600KM to get her business started.  Her salary right now is too small, so Mirjana wants earn some extra money and thinks that this business will offer a good future for her.

loans.use: To buy materials for making Japanese flower arrangements

loans.name: Jasminka

texts.en:
Jasminka‡ is 54 years old and she is from Lukavac. She is married and her husband is employed. Her husband helps her with paying for household expenses and school for their daughter. He earns 680 KM a month. Jasminka sells milk and milk products and in this way she earn about 150 KM monthly.

This is her first loan with Women for Women International in the amount of 600 KM. She will use this loan to buy a calf for reselling. She has her own food for cattle, which she produces in her field. Her wish is to buy more cattle for reselling.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es:
Brenda es soltera y no tiene hijos vive con sus papas, pero ella quedo desempleada y necesitaba tener alguna actividad para mantenerse, desde hace dos años empezó vendiendo ropa con sus familiares, poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo. y ahora tambien vende bisutería como complemento ara su actividad.

Ella necsita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia. Con tu apoyo ella saldra adelante.
texts.en:
Brenda is single with no children and lives with her parents. When she was unemployed a couple of years ago and needed to find work, she began selling clothing with relatives. Little by little, she's built a growing business. She now sells costume jewelry to complement her clothing business.

Brenda needs a US$300 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise. With your help, she can lift herself up.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Yasmeen Liaqat Ali Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji is the widow of L. A. and lives in the city of Riwind, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 16 years. She is the mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. Her eldest son is a transit driver and operates an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Her other children are all enrolled in the local neighborhood school.

Yasmeen baji works selling thread. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She buys inexpensive sweaters and removes the thread from them. Then she washes the thread, bundles it, and sells it to different shops for a profit. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothing so that she may expand her thread selling business.

This is a group loan, and the funds will be distributed among group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. She is joined by three other members: Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy cooking oil and spices for her food business; Naziran baji also wants a loan to buy sweaters for her thread business; and Majidan baji wants a loan to buy wood cutting tools for her wood selling business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothing to turn into thread sales

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat M., 29, the mother of three young children, all in school, raises pigs and distills Khmer wine in her home in Srolav Commune, Kompong Tom Province. Currently earning approximately $4 each day, Sinat is married to Mr. Neang Noeun, age 33, a motorcycle and horse cart taxi driver making about $5 per day.

In order to increase family income, Sinat is applying for a $1,000 loan to buy rice to store for later sale and to purchase two oxen.

loans.use: To buy rice to store for later sale.

loans.name: Mrs. Sonleng Hon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which is located in O’Kandol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, consists of 14 people and they will use the loan in different purposes. Mrs. Soleng H. was selected by the group to be the village bank president. She sells pots in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Seng S., is a construction worker who makes a small income to support the family. Although they try to work hard, they don't earn enough income to provide better living conditions for their family. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Soleng H. decided to ask for a loan, to add to her savings, to build a new house for her family. Mrs. Soleng H. is 30 years old and the mother of three children who all attend the local school. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Twelve members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma D., married with 5 children, lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She and her husband run a bakery and store. She has three married children who all attended school and are employed. She has two more children, both in high school, who help her at her bakery. The couple is trying to sustain and expand their bakery and store. In 1989 when she started her business it was small, but it has grown since in large part due to its location in the corner of the market. Their business profits are used to pay for the education of their two youngest children. Thelma is requesting 15,000 PHP to invest more in their store, especially for sari-sari store. She hopes that eventually her bakery will be large enough to be a local distributor of baked goods.

loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store in support to her bakeshop

loans.name: Henry Norberto

texts.es: El joven Henry tiene 23 años de edad, reside en Hilaleah  en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 2, y 4 años de edad, ella es ama de casa ya que todavía sus niños están pequeño para irse a atrabajar pero sus planes es ayudar a su esposo económicamente ya que todo esta caro, Henry se desempeña de electricista desde hace dos años, el cual inicio como conductor, y espera seguir superando ya que sus metas es poder seguir estudiando para poder dar mejor nivel de vida a su familia esta solicitud de crédito la quiere para invertir en materiales de construcción para hacer la cocina de su casa para estar un poco con mas espacio. Para esto va a comprar materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro entre otros. Le da gracias a Afodenic por el apoyo que le ha brindado para poder terminar de hacer su casa.
texts.en:
Henry is 23 years old, and lives in Hilaleah in the capital of Managua, his wife has two children, 2 and 4 years old,a nd she is a housewife since their children are still young to go to work, but her plan is to help her husband economically now that everything is expensive. Henry works as an electrician, and has for two years, which he started as a conductor, and hopes to continue improving now that his means are sufficient to continue studying to be able to provide a better level of life to his family. He wants this loan to invest in construction materials to build a kitchen in his house to have a little more space. For this he is going to buy construction materials like stone, sand, cement, iron and others. He thanks Afodenic for the support now that he has been able to finish making his house.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a kitchen

loans.name: Felipe Norberto

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Felipe C. se ha destacado como productor agropecuario desde su juventud y hoy en día ha alcanzado vasta experiencia la cual le ha servido de mucho beneficio porque por medio de esta actividad mantiene su núcleo familiar.
Hoy en día el señor Felipe ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de ganado para su desarrollo ya que requiere adquirirlos para sacarle su provecho y de esta forma continuar manteniendo su hogar compuesto por sus tres pequeños hijos que tanto requieren del apoyo de su padre.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega, Mr. Felipe C. has stood out as an excellent farmer since he was young. He now has extensive experience in this field, which has been of great benefit for him because this is how he supports his family.

He now turns to Ceprodel to request a loan that will permit him to purchase livestock so that he can keep supporting his three children who really need their father’s assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Qiyomiddin

texts.ru: Абишев Киемиддин житель города Яван. Возраст 23 года. Еще не женат. Уже три года занимается бизнесом. Открыл точку обслуживания клиентов по продаже пластиковых карт и денежных переводов за мобильную связь. обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы закупить карты различных провайдеров. Это даст возможность увеличить ассортимент  и соответсвенно доход. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Qiyomiddin A. lives in Yavan. He is 23 years old and is not yet married. He has been a businessman for 3 years. Qiyomiddin opened a sales location that sells plastic cards and money transfers for mobile phones. He turned to us for a loan in order to purchase cards from different providers. This will give him the opportunity to increase his product assortment and profits. He plans to pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cards for sale

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Asunta T. M. from Dar es Salaam. She is single with three children, between the ages of 11 and 18. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans.

Asunta has been running a bead making business since 2008. Beads are small, rounded pieces of glass, stone or plastic which are perforated and threaded in a string with others to make a necklace or rosary. She works at the business for 13-16 hours per day, six days per week. Asunta currently earns about $USD280 from her business.

Asunta is requesting a loan in order to buy more beads. In the future, she plans to increase the number of products. Asunta thanks you for your support! SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.
