One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beads.

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar M. Khalid Group

texts.en:
Shamim akhtar baji is a wife of M. K.. They have lived in a city named Lahore in Pakistan for the past twenty years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Shamim baji is an uneducated lady because her father was the only breadwinner of her family and couldn’t afford his children's education expenses. Her husband has had a gents undergarments selling business for the past ten years.

Shamim baji is the mother of four sons. Her elder son is a motor mechanic. The others are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. Shamim baji operates a thread-roll selling business. She does this work to share the financial burden of her husband and to pay the school fees of her kids. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy undergarments to expand her husband’s business.

She is the leader of a group of four other women from her locality. Ruqaiya baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (like wires, switches, and switch boards) for her electric shop. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy plastic baskets to sell. Rehana begum baji wants a loan to buy spare parts to sell. Nasreen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her business sewing clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy undergarments to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna M. is an entrepreneur in her own right. She finances her business using her own capital and works hard to bring in money for the family. Myrna is married with three children--two of whom are in school. Every day Myrna has to go to the market where she has a small stall for her fish. According to her, she needs to sell 9 to 15 k of fish to have capital for the next day's business activity and to cover the family's expenses. She wants to continue to expand this business by borrowing 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, Kiva's field partner.

loans.use: To purchase fish

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Milciades Omar

texts.es: Milciades es casado, de 28 años de edad, tiene 2 hijas, una estudia el 1er grado de primaria y una recien nacida de 20 dias, trabaja en el Banco de Finanzas de Juigalpa en Servicios Bancarios, con 4 años de servicio, su esposa de 25 años deedad no trabaja, cursa estudios universitarios, ademas de su salario tiene un incentivo de C$.3,600, la ayuda de U$.100.00 dólares mensuales que recibe de un hermano que esta en el extranjero, y ademas se dedica a la venta de celulares que le envia su hermano donde obtiene alguna ganancia.  Esta solicitando credito para comprar 5 protectores para las ventanas de su casa para dar mayor seguridad a la familia, pues estas son con aluminio y vidrio y son muy fragiles.  Se le conoce como un joven responsable, trabajador y cumplido con sus obligaciones, se siente muy contento por la oportunidad que la institucion le esta brindando y manifiesta que una vez cancelado el credito continuara pidiendo otro para lograr el sueño de tener una vivienda digna y segura.
texts.en:
Milciades is married and 28 years old. He has two daughters, one in first grade and a 20-day-old newborn. He has worked in the Bank Services department of the Banco de Finanzas de Juigalpa for four years. His 25-year-old wife is not working while she studies in the university. In addition to his salary, Milciades earns a bonus of C$3,600, receives an additional US$100 a month from a brother who lives in the United States, and also earns some money selling the cell phones his brother sends him. He is requesting this loan in order to buy bars for the windows of his house to give his family greater security. The windows are made of aluminum and glass and are very fragile. He is known to be a responsible, hard-working, and conscientious young man. He is very happy about the opportunity the institution is providing, and says that once he has repaid the loan he will request another in order to achieve his dream of having a decent, safe home.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building supplies

loans.name: Morena

texts.es: Morena L. A. reside en San Luis Talpa en el departamento La Paz, El grupo familiar de Morena está compuesto por cuatro personas. Morena se dedica a la costurería  elaborando ropa a la talla y diseño que sus clientes le piden. Morena lleva una gran trayectoria de experiencia en su profesión son 19 años que le han dado el buen gusto y calidad a las prendas que elabora, La acabados en los productos de Morena son de excelente calidad ya posee maquinas industriales para su producción. Morena solicita un crédito para invertir en su negocio comprando telas para la elaboración de productos.
texts.en:
Morena L. A. lives in San Luis Talpa in the department of La Paz. Morena’s family is made up of four people. She is a seamstress and makes clothing in the size and style that her clients request of her. She has a lot of experience in her profession because she has been imparting her good taste and making quality clothing for 19 years. Her products are very well-made because she has industrial sewing machines for their production. Morena is requesting a loan to invest in her business by buying fabrics for making her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. de Guadalupe”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 42 años, es madre de 02 hijos, uno que ya viene en camino.

Rosarito, lleva años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo así implementar su taller de confección de vestidos y como tenia la habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo Manuela Ramos decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa.
Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus costuras, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. A quienes les  atiende  con la amabilidad y el carisma  que le caracteriza. 

 Uno de sus sueños y meta por lograr, es implementar su propio taller de confección, con nuevas maquinas, cambiando lo antiguo por lo nuevo.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Rosario belongs to the “Nuestra Sra. De Guadalupe” (“Our Lady of Guadalupe") Communal Bank, in the district and province of Bellavista, Department of San Martín. She is 42 years old and has 2 children, with one on the way. Rosario is separated from her husband. Rosario has been in the tailoring business for years. Little by little she has generated her own income and saved her money, all with the goal of setting up her own tailoring shop. Since she was skilled at sewing, she knew she could achieve her goal. She decided to use a loan from Kiva partner Manuela Ramos to set up her own business in her home. Rosario tells us that her tailoring business is doing well. She works to complete orders that her customers purchase in advance, and always attends to her customers with her typical kindness and charisma. One of Rosario’s dreams that she hopes to achieve is to set up her own tailoring shop complete with new sewing machines—exchanging her old sewing machines for new ones. Rosario will use this loan of 1,000.00 soles to purchase different types and colors of fabric by the meter, along with supplies she uses such as scissors, large spools of thread of various colors, needles (some for hand stitching, some for her machine), pins, and buttons. Rosario now feels like she is a very accomplished woman who wants to achieve and make her dreams a reality. She is grateful for the help that the Manuela Ramos organization gave her in starting her business, and for the help Manuela Ramos has given to many other women who want to grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing different types and colors of fabric by the meter

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a widow and 37 years old. She has 3 children ages 20, 16 and 12 and one dependent.

She needs her first loan of 500000 RWF from VISION FINANCE COMPANY S.A to buy oil and fish to resell. Jacqueline has 10 years of experience doing that business and works from 6 A.M to 7 P.M. daily.

Jacqueline earns about $500 per month. The loan will help her expand her business. With the profits she will be able to pay school fees for her children and dependent.

loans.use: Buy oil and fish.

loans.name: Celenia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Celenia de 47 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, procreo dos hijos con edades de 10 y 12 años de edad, sus anhelo es poder terminar de hacer su casa, no vive con su esposo le ha tocado trabajar duro para poder mantener a sus hijos, y darle la educación que merecen, ella trabaja en servicios domésticos, trabajo que le rinde muchas veces, la tratan bien lo único que no es asegurada y se le hace mas difícil cuando esta enferma. Con este préstamo en Afodenic lograra cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que esta en mal estado, y espera cambiarlo para mejorar su situación y la de su familia de poder vivir dignamente. Da las gracias ala institución por los beneficios en mejorar su casa.

loans.use: Comprar zicn para cambiar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome P. makes a living primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She is a 58-year-old woman living in the town of Leusoalii. She is married and has five adult children. Salome has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 520 WST a month.

In 2009, Salome (0) joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salome is requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Salome's first loan from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose S. is currently in the business of selling various items in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more items in her shop to sell.  

Rose is 40 years old and is Married with a husband that is an accountant. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel. 

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more items in her shop to sell

loans.name: Wonderful Group

texts.en:
"Wonderful" is a group of five borrowers led by Anita D., 33, a single mother of three children ages 8-14, third through seventh grade.  Anita is an eleventh grade drop out due to poverty.  She lives in New Kru Town, a crowded and poor community that is full of crime.  Anita works in the Dualla market, where farmers bring their goods from out of town to sell, north of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.

Anita sells meat and spear ribs in the Dualla market and has been in this business for five years.  She hopes to become an international business woman.

When she started, her initial capital was Ld$2000.00.   Anita sells quality products so customer are encouraged to come back and buy from her.  She needs this loan to purchase more meat to serve customers.  Anita dreams of building a house for her family so they can move out of New Kru Town.

loans.use: Purchase meat to serve customers.

loans.name: Nurillo

texts.ru: Хучаев Нурилло проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 41 год. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Нурилло имеет среднее образование. Он более 5-ти лет занимается животноводством, откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для покупки скота, т.к. у него есть постоянные клиенты, т.е. спрос.
texts.en:
Nurillo H. lives in the Yavan district. He is 41 years old, married and has 5 children. Nurillo has secondary education. He has been involved in animal husbandry, raising and selling livestock, for over 5 years. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock because he has regular clients and, thus, demand.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en: Chann S. is 28 years old and lives with his wife in Takeo province. He is a construction worker building houses who is able to make a living of US$8 each day. His wife works as a garment factory worker. She typically makes US$3 per day. Chan S. would like to take out a loan of US$450 to purchase construction tools to assist in his work.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 26-year-old married man with two young children. Twelve years ago he started transporting goods for a store in the neighborhood and in 2004 when he could afford to buy his own van he started a business transporting goods for several stores in his village. Today, Ali is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to replace the trunk of the van so that he can safely and cleanly transport goods.

loans.use: to change the trunk of the van

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden H. is currently in the business of selling beans and groundnuts and is requesting a loan to buy more beans and groundnuts to sell.  Kiden is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy more beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena sells kerosene at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is married with 6 children and she is 45 years old. Her husband works as a security guard and he also supports the home. She has been in this business for 8 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum T., 29, is a garment factory employee who earns a salary to feed her young child. She sews cloth in the factory and earns an average wage of $70 a month.

Chum T. is married, but she divorced her husband when her child was a baby. She is taking out her loan to buy a cow which she will rent for a fee to farmers who need a cow to plow their farmland.

loans.use: To buy a cow to rent out

loans.name: Piedad Jasmina

texts.es:
La señora Piedad es otra de las socias del Banco Comunal  Creciendo para el Futuro  desde hace siete ciclos,   en este banco se reúnen un aproximado de veinte socias cada quince días en casa de una de ellas.

 Piedad  se caso  hace diez  años y tiene dos niños, su esposo es profesor en segunda enseñanza y gracias al esfuerzo conyugal lograron construir su vivienda propia que está ubicada en el sector El Parque Forestal  a las afueras de  la ciudad de Portoviejo.

Nuestra socia  es  profesional en la rama de belleza hace tres años, realiza todo lo que es  corte y tinturado de cabello, manicure y pedicure, su forma de trabajar es visitando de casa en casa a sus clientas que la mayoría son mujeres, así ha podido desenvolverse muy bien en este arte que le genera buenos ingresos, con este nuevo préstamo va a invertir en la compra de  esmaltes, tintes,  tijeras, secadora de cabello entre otros productos necesarios para su negocio.
texts.en:
Piedad has been a member of the Creciendo para el Futuro communal bank for 7 loan cycles. This communal bank has about 20 members and they meet every two weeks in one of the member's homes. Piedad got married ten years ago and she has two children. Her husband is a high-school teacher. Thanks to their efforts as a couple, they managed to build their own house, which is located in the Parque Forestal sector in the outskirts of the city of Portoviejo. Piedad has been a beautician for three years. She does everything related to hair cutting and coloring, manicures and pedicures. She visits her customers, who are mostly women, in their homes to provide her services. She has developed well in this art, which generates good earnings for her. She will use this new loan to buy nail polish, hair dyes, scissors and hair dryers, among other products that are necessary in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nail polish, hair dye, scissors, hair dryers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase medicine in bulk

loans.name: Barohat

texts.en:
R. Barohat is 36 years old. She is married and has four children. Barohat is a woman determined to search for the best things in life and to offer them to her dearly loved children. This eagerness means that she is always on the lookout for profitable new activities. She is accompanied and helped by her sister, who encouraged her to do this six years ago, when she moved to settle in her home town. 

Barohat devoted herself to selling blankets, towels and tablecloths, and now she is satisfied because her business provides her with sufficient income to cover the cost of primary education for her four young children.

Today she is requesting your help in getting a loan of $1500 to add new stock to her merchandise. Your support means a great deal to Barohat. Please offer her your help.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase blankets, towels and tablecloths for selling.

loans.name: Presentación Yadira

texts.es:
La señora Presentación Yadira M. es comerciante ambulante su negocio es de vender bajillas platos, vasos, cristalería y todo lo que se ocupa en los restaurantes tiene 18 años de dedicarse a esto ella ya tiene sus clientelas y solo por medio de pedido es que ella entrega.
Tiene tres hijos pero solo uno de pende de ella y una nieta es casada su esposo la apoya en todo. Anteriormente ella tenia un restaurante pero decidio alquilarlo para tener ese ingreso ahora ella vende ese tipo de productos decidio dejar el restaurante y venderles ese tipo de chinería y cristalería a sus clientes.
Tiene dos años y medio de trabajar con ceprodel y manifiesta que gracias a ceprodel y al apoyo que su esposo le ha dado ya hasta  término de construir su casita porque con los financiamientos que he obtenido con ceprodel me han quedado muy buenas ganancias y al suave he venido terminando mi hogar.
texts.en:
Presentación Yadira M. is a dinnerware, pots and pans, drinking glasses and restaurant supplies peddler. She has been in this line of work for 18 years and has a regular customer base to whom she sells based on prior orders. She has three children but only one of them and a granddaughter depend on her; her husband supports her work efforts. She used to run a restaurant but she decided to lease it out and earn the rent income; now she sells restaurant supplies and stopped running the restaurant – she’d rather sell dinnerware and glassware to her customers. She has collaborated with Ceprodel for two and a half years and she states that she is grateful to Ceprodel and to the support she’s gotten from her husband. She’s managed to finish building her little house and thanks to profits from Ceprodel’s loans she has been able to comfortably finish her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dinnerware, cutlery, coolers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Ana Ester

texts.es:
Ana Esther Z. tiene 53 años y vive en el barrio Quiroga de Bogotá  la capital de Colombia;  ella esta casada y tiene 7 hijos de 14 a 33 años de edad; Para Ana la satisfacción mas grande es atender y suministrar a los clientes   alimentos higiénicos y bien preparados por ella y su empleada; es así como su “Restaurante y comidas rápidas Archíes 70”, no tiene competencia en el sector. En la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor de $1.800.000 para comprar materias primas e insumos necesarios para la preparación de estos alimentos: granos,  lácteos, comestibles, carne y pollo y algunos implementos de aseo para el mantenimiento higiénico de este sitio.  
Ana inició su restaurante en el año 2008, pero desde hace 15 años adquirió experiencia en esta actividad, pues sus padres y familiares  han tenido este tipo de negocio y ella ha estado muy de cerca desde entonces.  
Sus sueño es tener una cadena de restaurantes  que se destaquen por la calidad  en los proceso y generar mas fuentes de empleos; otro de sus sueños es hacer de sus hijas unas profesionales en los que a ellas les guste. Lo mas difícil fue tomar la decisión de montar su negocio con las expectativas de tener los recursos económicos necesarios para hacerlo; ahora su gran desafío es remodelar el restaurante  dándole un aire de modernidad y más llamativo para sus clientes, de tal manera que al momento de llegar a consumir los productos se sientan a gusto y siempre muy decididos a regresar. A Ana le gusta el barrio donde vive desde hace 25 años, por el buen trato de su la gente, porque lo considera seguro   y porque tiene en los colegios, clubes deportivos y en  la iglesia su mercado real y potencial.
texts.en:
Ana Esther Z. is 53 years old. She lives in the Quiroga neighborhood of Bogotá, the capital of Colombia. She is married and has 7 children aged 14 to 33. Ana's biggest satisfaction is serving and providing customers with sanitary and well prepared food made by her and her employee. That is how her restaurant “Restaurante y comidas rápidas Archíes 70” has no competition in the area. At present, she is using a loan of $1.800.000 to buy the necessary raw materials and ingredients to prepare this food: grains, dairy, edibles, beef and chicken as well as some tools for cleanliness and sanitation for the locale. Ana started her restaurant in the year 2008 but she has had experience in this activity for 15 years. Her parents and relatives have had this type of business and she has been close to it since then. Her dream is to have a chain of restaurants that stand out with the quality of their processes and to generate more sources of employment. Another dream is to make her daughters into professionals in the areas they really like. The hardest part about deciding to start her business was the expectation of having the necessary economic resources to do it. Now her biggest challenge is remodelling the restaurant, giving it an air of modernity more attractive to customers. This way, when they arrive to consume the products, they will feel at ease and always wanting to return. Ana likes the neighborhood where she has lived for 25 years because it treats its people well, she considers it safe, and because it has in its schools, sports clubs and in its church a real and potential market.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grains, dairy, edibles, beef and chicken and some cleaning equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and food to sell.

loans.name: Nazareo

texts.es:
El señor Nazareo D. es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos pequeños que desea lo mejor para ellos y la seguridad. 
Es por eso que solicita el préstamo ya que le está haciendo falta el portón al frente de la casa para que sus niños puedan jugar sin peligro. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe del su trabajo como empleado de una agencia aduanal en el área de tramitador.
Nazareo D. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cual pago puntualmente.
Desea que su familia tengo una mejor casa donde puedan vivir y estar seguros.
texts.en:
Nazareo D. is father to two small children; he wants the best for them and to keep them safe. He needs a loan, therefore, to install a front gate in the entrance to his property so that his children can play danger free. He plans to repay the loan with the salary he earns employed as an expediter at a customs agency. Nazareo D. has had two previous loans with PVP which he repaid punctually. He hopes his family will have a better house in which to live and be safe.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a front gate on his property.

loans.name: Kagorogoro Ii Tukwatanise, Bushenyi Group

texts.en:
N. Topoista is a hardworking and an ever-optimistic 35-year-old married mother of seven, aged between 23 and 10 years. She operates a growing produce business in Kagorogoro Trading Centre, dealing in dry food cereals. With a business longevity of ten years, she has managed to significantly sustain and improve her family’s welfare status.

To all appearances, Topoista’s future business prospects look rosy with close to 120,000 Ugandan shillings coming in monthly from her business. She envisions an even greater profit as she gets this loan, anticipating being in position to buy more merchandise for the business. This will enable her to expand her business and also be able to earn more revenue and live a self-sustaining life.

Topoista says that her previous business was selling tomatoes and it's from this business that she saved to start her new business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her business

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Nem O., 42, is widowed and resides with her two children and two younger sisters in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. O. sells brooms for an income of USD 3 per day. 

O. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase groceries to help one of her sisters to expand her business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy groceries for her sister to expand her business

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es:
El señor Ivan es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres en la zona Plan Autopista de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Ivan trabaja en una imprenta que esta ubicada en la zona Miraflores y con el sueldo que gana ayuda a mantener su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para construcción de una habitación y esto ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Esta es la primera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ivan is single and lives with his parents in Plan Autopista in La Paz. Ivan works at a printer's located in Miraflores. He uses his salary to help maintain his household. The requested loan is for the construction of a bedroom, which will improve Ivan's living conditions. This is the first time Ivan is asking for a loan. He was graded favorably by a socioeconomic analysis, which allows him to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a room

loans.name: Emanuel Ita

texts.en:
Emanuel Ita N. is 27 years old. He is a farmer and supports three people in his family. His spouse is Norkilorit N. and they have two children aged 5 years and 2 years. Norkilorit is a housewife and she helps Emanuel in his farming activity.

Emanuel does wheat farming which he has been doing for the last three years successfully. This will be his first loan and he is planning to spend it on preparing his five acre farm for wheat planting. He is planning to use the anticipated profit from his farming to expand his farming activity by hiring a bigger piece of land to increase his wheat production.

He hopes to become a large scale farmer owning a bigger piece of land and be financially stable to support his family.

loans.use: preparing a farm for wheat planting

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
K. Betty is 21years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is married and has 1 child who is  currently in school.  Betty has a business of selling snacks, which she has had for 6 years.         

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase and buy more oil, flour and charcoal.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and to buy food for her family.  In the future, Betty hopes to own a house

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: to buy more flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Dinora Jeaqueline

texts.es:
la sra. Dinora Jeaqueline C. N. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene 4 años de haber iniciado con una pulpería misma que opera bajo el nombre Pulpería “DANIA”.
El crecimiento en su negocio es notable.
tambien la Sra. C. tiene otro negocio de pulpería ubicado en la Colonia el Encanto en la ciudad de Danlí y es administrado por una hermana.
Doña Dinora es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen en su totalidad de ella, cubriendo los gastos de alimentación, vivienda, salud, vestuario y educación, en la actualidad ambos hijos están cursando sus estudios primarios. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Dinora Jeaqueline C. N. sells popular consumer products. Four years ago, she started her own octopus meat shop called "DANIA". The growth of this business has been notable. Mrs C. also has another octopus meat shop, run by one of her sisters, in the Colonia el Encanto neighbourhood of Danlí. Dinora is a single mother, with two children that depend on her entirely for their food, accommodation, health, clothing and education. Both children are currently in primary education. The loan will be used to buy produce and promote her business more.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy produce for her shop (including soft drinks, fruit juice, butter, oil, soaps, beans, rice, bread, sugar, biscuits, donuts (churros), salt, bagged water, batteries, candles, soups, sauces, cakes, and deodorants)

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
J. U. Ruslan is an entrepreneurial young man who is engaged in cattle breeding.  In 2007, Ruslan graduated from State Juridical Academy in the capital city Bishkek, but, being a responsible person and grateful son, he returned to his native town, Naryn, to support his elderly parents.  He started his business using initial capital of 10,000 soms (KGS) and bought cattle. With hard work and great effort, Ruslan managed to multiply the number of cattle and today he has four milk cows, two horses and two bull calves. He earns about 2,000 KGS monthly, which allows him to renovate his family’s house. 

Ruslan has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy seven calves for fattening and reselling. He is eager to broaden his business because he plans to marry his girlfriend. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Chum's Group

texts.en:
Chum C. is a 44-year-old married woman and the village bank president selected by its 16 members, all living in Daeum Rues village, Kandal Province. The members will use their portion of the loan for various purposes.

Chum C. earns her living by selling Khmer cakes in the local market, using her profits to support her family and save for the future. Since her business is going well, she is requesting a loan to buy more Khmer cake supplies to expand her business activities. Her husband, Mr. Sambath Preap, 45 years old, is a farmer who owns 1.20 hectares upon which he cultivate rice; he also helps in his wife's business activities. This couple has a child who is a student at the local school.

loans.use: To buy more Khmer cake supplies to continue and expand her business activities.

loans.name: Gena

texts.en: Gena U. is from the village of Capayangan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 29 years old. Gena is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Gena runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Gena has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Gena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gena is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Gena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.es:
Doña Alfonsa tiene 61 años de edad  está casada hace mas 30 años  tiene 4 hijos ya mayores de edad.  
	 La Sra. Alfonsa se dedica hace 35 años a esta actividad,  teje frazadas y manteles artesanales y ella misma se encarga de venderlos ya que  la mayoría de sus hijos viven por la capital ella le lleva su producto para comercializarlo, viaja una vez al mes y le resulta muy rentable su producto,  gracias  a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo brindarles a sus hijos todas las comodidades y a la vez hacerle estudiar. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilo y color para tejer hamacas que en ésta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alfonsa, age 61, has been married for over 30 years.  She has four grown children.

Alfonsa has been weaving handmade blankets and tablecloths for 35 years. She sells them herself because most of her children live by that money.   She travels once a month, and she is able to earn a very good profit with her products. Thanks to her work and effort, she has been able to provide her children with all of the basic comforts and also pay for their education. 

She is requesting the loan to buy thread and dye in order to weave hammocks, which her customers request a lot during this season.

loans.use: Buy thread and dye

loans.name: Josefa Bernarda

texts.es: Josefa Bernarda tiene 58 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de comida. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, inicio porque necesitaba tener una fuente de ingresos que le generara ingresos necesarios y así proporcionarles a sus 3 hijos lo necesario. Uno de sus mayores desafíos es que tiene que realizar la elaboración de sus diferentes comidas para que sus clientes no tengan que esperar mucho tiempo. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, verduras, jugos y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Josefa Bernarda, 58, sells food.  She has had the business for over 6 years.  She started it because she needed a source of income to provide for her three children.  

One of the greatest challenges she faces is to prepare the different dishes so that her customers don’t have to wait too long.

The loan will be used to buy basic grains, vegetables, juices and soft drinks.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, vegetables, juices and soft drinks.

loans.name: Janylbubu's Group

texts.en: Janylbubu is the leader of this group. At 49, she is unfortunately a widow. By herself she takes care of, raises and gives proper upbringing to her two sons, both of whom are university students. In order to support the family financially, Janylbubu earns money by working as an operator in the Tokmok filling station. Besides that, she is engaged in cattle breeding. She is a hardworking woman who wants to improve the well-being of her family and for this reason, she intends to develop her business concerning cattle breeding. She wants to purchase cattle to feed and then resell at a higher price. For this purpose, she hopes to get a loan. In the future, Janylbubu aims to present her son with a musical instrument. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Dayse Beatriz

texts.es:
Dayse Beatriz J. R. tiene 40 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL BATAN se encuentra ubicada 90 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla esta conformado por 21 socios que se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Dayse se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz desde hace mucho tiempo. Compra sus productos en el Cantón Bucay y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando.

Le gusta seguir trabajando con la familia.
texts.en:
Dayse Beatriz J. R. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and children in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar.  She has four children.

The members of the V.R.C El Batan are located 90 minutes from the Chillanes office in the canton of Chillanes.  This group is made up of 21 members who have worked as farmers, planting short-cycle crops like cacao, cassava, and corn for a long time.

Dayse is a farmer who has planted cacao, cassava, and corn for many years.  She buys her products in Bucay canton and sells them in the market in Chillanes and in her area.  

She is askign for this loan to purchase agricultural supplies and fertilizers for her cacao crop.  This loan will help her financially and allow her to meet her needs.  She can face challenges like plagues, sickness, and weather changes.  Her dream is to continue working.

She would like to continue working with her family.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Maxime

texts.fr:
Commerçante de 41 ans,mariée et mère de 3 enfants, cliente de Hope depuis bientôt 4 mois, elle s'est lancée dans la vente de la layette comme: brassières,cache - brassières, tricots,couches, draps pour bébé , grenouillères.
Ses ventes sont de 40.000 a 150.000 fr par jour, elle a  fait preuve d'un remboursement constant et des épargnes régulières pour le premier prêt 
Elle tient a bénéficié  d'un deuxième prêt, pour faire face a ses problèmes et continuer a renforcer son activité en ajoutant de la layette qu'elle pense faire acheter a Pointe Noire , Kinshasa et aussi aux femmes commerçantes qui viennent de la France .Ses clientes sont les femmes qui viennent pour les consultations prénatales de la maternité qui est non loin de sa boutique,
Dans ses perspectives d'avenir, elle s'efforce a faire plus de bénéfices pour qu' elle  puisse  ouvrir une autre boutique   ou l'on ne trouvera que des vêtements pour nouveaux nés.
texts.en:
This merchant is 41 years old, married and the mother of three. She has been a client of Hope for almost four months. She sells baby products, such as vests, undershirts, onesies, diapers, sheets for babies, sleeper suites, etc.

Her sales range from 40,000 to 150,000 West African Francs per day. She already proved her ability to pay timely and save money after her first loan. She really hopes to obtain a second loan in order to meet her challenges and continue growing her business and having merchandise ordered from Pointe Noire, Kinshasa, and also from merchants who travel to France. Her clients are women who come for prenatal visits to the medical office located near her store. In the future, she will try to increase her revenue in order to be able to open a second store specializing exclusively in clothing for the newborns.

loans.use: Purchasing baby items: diapers, undershirts, bibs, onesies, sheets

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Mrs. Von Y. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Koy Oul, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have six children: three sons and three daughters. Three are married and live outside the family home, one attends school, one is a construction worker and another one has full-time employment in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a wooden-house repairman and a fisherman. 

Vun was a weaver, but she stopped the business. Their main source of income is from her husband and her child’s salary. She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to get work

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas, tiene 60años, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo y 2 nietos. Alejandrina se dedica a la confección de blusas, faldas, fustanes y los lleva a las ferias de Acos Vinchos, Rosas Pata, Ccescca, Paccha, aprendió de está actividad desde muy niña y con este oficio ha podido educar a su hijo y ahora ayuda en la educación de sus 2 nietos que están en la universidad.
Alejandrina solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como: Telas, blondas, hilos.
Esta en Finca desde hace 5 años, le gusta por los prestamos que le otorgan y puede ahorrar.
Su sueño es seguir teniendo las misma fuerza para seguir trabajando y que sus nietos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Cocharcas”. She is 60 years old and a single mother with one child and two grandchildren. Alejandrina earns a living by making blouses, skirts, and petticoats and then brings them to the fairs in Acos Vinchos, Rosas Pata, Ccescca, and Paccha. She learned this skill as a young girl and the income from her job enabled her to provide her child with an education. Now she helps with the education of her two grandchildren who are at the university.

Alejandrina is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of materials such as fabrics, lace, and thread. She has been with FINCA for five years and enjoys the loans that have been given to her and having the ability to save. Her dreams include having the strength to continue working and seeing her grandchildren become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, lace, and thread

loans.name: Fernando Bladimir

texts.es: El Sr. Fernando Bladimir G. M. él es trabajador activo de la empresa “Alcaldía Municipal de San Rafael del Sur” desempeñándose como Operario de Vivero tiene  dos  años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Fernando Bladimir G. M. is currently employed of the “Municipal Township of San Rafael del Sur” where he has been working for two year in the plants nursery. He is married and currently has two children who go to school. He has had two loans with CEPRODEL, and each one has been used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, piedrín (a type of building stone) and so on: they have been used to enlarge and improve his house. Ha has greatly benefited from the loans with Ceprodel, as through this mean he has improved his own quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To buy sand, cement and stone.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is a widow. She lost her husband due to a car accident. Natalya was forced to find ways to support herself and her newborn baby. The tragedy didn’t break her. She found the strength to move on and even started her own clothing sales business. She launched her trade 10 years ago. Presently, Natalya has two vending locations. Her gross income amounts to 24,000 Grivnyas. Net profit is over 4,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Natalya is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal merchandise. She is planning to purchase women’s spring clothing items, i.e. jackets, blouses, pants, etc. and diversify assorted merchandise she offers for sale. The business has helped Natalya take her mind off painful memories of the past and look into the future with hope. She is seeking to keep her business running and profitable as it the only way to provide for herself and her child and guarantee a secure future for their family.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Gedion Maina

texts.en:
Gideon is 48 years old. He supports four members of his family. He is married to Patricia and they are blessed with three children, ages 20, 16 and 10. Gideon’s wife provides outside catering services which is an extra source of income. 

He has been operating a retail shop for the past thirty-one years. His monthly income is approximately $227. He plans to use the entire loan amount to increase his stock of maize flour and sugar. 

Gideon will use the anticipated profit from the business to educate his three children. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD. His hopes and dreams are to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To increase stock of maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Ruddy Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel de 24 años,  es un hombre trabajador que empezó dese el colegio el arte de diseñar y le gusta esta actividad. Está casado y tiene una hija de 1 año.

En la actualidad labora de lunes viernes desde las 8H00am a 3H00pm, su esposa lo ayuda arreglando carteles y también realiza las cintas para reinas  para cualquier presentación que le pidan. Con el préstamo quiere comprar pinturas, telas, cartulinas para aumentar sus ingresos.

En un futuro  quiere terminar la universidad y ser profesor con su esposa.
texts.en:
Gabriel, 24 years old, is a hard-working man who has been active in the art of design since he was in school.  It is something he enjoys.  He is married and has a one-year-old daughter.

He currently works Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.  His wife helps him with his poster-making and also makes ribbons for the queen of any given event.  He plans to use the loan to buy paint, fabric and construction paper to increase his income.

In the future he would like to finish his college education and become a teacher, together with his wife.

loans.use: To buy paint, fabric and construction paper

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en:
Haidee runs a fishing business. She and her husband have two children and she works hard to help support her family.

Haidee has requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she knows she will save money by being able to use the dried wood from her surroundings as firewood. Haidee is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money but is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a 35-year-old single mother living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. After separating from her husband, she decided to venture into retail shopping to help her support her child. She started as a farmer and later saved to set up a shop, which has been profitable despite the current inflation rate in the country.  Her desire is to become a wholesale trader. Annet needs the loan to buy cooking oil, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, sugar and soap to sell

loans.name: Vladimir Ramon

texts.es:
Vladimir pequeño comerciante de venta de comida con más de veinte años en las ventas, ofreciendo su variedad en comida. Negocio que tiene es su casa de habitación, comenzando con ayuda de su mama, y capital propio.
Y pocos alimentos ya que solo era comida rápida, luego con las ganancias comienza  a vender carne asada, pollo, lo que más tarde quiere hacer mejora a su negocio en la compra de mesas, sillas, utensilios para hacer la comida siendo Afodenic quien da un financiamiento logrando el objetivo.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo cambiara unas laminas del techo del bajarete, y podrá agrandar mas el espacio del negocio, lo que hará con este nuevo préstamo la compra de laminas de zinc y perlines, golosos para hacer la mejoras.
texts.en:
Vladimir is a small businessman who sells meals.  He has been in this business for more than twenty years and offers a variety of food.  His business is located in his home.  He started his business with his mother's help and his own capital.  He didn't offer a great variety of food at first because it was only fast food.  However, using his profits, he started to sell roast meat (chicken).  He further improved his business by purchasing tables, chairs and utensils with which to make his food.  It was Afodenic who provided him with the loan to achieve his goal.

Vladimir will use this new loan to replace some of the roof of his shelter and further expand his business space.  He will use his loan to buy metal sheets, beams and bolts to make these improvements.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, beams and bolts to replace some roofing and to increase the size of the shelter he uses for his business

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, tiene la edad de 48 años, está casado y vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo que son sus mayores prioridades. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de su frijol. El lo que quiere es mejorar su próxima cosecha y así poder obtener de su proyecto mejores ganancias. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo, además el cuenta con la experiencia para producirlo y generarle ganancias. El quiere con esta mejora a su frijol generar divisas para el mantén y el bienestar familiar en su futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 48 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children who are his main priorities.  He plans to use his loan to buy the supplies he needs to care for his bean crop.  What he would like is to improve his next harvest and thereby be able to make better profits.  He has a plot of land which is ideal for growing this crop.  He also has experience in growing it and making profits from it.  By improving his bean crop, he would like to make money with which to support his family and provide for their well-being in the future.

This is the first loan that Gerardo has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better repayment terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to care for his bean crop

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 44 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Anecita has been farming sugarcane for 26 years and also earns additional income from running a sari-sari (variety) store and raising livestock.

Anecita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 38 years old.  He is married and has 3 children aged 6, 10 and 18. In 2006, he established a pharmacy. He began this business immediately after he left secondary school, which he did because he did not have financial support to continue his schooling.  At that point in his life,  he became involved in business with the aim of generating enough income to continue his schooling.  Unfortunately, he did not continue.  He therefore decided to make business his career and thanks to God, he has achieved greatly in business.  He has been able to build a house, where he presently lives, and can now take good care of his home.  

Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business.  He serves the Makama community, where he sees over 30 customers each day.  His business is popular because he is the only person selling pharmaceutical products in his area.  He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 to purchase more pharmaceutical products -- ampicilin (100 cartons @ 120,000), pinoplex (5 cartons @ Le180,000), etc. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  

In the future, he plans to take this loan, which will help him greatly as additional capital, and realize more profit so that he can give a quality education to his children and take good care of his wife.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy pharmaceutical drugs in bulk

loans.name: William

texts.es: William, un joven padre de familia de 29 años, es natural de Chupaca, vive con su esposa y su hijo en casa de su madre. Tiene experiencia como músico desde hace 5 años, toca el bajo y es guitarrista, conforma parte de una banda musical donde tocan varios géneros musicales desde lo típico vernacular hasta lo mas moderno en rock y cumbia. Los contratos que recibe  dentro de su grupo son semanales por lo que siempre tiene trabajo como músico que cobran por hora. Pero el gran sueño de William es tener su propio grupo musical y prepararse en música, lo que sabe de música lo aprendió  por unas amistades que le enseñaron a tocar, sin embargo desea tener conocimientos mas profundos de música. De manera paralela vende animales en la feria ganadera de su zona, aprovechando los conocimientos que sus padres le enseñaron este oficio, por tanto tiene proyectos de incrementar su capital de trabajo. Fue invitado a formar parte del grupo solidario que integra por medio de un familiar y se compromete a responder puntualmente a los pagos mensuales que se le asigne porque tiene en claro su inversión futura. Destinará el dinero en la compra de ovejas para vender y una parte en el mantenimiento de su instrumento musical.
texts.en: William, a young father of 29 years of age, is from Chupaca. He lives with his wife and his son in his mother's house. He has been a musician since he was 5 years old - he plays the bass and is a guitarist - and he is a member of a band that plays various styles of music from the local vernacular to more modern rock and cumbia. The contracts that he gets with the group are weekly and he can always get work as a musician paid by the hour. But William's greatest dream is to have his own musical group and to learn more. What he knows about music he learnt from some friends who taught him to play, but he wants to have a deeper understanding of music. At the same time, he sells animals in the livestock market in his area, drawing on everything that his parents taught him about this work, and he has projects to increase his working capital. He was invited to be part of the community bank by a relative and he promises to make his monthly repayments punctually because he has future investments clearly in mind. He will use the loan to buy sheep to sell and also part of it for maintaining his musical instrument.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has operated a café business for the past five years. Her customer base is made up of her neighbors and passers-by. She also is engaged in farming and the sales of farm produce, which provides a secondary source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish a restaurant in the future.

Beatrice is a married woman with two children: one attends school and one is still too young for school. Beatrice owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she has requested, she wants to purchase tea leaves, sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, and farm fertilizers. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase tea leaves, sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, and farm fertilizers

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simón de 63 años de edad, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, sus hijos viven independientemente, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito de Motupe que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Simón se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza y comercialización de animales de corral (cuyes, pavos y conejos), sus corrales los tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos  naturales, una vez que lleguen a su peso  y tamaño ideal lo ofrece a sus clientes en los diferentes mercados de la zona y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar sus necesidades diarias de su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y algunas calaminas para arreglar sus corrales, para engordarlos y luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un buen precio por ellos y así pueda tener mayores ganancias para brindarle a su esposa  una mejor calidad de vida.  Simón  es una persona dedicada su trabajo y lo único que desea es poder brindarle a su esposa algunas comodidades en su hogar y que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Simón, 63, lives with his wife in his own house.  His children live on their own.  His house has all basic utilities and is located in Motupe District which belongs to Lambayeque Department.  This is a zone noted for farming, cattle raising and tourism.

Simón has been raising small farm animals (guinea pigs, turkeys and rabbits) to sell for several years now.  His corrals are in the rear of his property.  He feeds them nutritionally balanced feed, grains and natural grasses.  Once they reach ideal size and weight he sells them to customers in various local markets and uses income obtained to cover his household’s daily needs.

He has requested a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa through its Seed Capital program to buy nutritionally balanced feed for his animals to fatten them up and then sell them in various local markets hoping to get good prices for them to provide his wife with a better quality of life and to buy a few sheets of plywood to repair his corrals.

Simón is a person who is dedicated to his work and all he wants is to be able to provide his wife with a few comforts at home and that his business continues growing.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed and to buy a few sheets of plywood to repair his corrals.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 29-year-old man. He is married and they have two children aged six and three to whom they hope to give a good education to university level. He runs a retail shop at a busy market area known as Kinanie in Kitengela. He has been running this business for two years now and has one employee. 

He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. He however works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure his business is doing well. He is using his loan of KES 80,000 to buy more general items to grow his business to wholesale and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to diversify into a real estate business in future. He describes himself as honest and understanding.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, rice, cooking oil, detergents, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy buckets, cups, bowls, plastic utensils and cooking utencils

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 36 years old, married and with three children.  He does tailoring to earn a living.  He has been in the business for eight years and has employed two people.  He also repairs sewing machines so as to earn more income.  Through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in business management skills.  This has helped him to improve his business.

Vincent hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.  He has requested 25,000 Kenya shillings to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Jorge Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor José Eduardo es un hombre trabajador que le gusta imponerse retos y cumplirlos, por eso hace 5 años inicio con su negocio de papelería y mercería en uno de los ejidos cercanos a la ciudad, por que vio que seria una mejor opción de tener mayores ingresos al colocarlo en un lugar donde no hay mucha competencia. Jose Eduardo comenta que todos los días sale de su trabajo hacia el ejido y hace 15 a 20 minutos en llegar pero esta teniendo resultados favorables y sobre todo en lo económico para su familia. 

El negocio cuenta con variedad de producto de papelería, mercería, regalos y servicio de internet para cualquier persona a un precio accesible. Para José Eduardo es muy importante mantener  su negocio con mercancía variada para que sus clientes encuentren lo que necesiten ya que por la lejanía es muy difícil de conseguir, por ello el préstamo lo utilizara para comprar cuadernos lápices, plumas, marcadores, mochilas, listones, y equipo de cómputo que este en mejores condiciones; de esta manera sus ventas incrementaran y su negocio será prosperado.
texts.en:
José Eduardo is a hardworking man who likes to set goals for himself and accomplish them.  Because of this, five years ago he started his stationery and variety shop in one of the “ejidos” [system of cooperative land tenure] near the city because he saw that it was a better option for earning higher income to establish it in a place where there was little competition.  José Eduardo comments that he leaves work daily and heads to the ejido; it’s a 15 to 20 minute trip but he’s having favorable results above all for his family’s economy.

The business has a variety of paper goods, merchandise, gifts and Internet access service for anyone at an accessible price.  For José Eduardo it’s important to keep his business stocked with a good variety of merchandise so that his customers can find whatever they need because it’s hard for them to get things due to the distances involved.  Because of this, he’ll use the loan to buy notebooks, pencils, pens, markers, backpacks, ribbon and computer equipment that’s in better condition so that he can increase sales and his business will continue to make progress.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, backpacks and computer equipment.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, 42 years old, is married and has five children, three of whom are in school. She has operated a business selling maize flour in Yei, South Sudan, for six years.

Esther requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan, in order to purchase maize flour, cassava flour and groundnuts to sell. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more maize flour, cassava flour, and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been working in the transport industry in Njabini town for the last  nine years. He is 35 years old, married to Elizabeth and they have three school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He repaid both his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to service his pick-up. 

In future, Peter hopes to buy a lorry which he will be using to transport goods to and from the market in Njabini town.

loans.use: To service his pick-up.

loans.name: Twisungane N0 22/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Gratien fait partie du groupe Twisungane no 22/Rsz. Le nom du groupe signifie «Mettons nous ensemble». Il a 42 ans et il est marié avec 5 enfants de 1 à 13 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Gratien est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire les semences sélectionnée. Dans les prochaines années, Gratien voudrait être le fournisseur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Gratien belongs to the Twisungane no 22/Rsz group.  The name means "let's come together".  He is 42 years old and married, with five children between 1 and 13 years old, four of whom are in school.  His education level is six years of primary school.

Gratien grows rice.  This is his second loan cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice cultivation.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to use selected seeds.  Within the next few years, Gratien would like to be the local supplier.  With his profits, he plans to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for rice farming.

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Betty is 19 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. For the past two years, Betty has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells chicken. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more feed for the chickens, which will help Betty to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to become a doctor. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Betty's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 38-year-old young woman, she is married and has one son.  Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Mona is looking to improve her home by making some repairs such as painting and changing tiles and purchasing new home furniture such as living room seats and a kitchen table but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for this so she needs to borrow a loan of $2,000 from FATEN.  When she gets the loan, she will be able to purchase new home furniture and make some repairs.  This will change her life positively and offer her family better living conditions.  Mona is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture and make some home repairs.

loans.name: Misanga Group

texts.en:
Dinah is the facilitator of Misanga group. Dinah and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Dinah takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Dinah had a good maize yield harvesting 7 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  she was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on ½  acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dinah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Dinah will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Misanga group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: El señor Cirilo trabaja como ayudante de albañil y es además rentista jubilado. El crédito que solicita es para completar el dinero necesario para poder comprar un terreno, amurallarlo y poner puertas y alquilar como parqueo para poder mejorar sus ingresos. Cirilo es casado y no tiene dependientes. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona  de Villa Dolores de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta es la cuarta vez que su crédito es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Cirilo works as a masonry assistant, but he is also a retired pensioner. The loan he is requesting will be used to complete the necessary sum that he needs to buy a piece of land. He will also install fencing and gates so that he can rent out this land as a parking lot, which will help to improve his income. Cirilo is married and has no dependents. He lives in his own home in the District of Villa Dolores in the city of El Alto.

This is the fourth time that his loan has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land that can be rented out as a parking lot.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Leonila has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Leonila is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Leonila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Vaiola

texts.en:
Vaiola is 37 years of age and a widow with one child. She owns and operates a business venture of selling soft drinkts to her village community. She has run this business for one year. Vaiola needs a loan of $1,000 WST to purchase codial , raros ,sugar and plastic cups. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 WST per week) to improve and expand the business.
In 2011, Vaiola joined Kiva partner SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Vaiola's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase codial , raros ,sugar and plastic cups

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 32 years old, married with two children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retail shop owner and he has been in business for five years. He started with farming where he saved money and then started a retail business. His goals are educating his children and owning a wholesale shop. 

Stephen wants the loan to buy soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy  soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Gnonmi Group

texts.fr: GNONMI est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mouniratou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 29 ans. Mouniratou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Mouniratou est mariée à un certain Moudja. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Mouniratou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Mouniratou vend des pâtes dentifrices depuis dix ans et des tisanes de façon secondaire. Mouniratou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Mouniratou sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe GNONMI, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des pâtes dentifrices et des tisanes.

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en: Mrs. Lieu is 34 years old. She is married and has two children, so she works very hard to provide for them .Husbandry and fishing are the main income of her family. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family living standard as well as environment protection.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
