Don Leónidas tiene la edad de 55 años, en muchas ocasiones se ha acercado a Afodenic con el ánimo de mejorar su negocio y con los créditos emitidos mediante Kiva ha hecho posible este sueño, ahora su venta de Pulpería, Granos Básicos y abarrotería en General le es más productiva y auto sostenible, con la variedad de productos que ofrece ha ganado clientes, siendo su principal fuente de ingresos y la sostenibilidad de su hogar esta actividad que en conjunto con su esposa llevan a cabo para brindar un buen vivir a su hija  que aun es menor de edad y estudia, como padre responsable desea lo mejor para ella.  
Con el crédito anterior incremento el capital de trabajo, ahora vende mayor cantidad de productos y el negocio está más amplio siendo más rentable.

Este préstamo será invertido en reparación de baño e instalación de inodoro, obra que dejo a medio hacer por no ajustar con los recursos económicos, faltando aun poner parte del azulejo, cambiar la ducha, reparar una pared en el baño que se filtra,  comprar pega, Cemento Bond, Porta Toallas, llave de pase, y demás accesorios necesarios en esta mejora, espera completarla en su totalidad con el Préstamo para bien de su familia.

Su meta principal es continuar mejorando su vivienda, con otro crédito mediante Kiva si Dios le permite hará un cuarto.

loans.use: Completar la obra del Inodoro y baño que inicio anteriormente, poner azulejo,cambiar ducha y otros; deseando que su familia goce de mejor calidad de vida.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to pull through, overcoming different obstacles that have arisen in her life. She is a mother of four, and from Kitale, a remote town in the Rift valley province of Kenya. 

Beatrice has spent the past 10 years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Beatrice is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in; poultry farming is closest to her heart. 

Beatrice wants to diversify and start a business selling cereals. She is requesting a loan to buy cereals to sell. The Kitale area has a ready market for cereals, but the problem is that there are no cereal suppliers. With your loan, Beatrice will be able to sell cereal to the local market and to her neighbors. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. 

Beatrice is very concerned about her four children’s education, so profits from selling cereal will go to pay her school fees. She dreams of a secure future for her children. Beatrice awaits your kindness with open hands.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah, 44 year old, married and has 3 children. She borrowed a loan to buy for more goods in her sari-sari business. Through her business she was able to help her husband who is a carpenter. She was able to provide their daily needs which is the food and able to give her children some financial support. She is a hard working mother and she also have a piggery that able her to pay some of their bills. She want to expand her business, help her family and give her children a bright future.

loans.use: to buy for more goods in her Sari-sari business

loans.name: Dorothée

texts.en:
27 years old, Mrs. Dorothée K. is a married woman and mother of one child. Oldest child in her family, she worked hard in order to help out her parents and her younger brothers and sisters. Thanks to help from her husband and a loan of $450, she opened a dry goods stores in her community. This could become very profitable as she realizes thather store is the only one in the area and demand is great. She is therefore hoping to enlarge the inventory of her store, and is asking for a loan to invest in her store. She is asking for a $1200 loan which would allow her to buy and resell dry goods, thus greatly expanding her business and allowing her to better take care of the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 27 ans, Mme K. Dorothée est une femme mariée et mère d’un enfant. Fille aînée de sa famille, elle travaille durement pour venir en aide à ses parents et à ses jeunes frères et sœurs. Grâce à l’appui de son mari et à un crédit de $450 obtenu, elle a ouvert une boutique de mercerie dans son quartier. Cette activité peut lui être très rentable si elle disposait d’un fonds de crédit plus consistant car sa boutique est la seule dans son quartier. Elle s’est donc rendue compte que la demande est devenue très forte et cherche à renforcer sa boutique. Le renforcement et l’élargissement de la boutique nécessitent un nouvel investissement et pour y parvenir, Mme K. a besoin d’un appui financier. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $1200 qui va servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente des produits de mercerie. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître considérablement ses activités et facto ses revenus aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buy and sell dry goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Ngeh Godlove

texts.en:
Born in 1972, Godlove is married and is a father of three children. Ironically unemployment and poverty caused him to indulge in smoking. This situation was further compounded by the death of his supportive father. Encouraged by GHAPE members in his community he joined GHAPE in 2004.  His training in basic health-care, marketing techniques, credit management, and experience in the utilization and repayment of two previous loans, and the available support from group and center members are strengths he will continue to exploit   

Given a loan of $800, Godlove plans to expand his piggery by buying 10-piglets, sticks to increase rooms in the fence, feed, and to set aside money for vet services and other emergencies. He will provide his community with manure, pork and pigs for marriage ceremonies and other traditional rites. He plans to repay the loan during the term.

loans.use: Sale of beans, palm oil, and pigs.

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso P. is 41 years old and is married. He and his wife, Damiana Aquino, have an 8 year old son who attends a public school in their neighborhood. Celso's wife sells men's and women's clothing and perfumes door to door.

Celso owns a locksmith shop located in the center of the city and has 12 years of experience in the trade. His business enjoys an established client base and generates sufficient income to cover the family's expenses. In spite of his many responsibilities and his age, he makes an extraordinary sacrifice to continue studying. He's currently in his last year of law school at one of the city's best private universities.

His biggest dream is to complete his studies and to practice law, which will enable him to improve his family's quality of life and allow him to provide better opportunities for his son.

He's requesting a US $300 loan to invest in a motorcycle, because most of his business consists of house calls. Having this mode of transportation will allow him to provide better service and also to get to his law school classes on time.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Celso Páez tiene 41 años, esta casado con la Señora Damiana Aquino, la pareja tiene un hijo varón de 8 años de edad y que va a una escuela pública del mismo Barrio. Su señora vende ropas y perfumes para damas y caballeros, actividad que la realiza casa por casa, pues no cuenta con un local fijo para la venta. Celso es propietario de una cerrajería en pleno centro de la ciudad, con una antigüedad de 12 años en el ramo, con buena clientela formada lo que le genera ingreso suficiente para cubrir gastos familiares. A pesar de las enormes responsabilidades que posee y de su edad, él realiza un sacrificio extraordinario para seguir estudiando, actualmente está cursando el 4to. Año de la carrera de Derecho (Leyes) en una de las mejores universidades privadas de la ciudad. Su mayor sueño es poder culminar su carrera y ejercer la profesión, de esta forma mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y dar mayores oportunidades a su hijo. Solicita un crédito de $ 300 que los invertirá en la compra de una motocicleta, ya que la mayoría de sus trabajos los realiza a domicilio, este medio de transporte lo ayudará a agilizar y mejorar sus servicios, además que le servirá como medio de transporte para llegar a tiempo a las clases de la facultad.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for business use

loans.name: Umu

texts.en: Umu is forty-eight years old and has six children.  She sells locally produced cooking pots and spoons in Makeni town.  The pots are produced by blacksmiths using aluminum scrap metals.  Pot producing is one of the booming local technologies that generates income for producers and sellers and creates employment for the youth.  As many women in Sierra Leone, Umu’s dream is to have educated children who will deliver themselves from poverty in the future.  Umu says, “My vision is to see the future of my children poverty free”.  She is requesting a loan of $275 so she can purchase more stock and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more locally made household utensils for her business.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es:
Business Description

Clarisa’s business involves the sale of a variety of household goods such as sheet sets, pots and pans, silverware, quilts, blenders, etc. She travels throughout the Isla sector offering her products, where she is known for augmenting her earnings through her business to sustain her home. She works every day of the week.

Loan Use

Clarisa asks for a loan to purchase additional merchandise, specifically those which bring a good profit and are in high demand. She also wants to increase her inventory to offer her customers a greater variety of products.

Personal Information

Clarisa is 25 years old and has a 6-year old child. Her husband works at a garage. He tells us he would like to have your support with his wife’s request for a loan, as the additional income she can generate greatly helps the family. Clarisa’s desire is to grown her business to generate enough income so that they could save money to buy their own lot and build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Clarisa tiene negocio de venta de artículos para el Hogar: Juegos de Sabanas, Juegos de Ollas, Juegos de Cucharas, Edredones, Licuadora y otros enseres para el Hogar. Clarisa recorre sector de Isla ofreciendo sus productos, ella es conocida al igual que su familia que tiene esta línea de trabajo como fuente generadora de sustento para su hogar. Clarisa labora todos los días de semana.

Uso del Préstamo

Clarisa solicita el crédito para comprar más artículos, específicamente aquellos que tienen una inversión mayor y los realiza sobre pedidos. Clarisa también necesita incrementar sus mercaderías y ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de Productos. Además viene época de Navidad y las ventas son buenas.

Información Personal

Clarisa tiene 25 años de edad y 1 hijo de 6 años. Esposo trabaja como empleado en un Taller de Ventas. El nos dice que le gustaría que le apoyen a la esposa con el crédito, porque de esa manera se generan otros ingresos que benefician a la familia. El anhelo que tiene Clarisa es crecer más su negocio y generar mayores utilidades que les permitan ahorrar y poder comprar un terreno y luego construir.

loans.use: Purchase household goods to improve her sales/variety of inventory.

loans.name: Apiseka

texts.en:
Apiseka is 38 years old. She is married with three children. There are nine people in her family.

Apiseka is a new member; she joined SPBD this year. She is one of the most popular tailors in her village. She has been sewing clothes for more than 10 years, since she was 27 years old. She sews t shirts, puletasi (traditional Samoan garb worn by women) and haloa. Groups also ask Apiseka to make uniforms for them. She earns about $450 WST ($180 USD) a week.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: José

texts.en:
José G. is 55 years old and is married to Teresa G. who is fifty-four. They have no children because of the inability to conceive. Mr. G. has a small convenience store in which he sells various things. In order to start up this business, Mr. G. had cultivated cotton in prior years. With the cotton profits, he bought merchandise and soon began his convenience store in the year 2000.

Years have passed and Mr. G.’s store has grown in the amount of merchandise sold. It is located in an area where there is not much competition and therefore has achieved great income. It continues to be well maintained and staffed by his family. Jose wishes to continue the expansion of his convenience store and with a loan will diversify the goods, buying items such as yerba mate (herbal tea), sugar, oil, bath soap, and laundry detergent.

loans.use: To purchase yerba mate, sugar, oil, flour, bath soap, and laundry detergent

loans.name: Teo's Group

texts.en:
N. Teo, the chairperson of her group, is not married and has 4 children. For 11 years, She has been selling fresh fish to companies and traders in Kamwokya, Ntinda, and Bukoto, the neighboring towns.

Her group has been together for 5 years and all members have successfully repaid their loans. Teo is requesting a loan to offset the current high price of fish. She wants to expand her business by buying more fish.

loans.use: Teo wants to buy more fish with the loan.

loans.name: Joilith

texts.es:
Every day Joilith sells groceries and goods to fulfill people's basic needs. She is a 27 year old mother of 2. She works to increase her income and convert her small convenient store into a mini-supermarket. She also works to improve her children's quality of life. In order to achieve her goals, she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad es la rutina diaria que desempeña la señora Joilith de 27 años de edad, quien es madre de 02 niños. Se desempeña diariamente con el objetivo de incrementar sus ingresos y convertir su pequeña bodega en un minimercado además de elevar la calidad de vida de sus pequeños.Para iniciar el cumplimiento de gran propósito solicita una suma de dinero en préstamo.

loans.use: Injection of funds to convert her small convenient store into a mini-supermarket

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina N. is a trader who owns a provisions store. She is married and has 4 children. She is working very hard, and business is doing very well. She wants to increase sales and maximize profit, but her problem is a lack of adequate capital.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Karikari

texts.en: Kwame is a married father with three children. His children are currently in school. Kwame has been selling newspapers and also doing photocopies for clients for 10 years now. He wants to use his loan to buy more newspapers for the community folks to know or read about national issues. He also plans to use part of his loan to buy a photocopier machine to expand his operation. Kwame is a member of the group called Paul Amantem. Members of the group agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more newspapers and papers for photocopying

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Lupita is married and has 3 children, 22, 18 and 16. Her husband, Manuel Arellano Hernandez, is a construction worker. She started working primarily to help her father-in-law who, for more than 10 years, had earned a living selling cheese and chorizo. He had just arrived from the countryside so, to help him and to help her husband with household expenses, she decided to start selling and little by little she's managed to earn a good income.

Now she need a US$700 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, so that she can stock more merchandise and buy a display case for more kinds of cheeses and chorizo. With your help, Lupita can grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Lupita es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 22,18,16 años. Su esposo Manuel Arellano Hernandez trabaja como albanil. Inició el negocio primero para apoyara su suegro en la venta de queso y chorizo quien desde hace mas de 10 años se dedica a esto, para que se ayudara porque acababa de llegar del rancho, despues como necesitaba ella tambien dinero para apoyar a su esposo en la economia familiar decidio empezar a vender y poco a poco ha logrado buenos ingresos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $ 700 que pagara en 6 meses para poder invertirlo en mercancia y comprar un aparador para vender mas tipos de queso y chorizo en su casa. con tu ayuda Lupita hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Fanny Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs Fanny, whilesearching for wayts to earn money in order to support her family, decided six years ago to open a local store out of her home. This was established thanks to the economic help from her children. Mrs Fanny does not currently have children that are dependent on her, but supports herself and her husband, who runs a hostel and also helps with expenses.

Mrs Fanny began this business with a bit of capital, and it has grown through the years and enabled her to increase the inventory of her products. She would like to continue this and her plan is to open a store, and with this loan be able to purchase clothing and cosmetics to increase the variety of the products offered in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Fanny en busca de formas que pudieran generarle ingresos para la manutención de su familia hace 6 años decidió poner una pulpería en su casa de habitación, esto pudo hacerlo gracias a la ayuda económica que le brindaron sus hijos. Doña Fanny ya no tiene hijos que dependan de ella, solamente son ella y su esposo, quien es pensionado y aporta a la economía familiar. Doña Fanny inició este negocio con poco capital, pero a través de los años éste ha ido creciendo y ha podido aumentar el inventario de su producto. Desea continuar ese crecimiento ya que sus planes son llegar a tener una tienda, así que con el crédito otorgado comprará ropa y cosméticos para poder aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece en su tienda.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is 38 years old. She is a married with 3 children between 14 and 18. She has been a snacks (carpet) seller since 2003. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Mwanaidi now hopes for a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Tamir Group

texts.en:
Tamir Group is composed of two dedicated women living in a small village in the area of Hasbaya, located in the South of Lebanon. The women of Tamir make "Saj" (traditionA. Lebanese bread). This delicious bread is very popular with their clients. Typically, it is made fresh on a large dome-shaped grill. It is used by families and businesses alike to make many types of famous Lebanese sandwiches or it is dipped in spreads like hummus or baba ghanoush. The work of these women is therefore vitA. to the day-to-day lives of Hasbaya residents. Each woman of the group has requested a loan of $300 in order to finance the purchase of more raw materials for their bread-making businesses.

Hanyah is 63 years old and is a member of the Tamir group. Hanyah has requested a loan of $300 to finance the purchase of more flour and other ingredients for her bread-making business. This purchase will allow Hanyah to increase the amount of bread she can produce. This is a second time Hanyah has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

Abir is 31 years old, single, and is also a member of the Tamir group. Abir has similarly requested $300 to improve her business. This is the second time Abir has asked for a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase new machinery and supplies for making bread

loans.name: Mayra Yolanda

texts.es: Mayra Yolanda P. Pérez Es originaria del municipio de San Francisco el Alto Totonicapan ella desde ñina fue aprendiendo el arte de sus padres el la confeccion  principalmente  la  elaboracion de playeras  hace cinco años decide inciar su propio negocio con un pequeño capital que le regalo su querida madre,  fue creciendo poco a paco su negocio y su capital, teniendo una maquina pequeña de coser, ella contraye matrimonio y deside abandonar su actividad que ha aprendio, de nuevamente ella y su esposo  hace  un año deciden aperturar  su propio negocio  en la plaza del municipio de San Francisco el Alto  por ser un municipio del altiplano en villa de desarrollo economico  principalmente en la sastreria uno de los mercado mas grande de Centro America en confecciones, y donde doña Mayra quiere formar parte de este crecimiento se deciden hacer un prestamos  para ampliar mas su capital y principalmete en la compra de telas, conos, moldes para poder surtir su mercaderia ya que se aproximan las fiesta de fin de año  y surtir sus productos.
texts.en:
Mayra Yolanda P. P. is from the town of San Francisco, and from a young age she has learned the art of hand making shirts. Five years ago she started her own business with very little capital that her mother gave her. Having only small sewing machine little by little her business and capital grew. She eventually got married and stopped working, but now she and her husband want to reopen this business in the town plaza in San Francisco in order to be part of the biggest developing textile market in Central America. Mayra wants to be part of this growth and has decided to take out loans to increase her capital, especially different fabrics, cones, and molds. All this will be needed to help her increase her business now that parties for the new year are approaching.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a hair stylist and she sells weavons and hair extensions in her shop. She makes lovely hairstyles for her customers.

Roseline has 2 children. The younger child is 8 and the elder is 11 years old. Roseline is 45 years old and she is a LAPO client. Roseline lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to buy more weavons and hair extensions to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more weavons and hair extensions

loans.name: Helena Pedro

texts.pt:
Helena Pedro M. é natural do distrito de Chibuto, província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 50 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 5Filhos com idades o primeiro com 32 anos e trabalha, o segundo com 28 anos estuda na 8ªclasse e trabalha, terceiro com 24 anos e estuda na 10ªclasse, quarto com 16 anos e estuda na 8ªclasse, quinto com 4 anos de idade e ainda não estuda. 

Helena estudou até 2ªclasse e parou por falta de condições e problemas sociais que consistira na separação dos seus pais. Passou a sua infância até ao casamento na província de Gaza e mudou se para cidade de Maputo na companhia do marido que trabalhava na cidade. Vive numa casa própria.

Helena vive de negocio que consiste na venda de cereais num dos grandes mercados da cidade de Maputo. Faz este negocio a mais de 20 anos, onde destaca o milho que adquira o saco por 850,00mt e vende por 1000,00mt e consegue um rendimento liquido mensal de 3500,00mt.

Helena tem planos de pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro empréstimo afim construir algumas dependências para aluguer afim de aumentar a sua renda familiar.
texts.en:
Helena Pedro M. was born in Chibuto, a southern province of Gaza, in Mozambique. She is 50 years old, married, and the mother of five children ages 4-32, three of which are in school. Helena's own studies were interrupted after 2nd Grade due to her parents' divorce and their subsequent financial difficulties. She currently lives in Maputo with her husband and kids, at a house they own. For the past 20 years Helena has been in the business of selling dry cereal in one of Maputo's main markets. Her main product is currently corn, which she buys bulk for 850,00 and sells for 1000,00 mt. Her overall monthly profit is 3,500 mt, and Helena plans to pay this loan back quickly, so that she can take out another one, to build additional rooms that she can rent to help increase her income.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling dry cereals

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị  Hợi năm nay 39 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị Hợi là chăn nuôi và  dịch vụ cho thuê cốt pha với tổng thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Hợi mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 để đầu tư mua gỗ đóng cot pha cho thuê.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hợi, 39 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2006. Currently, the main sources of income of her family are raising animals and renting out bamboo scaffolding and wooden forms for use in construction (molds to hold concrete in the desired shape while it hardens). Their average monthly income is 3,000,000 VND (183 USD). In the next lending cycle, Mrs. Hợi hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (550 USD) to buy lumber which she will make into construction forms she can rent to builders.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business renting construction implements

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Para El Progreso Group

texts.en:
Carmen Isidra L. is the coordinator of a group called Mujeres Unidas por el Progreso. Her group has five members. The loan will be shared by the members of the group, who run various businesses. 

Carmen is 38 years old and single. She lives with her mother and three adult children; 20, 22, and 24 years old. She runs a small restaurant where she sells sandwiches, rice and meat, other dishes, and juices. She runs this business from home, and most of her clients live in her neighborhood. She has previously received three loans from Esperanza; this will be her fourth loan. With these loans she has been able to invest in a freezer and gas cylinder. Today she probably sells twice as much as she did before receiving her first loan in June of 2007. She would like to expand her business even further and hopes that one day she will be able to employ another person to help run the business. She thinks that her neighborhood is ready for a larger cafeteria. She would also like to make some home improvements and adds that she would like to find a boyfriend.

loans.use: To expand a restaurant

loans.name: Djèkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du  groupe Djèkadi  tous mariés, ayant en moyenne 38 ans avec 5 enfants vivent dans des familles monogames dans le quartier Rails ko de Markala (4ème région administrative du Mali).
Voisines de quartier, les membres  du groupe se sont connus dans l’association traditionnelle d’entre aide Parissain qui veut dire  en dialecte Bobo. 
Ce groupe de femmes exerce comme activités génératrices de revenus, la vente du riz et la transformation des légumes (oignon tomates). Leur bonne organisation et leur dévouement dans les activités de transformation leurs ont valu un appui de l’US AID à travers des séchoirs et une machine de collage de sachets.
Ainsi dans le souci de mieux rentabiliser leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’approcher Soro Yiriwaso qu’elles ont connu à travers l’Assemblée Générale des Artisans de Markala. Après avoir bien remboursés les 2  prêts  précédents elles sont à leur 3ème  prêt de groupe (prêt solidaire).
Ce prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter, 10 sacs de sel de cuisine, 50kg de laye, 5 sacs d’oignon dont une partie est séchée au séchoir avant la vente et un sac d’arachide qui serait transformé en pâte. Elles s’approvisionnent hebdomadairement au marché de Diamarabougou  pour tous ces condiments ci dessus cités. Elles revendent en détail, au comptant et à crédit au marché de Diamarabougou et à domicile  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 11.000FCA qui sera utilisé pour acheter du savon et subvenir aux dépenses de nutrition de la famille.
 Leur ambition est de préparer les trousseaux de mariage de leurs filles.
texts.en:
The 4 members of the Djèkadi group are all married, are on average 38 years old with 5 children, and live in monogamous households in the Rails ko area of Markala (4th administrative region of Mali). Living in the same area, the members of the group met each other in a traditional mutual assistance association named Parissain. This group of women runs as a revenue-generating business the sale of rice and the processing of vegetables (onions and tomatoes). Their good organizational skills and their dedication to their business of processing vegetables earned them support from US AID in the form of dehydrators and a machine to seal bags. Thus, with the hope of increasing the profitability of their businesses, these women decided to approach the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which they found out about through the General Assembly of Artisans in Markala. After having repaid their 2 previous loans without problems, they are seeking their 3rd group loan. This loan will be used to buy 10 bags of cooking salt, 50 kg of milk, 5 bags of onions, of which one portion is dried in the dehydrator before sale, and 1 bag of peanuts, which will be converted to paste. They supply themselves weekly at the Diamarabougou market for all the condiments mentioned above. They sell at retail, in cash or on credit, in the Diamarabougou market and at home to a clientele composed primarily of women. They intend to realize an average monthly profit of 11,000 FCA, which will be used to buy soap and meet the nutritional needs of their families. Their ambition is to prepare bridal trousseaus for their daughters.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food condiments

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco se dedica a la confección y venta de chalecos, faldas los cuales vende en el altiplano, en estas fechas es cuando tiene mas demanda para estas prendas, vive en casa propia su esposa falleció tienes cuatro hijos los cuales ya son independientes su casa queda ubicada en la Calle Ayacucho, zona Puerto Camacho de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra tela por cantidad hilo encajes que necesita para la confección de las prendas. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Francisco makes and sells sweaters and skirts, which he sells in the Bolivian Altiplano. Demand for these garments is highest at this time of year. He lives in his own house. His wife passed away and he has four children who are already independent. His house is on Calle Ayacucho in zona Puerto Camacho in the city of El Alto.

This loan will be used to buy the thread and fabric that he needs to produce garments.

It is his first loan from Impro; the results from his evaluation qualified him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en: Sultan B. is a Tanzanian businessman. He runs a fruit shop. He sells a variety of fruits at Kigambon ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells mangoes, oranges, papaws, bananas, avocadoes etc. He purchases the fruit from the Buguruni fruit market at Korimako. He has been in the business for three years. Fruit demand is very high in Dar es Salaam. B. plans to runs a wholesale shop but funds are a limiting factor. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business items.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 33 years old and is married with three children. She sells clothes and shoes and she hopes to own a boutique in the future. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Shola

texts.en: Shola is 56 years old and divorced with three children. She has sold bunches of plantain (a fruit like a large banana) in retail and wholesale to her customers since she started this business eight years ago. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more bunches of plantain to sell. Shola promises to pay back her loan promptly. She says thanks to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bunches of plantain to sell

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.en: A. Abdurashid was born in 1960 in Shahristan, Tajikistan where he now works as a farmer. He is married and has four children. His main business is agriculture, which provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family. Abdurashid owns a large piece of land where he cultivates different kinds of vegetables, but due to the poor quality of the soil and the insects, he is no longer able to satisfy market demand. Very hard-working, he is asking for a loan of $1500 to buy seed and fertilizer. The loan will greatly improve Abdurashid’s income and his family's living standard. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg T. is a widow living with her 13-year-old son in Arhangay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her 13-year-old son is a student in a local high school.

She has a small retail business in second-hand clothing. She started selling second-hand clothes for women and men in 2002 at the local black market in Arhangai province. She frequently travels to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and purchases cheap second-hand clothes from the wholesale markets there.

Since the beginning of her business in 2002, she has done well and gained significant experience in retailing second-hand clothes at the local market. She says that she works hard for her son. She would like to make sure that her son grows up without any serious financial strains. She requests a loan to purchase more second-hand clothes from Ulaanbaatar for her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Eugene, a 31 year-old married man with a 1 year old child residing in Nyarugenge district of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda. This entrepreneur rents a plot in Nyarugenge market and sells men's clothes especially jeans. Despite his experience of 15 years in this business, Eugene employs 2 regular workers. He is requesting his first loan worth 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company, the partner of World Vision Rwanda.

Before this loan he used to earn a monthly profit of $84 US. He starts his daily activity at 6:30 AM and works to 7:00 PM. With this loan he will buy more clothes to expand his business and with increased profit he hopes to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Francisca Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Francisca Elsa F. C. tiene 57 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, Provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria.
Francisca se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como: cremas, labiales, perfumes, talco, etc, los cuales los distribuye en puestos de sus amistades y también los vende directamente a sus familiares y amistades.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro mas productos de belleza para aumentar su stock y poder vender con mayor facilidad y frecuencia.
Este crédito de 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos de belleza (cremas, perfumnes, talcos).
Francisca sueña con tener un puesto en algún centro comercial o mercado, para vender ropa para niños, jóvenes y adultos. Así como también para vender sus productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Francisca Elsa F. C. is 57 years old and lives in the district of Moche, which is in the Trujillo province of the department of La Libertad, Perú. This entrepreneur has finished schooling through the fifth level of secondary school. Francisca sells beauty products such as: lotion, chapstick, perfume, talcum powder, etc., which she distributes to her friends' market stands. She also sells directly to friends and family. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought more beauty products to increase her stock and be able to sell with ease and more frequently. This loan of 500 PEN will be invested in the purchase of more beauty products (lotion, perfume, talcum powder). Francisca dreams of having a stand in a commercial center or market, to sell clothes for children, adolescents, and adults as well as her beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products such as: lotion, chapstick, perfume, talcum powder

loans.name: Los Colavoradores, Group 5

texts.en:
Rosalene M. (far right) is the coordinator of a solidarity group within Los Colavoradores, an Esperanza Bank of Hope. She and her group members are from Juan Dolio, a town in the Dominican Republic. She is a Haitian immigrant, a class of people that frequently faces harsh discrimination in the DR. 

Rosalene makes her living selling clothes, something she has done for four years. To maintain her stock, she travels to Santo Domingo up to three times a week! She has taken out this loan, her third with Esperanza, so that she can afford to buy more clothes in a single trip to the capital. This would allow her to decrease the frequency with which she must travel to buy clothes, saving her a lot of money on transportation costs. 

Rosalene has six children, ranging in age from 12 to 20. Even at these ages, all of them attend some sort of school. Two of them so far have expressed career aspirations, she says, one wanting to be a doctor, and another a mechanic.

Please lend to Rosalene and her group to help them achieve their goals!

loans.use: Larger clothing stocks

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: El señor Juan N. de 33 años de edad, casado su esposa ama de casa, reside en el barrio El Paraisito en la capital de Managua, su anhelo es poder tener su propia casa ya que habita en la casa de sus padres ya que se le ha hecho difícil poder construir la propia. De joven comenzó a trabajar en un taller de enderezado y pintura, el cual adquirió experiencia y ha logrado poner su propio taller y se siente sastifecho ya que tiene dos años de administrarlo y ahora si espera ahorrar para hacer su casa ya que también ayuda al medicamento de su mama que es diabetes y es caro. En Afodenic es su tercer ciclo el cual invertirá con este préstamo, en la compra de una power que es para enderezar vehiculo y esto será de gran beneficios para dar una mejor servicio a sus clientes. Da las gracias a la institución por la prosperidad de su negocio lo cual viene hacer de gran beneficio para su familia.

loans.use: comprar una power para enderezar vehiculo

loans.name: Falelua

texts.en:
"Falelua M. (0) is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Manono Tai.  She is married and has 2 infant-aged children.  To make a living, Falelua owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community.  Falelua has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Falelua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Falelua is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD.    Falelua is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Falelua plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan is a 53 year old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon. Ghassan has owned a grocery store. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his work by diversifying his merchandise. Ghassan is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he had financial issues. Ghassan decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his income. In the future, he plans on improving his store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeurn P. was born in 1946 and lives in Proeus Leu village in Takeo province. She is a rice middle woman. She is a widow with a child who is a farmer. He owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this, her child sells palm sugar in the local village. Since her child's business is going well, she wants her child to sell the sugar door to door so Mrs. Hoeurn P. is requesting a loan to add to her saving to buy a motorbike for her child to sell sugar.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to sell sugar.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en: Alpha C. is 30 years old. He is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. Alpha is seeking a loan of 1 million Leones in order to pay school fees for his children and to purchase materials for the family's home.

loans.use: School fees for his children

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna C. is from the village of Talisay. She is 51 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Myrna owns and operates a food stall, selling variety of snacks in the school and in the local community. She is just starting this business. The two students included in the picture are Myrna's customers. In 2006, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her grandchildren. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph operates a taxi business in Naivasha town. He has been doing this for three years. Joseph is 30 years old, married to Beth Muthoni, and they have a four year old baby who is in nursery school. He was introduced to KADET by a friend. This will be his first loan with KADET and he plans to use the cash to repaint his car and buy new tires. His future plan is to buy another vehicle. He will employ someone to drive it for him as a taxi. He also plans to buy a piece of land for farming activities.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To repaint his taxi and buy new tires

loans.name: Lassiratou

texts.fr: A. Lassiratou est née en 1979 à Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Lassiratou réside depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Houinmè à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. C'est une veuve ayant à sa charge trois enfants tous scolarisés qui sont ses enfants. Lassiratou assure seule les charges de la famille. Lassiratou n'a pas été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Lassiratou vend des divers (huile de palme, huile d'arachide, maïs, poissons, etc.) à son domicile. Il y a 15 ans de cela que Lassiratou mène cette activité. C'est au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo que Lassiratou s'approvisionne. Lassiratou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d'augmenter son fonds de roulement afin d'agrandir son activité, Lassiratou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Lassiratou A. was born in 1979 in Sèmè-Podji, Benin. Lassiratou has lived for twenty years in the Houinmè area of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is a widow with three children in her care, all of whom are in school and are her own children. Lassiratou provides for her family by herself. Lassiratou did not go to school. To meet her needs and the needs of her children, Lassiratou sells various items (palm oil, peanut oil, maize, fish, etc.) at her home. Lassiratou has run this business for 15 years. It is at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo that Lassiratou gets her supplies. Lassiratou is a longtime client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), having already obtained two loans, which were repaid properly. In order to increase her working capital to enlarge her business, Lassiratou is seeking a third loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cans of palm oil and peanut oil, and 1 bag of maize

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia M. is currently in the business of selling fresh vegetables in the market. She is requesting a loan to buy other items like rice, beans, groundnuts, posho and maize flour to sell. Cicilia is 27 years old and single. She has 2 children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, groundnuts, posho and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Maria Delicia

texts.es:
La señora María Delicia, pertenece al Banco Comunal ”Santa Ana” Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 66 años, 03 hijos, los 03 ya son independientes.

María Delicia, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde atender a sus clientes. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con un capital S/. 200.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
María Delicia, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
María Delicia, 66, is a member of the "Santa Ana" communal bank, which is in Moyobamba district, Moyobamba province, San Martín department. She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are independent. María Delicia is a hard-working and tenacious woman who decided to set up her own carbonated beverage business. She tends to her customers herself with neither a schedule nor a boss. She tells us that she began with a capital investment of 200 soles and bought 5 cases of soft-drinks. When she saw that she did well, little by little she began to invest more. Currently, she has the same business and is well-known by her customers, who are her neighbors, family members and friends. With this 2000 sol loan she will buy cases of soft-drinks in various flavors, sizes and brands as well as still and sparkling mineral water. María Delicia has many goals before her and she is very motivated to make her dreams come true and to reach those goals. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed help. She is responsible with her repayments and intends to continue to be so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carbonated beverages.

loans.name: Santos Noé

texts.es: Santos Noé T. de 50 años de edad, reside en Cuscatancingo, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa quien es ama de casa y sus dos hijas. Él posee un taller de reparación de calzado para ambos sexos. 32 años son lo que tiene Santos Noé de dedicarse al mismo oficio, el cual le ha permitido durante tantos años mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante. Él es una persona muy amable quien aprecia mucho su manera de ganarse la vida, ya que hasta ahora no le ha hecho falta nada y ha sido gracias a este. Es por esta razón que santos solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar suelas, hilos, agujas especiales para reparar calzado y todo los materiales necesarios para este fin, Santos desea comprar todo este producto al mayoreo, ya que de esta manera podrá obtenerlo a menores precios. Santos es un hombre muy responsable y de buenos valores quien cuenta con el cariño de sus vecinos y con muy buenas referencias, ya que es alguien que siempre se ha esforzado por seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Santos Noé T. is 50 years old and a resident of Cuscatancingo, which is located in the Department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife, who is a homemaker, and their two daughters. He owns a shoe repair shop that handles footwear for both men and women. When he was 32 years old, Santos Noé dedicated himself to this trade which has allowed him to support his family over the years and help them move forward. He is a likeable person who appreciates his means of earning a living. Until now, he has not been lacking anything and for this he is very thankful.

Santos is requesting a loan so that he can buy soles, thread, special needles for repairing shoes, and all the other necessary materials for his job. He wants to buy these products in bulk so that he can get a lower price. Santos is a responsible gentleman with good values. He has the respect of his neighbors, presents good references, and always strives for success.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies & materials for repairing shoes

loans.name: Agbeguida

texts.en: Agbeguida G. is 36 years old and runs a hardware store called “ETS. Mon Seigneur” in Lomé, Togo. Mr. G. is married and has two children. He began his business in 2000 and is asking for his second loan from WAGES, which he will use to replenish his stock of nails, paints and other hardware supplies. With your help, Mr. G.’s business will continue to grow.

loans.use: To restock hardware supplies

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas A. A. is 42 years old, married and has five children aged from 6 months to 9 years old. Her business is located in Kibuye, a busy market in Kisumu. She has been selling cereals such as maize, beans, rice and groundnuts for the last seven years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is delayed deliveries as a result of bad roads. However, she works very hard to keep her business going well. She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy more cereals to expand her business. She hopes to increase business and supply her cereals to different parts of the country in the future. She also wants to give her children a good education. She is very determined.

loans.use: Maize, rice and groundnuts

loans.name: Luz De San Antonio Group

texts.es:
LUZ D. SAN ANTONIO
Los doce integrantes D. esta alcancía comunal son personas muy emprendedoras y responsables esto lo han ido demostrando durante los IX ciclos que están trabajando con EDAPROSPO, darles lo mejor a los suyos es su objetivo primordial entre otros. Esforzarse cada día en sus negocios para alcanzar sus metas, tal tenemos a continuación la historia D. Nancy.
Nancy a la edad D. 31 años es madre D. tres hijos, y con un esposo que le brinda todo su apoyo, comenzó en el mundo del negocio desD. muy joven vendía tripitas D. forma ambulatoria y preparaba comida para algunos choferes D. motocar, fue por medio D. estos choferes que se informó del negocio D. los motocar que era rentable; decidió entonces en obtener una motocar con los ingresos D. sus ventas y el sueldo D. su esposo que pudo ahorrar y D. esta forma alquilarlo, y cuando vio que este negocio era rentable decidió comprar una motocar más llegando obtener dos más mas tarD.. 
Cuando se vio con la necesidad D. un préstamo inmediato no sabía entonces a donD. recurrir y fue por medio D. una vecina que se enteró los beneficios que brinda EDAPROSPO. Su primer préstamo lo invirtió en el mantenimiento y funcionamiento D. sus motocars, gracias al préstamo D. EDAPROSPO le apoyó mucho y fue D. gran utilidad su ingreso fue mejorando; pero al transcurrir el tiempo y sentir la competencia D. este negocio optó por vender sus motos para D. esa forma invertir en un negocio nuevo el D. alquiler D. habitaciones en su domicilio. En la actualidad cuenta con un motocar que lo obtuvo D. la venta D. sus anteriores motocar que fue vendiendo D. a poco con un año D. funcionamiento. El próximo préstamo que le brindará EDAPROSPO piensa invertirlo en la construcción D. su casa para brindarles comodidad a las personas que deseen alquilar habitación. Los planes que tiene en mente es que tengo una buena comodidad en su casa para brindarle una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia y darle una buena educación a sus hijos para que sean buenos profesionales y que aún siendo planes para un futuro está segura que lo logrará.
texts.en:
Luz D. San Antonio The 12 members of this communal bank are very enterprising and responsible. They have demonstrated this during the nine cycles in which they have worked with Edaprospo. Their prime objective, among others, is to give their loved ones the best. They put forth great effort everyday in their businesses in order to reach their goal. What follows is Nancy’s story. Nancy is 31, and she has three children. With a husband who gives her all of his support, she started in the world of business. Since she was very young she has sold tripe as a traveling vendor and prepared food for some of the “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicles) drivers. It was through these drivers that she found out that the motocarro business was profitable. She then decided to get a motocarro with the income from her sales and what she could save from her husband’s salary. That way they rented one. When she saw that this business was profitable, she decided to buy another motocarro. She later came to have two more. When she saw the need for an immediate loan, she did not know where to go. It was through a neighbor that she found out about the benefits that Edaprospo offers. She used her first loan for the maintenance and operation of her motocarros. Thanks to the loan with Edaprospo, her income was improving. It was a big help and of great use. But, as time passed she felt the competition in this business. She decided to sell her motocarros and invest in a new business, renting rooms in her house. She currently has one motocarro that she got by selling her previous motocarros after about one year of use. She plans on using her next loan from Edaprospo on the construction of her house in order to make the people who want to rent a room more comfortable. What she has in mind is having a comfortable house to give her family a better quality of life. She also wants to give her children a good education so that they will become good professionals. These are plans for the future, and she is sure she will accomplish them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build rooms

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypov B. (pictured with her husband and sons) and her husband, Mr. Savit Uk, have been married since 1991 and have five sons. One of them is a carpenter, two attend school and the other two are still young. The family lives along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sreypov has been selling corn for more than eight years and she sells mango as well. Her husband has been driving a motor taxi for more than six years. She hopes to continue expanding her business, so she is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase mango under contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mango under contract for resale.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga es una joven de 35 años de edad, desde hace varios años se dedica  a vender cosmético, el cual inicio con apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como albañil. Procreo dos hijos, que cursan el colegio. Con el objetivo de apoyar a su familia comienza ha vender en donde se afilia con la empresa Avon, vende una variedad de productos como: cremas, de piel, cutis, cremas para arrugas, shampoo, perfumenes, vanidad, pinturas, desorantes, vende al contado y al crédito, y muchos son encargos lo cuales los clientes lo hacen por catálogos. Con este préstamo comprara más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo cual espera colocar más cada día. Con estos financiamientos aumentado su inventario en productos y con ventas mas alta. Lo cual para ella es un beneficio. Sus planes es lograr mejorar su casa ya que solo ha invertido en su negocio.
texts.en:
Dominga is a young woman of 35 years of age. For several years she has sold cosmetics. She started the business with the support of her husband, who is a brick mason. They have two children, both in elementary school. With the objective of helping her family, Dominga began selling Avon products such as skin creams, face care products, wrinkle creams, shampoo, perfumes, make-ups, and deodorants. She sells for cash or on credit, and also orders items for customers from the catalog. With this loan, Dominga will buy more products to offer to her clients, who are growing in number each day. She will increase her inventory and thus increase her sales, which will be good for her. In the future, she would like to improve her house, as thus far she has invested all her money back into the business.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Avon cosmetics such as makeups, perfumes, and creams

loans.name: Remy

texts.en: Remy Balderino, a 34-year-old rice farmer, has three children. Currently, he tills a 1-hectare farm. The income of his business goes directly towards his family. He would like to grow his rice farm business and has been busy preparing it for the next planting. However, he still needs additional money to complete the process. He thought of applying for a loan of Php 6,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 47 years old and is married with five children aged between 19 and 28 years. Two of her children are currently attending school.

Mariam is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya. She has been farming for twenty years and produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables that she sells to the local market. She is also a tailor and earns income from her tailoring services to the locals. Her biggest challenge in farming is the seasonal changes that have a negative impact on the business.

Mariam has requested this KES 30,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to start a poultry project. The extra income from this loan will enable her to meet her family's basic needs. Mariam hopes to have expanded her business in five years time and be in a position to produce more eggs and sell more chickens.

This being her first loan, Mariam is optimistic that she will get maximum benefits from it.

loans.use: To start a poultry project

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma E., 51, is from the village of Rang-Ayan. She is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns around 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Norma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Norma is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Norma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
Chen Y., 45, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. Y. and her husband grow rice and buy bananas to stock and sell for an income of USD 3 each per day. 

Y. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase bananas to stock for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Y.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: buy bananas to stock for resale

loans.name: Angel Polivio

texts.es:
Ángel de 32 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución),  el tiene una tienda (su tienda esta con rejas en la foto para tener mas seguridad en su negocio debido a la delincuencia). 

Para tener mas ingresos para su familia el tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en víveres y comenzarlos a vender a las afuera de su casa. Poco a poco con esfuerzo obtuvo su tienda y construyo una parte de su casa, trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder continuar con su negocio el necesita comprar con el préstamo legumbres y arroz para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. En el futuro quiere agrandar su negocio y adecuar su casa.
texts.en:
Ángel is 32 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran (a periurban area with a deteriorating ecosystem). He manages a store. In the photograph, his business is behind security bars in order to protect it from crime in the area.

To have more income for his family, Ángel invested his savings in provisions and began selling these products outside of his home. After some time and with effort, he was able to open his store and build part of his house. He works from 7am until 8pm every day.

To continue his business, Ángel needs a loan to buy legumes and rice in order to cover the needs of his customers. In the future, he wants to expand his business and modify his house accordingly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase legumes & rice

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 10 años se dedica a elaborar ladrillos en una fábrica. Su estilo de trabajo es de manera dependiente, ya que gracias a una amistad de su esposo logró entrar en dicha fábrica, desde entonces elabora ella misma los ladrillos que luego serán vendidos al por mayor. Pero ella vio que la mejor ventaja es comprar los ladrillos que elabora y llevarlas a diversas ciudades para venderlas a un mayor precio. Actualmente trabaja medio tiempo y eso le permite dedicarse a sus hijos. Considera que esta actividad le ha unido más a su familia, recibe el apoyo de ellos ya sea elaborando o vendiéndolos, por eso se siente muy satisfecha por esto. En adelante desea tener su propio terreno para instalar su fábrica y producir ladrillos en mayor cantidad. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece además aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, utilizará en la compra de ladrillos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Elena, age 30, lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. For over ten years she has been making bricks in a factory. She is an employee thanks to her husband’s friend who was able to get her into the factory. From that time on she has made bricks, which are later sold wholesale. However, she saw that the advantageous thing to do is to buy the bricks that she makes. Then, she takes them to different cities to sell them for a better price. She currently works half time, which allows her to devote herself to her children. She thinks that this activity has united her family more. She receives help from them in making and selling the bricks. She is very pleased about this. Later she wishes to have her own land to establish a factory to produce a greater quantity of bricks. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She is very happy knowing that she has financial support. She has always demonstrated herself to be responsible with her payments. It pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people. Also, she is grateful to the people who will make the loan she is requesting possible. It will be very useful to the progress of her business. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy bricks wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more bricks

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 30-year old married man with two young children, who are attending school. He is the main income provider for his family. He has 19 years of experience working as a carpenter. He has been running his own carpentry business since 2006. His job consists of buying woods and cutting it in different designs.  He distributes his products to different galleries and he also works on request of the clients. He has multiple catalogs to allow his customers to choose from various designs. He works independently in his business. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase additional wood for his work. With the additional wood, he will be able to increase his production and so his income. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits in the coming months.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase additional wood supply.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is the resident of a small city called Chichawatni which is located in Punjab province of Pakistan and well known for its agriculture industry. 
She is 39 years old and is married with A. W.. She is a mother of a son and 2 daughters.  Her eldest son is in 8th grade and daughters are in 6th and 4th grade respectively. It is very difficult for Samina to pay their school fee and that’s why she sews clothes for neighboring clients to afford their school fee. She started this work for her children because she doesn’t want them to face the same fate that she experienced in her childhood.
  
Her husband operates a medicine selling business. He runs a medicine shop in the market. He supplies medicines to different clinics and sells also to individual customers. He has been doing this work for over five years.  

Samina has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband in his business.  With the loan her husband will buy medicines in bulk to sell from his shop and to supply to the clinics as well.  Samina hopes that this investment will help her husband in establishing his business on a larger scale. 
Samina is a regular loan user of Asasah. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has maintained good repayment record in previous loan cycles.

Note: "In this photo, the group member Safia is knitting a cart (used a place to bed).

loans.use: Purchase supplies of medicine for resale

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Monsieur Daouda Sidibé est un homme marié de 41 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle élargie à Bougouni, dans le quartier Faraba (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, dès son jeune âge il commença les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son père.
Depuis  maintenant 10 ans, il mène les activités de fabrication de marmites, de louches etc. Il maîtise bien son activité et est très sollicité à Bougouni et dans les villages environnants.
Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers un autre client de l’institution, il décide de collaborer avec cette dernière (avec qui il est à  sa première expérience) pour acheter, une grande quantité d’aluminum et 15 sacs de charbon de bois.
Il s’approvisionne en aluminuim à Bougouni et quelques fois à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali) et quant au charbon de bois, exclusivement à Bougouni auprès des paysans producteurs.                                                                                                                                                                              La vente de sa production se fait au marché de Bougouni et dans les villages anvironnants, à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour agrandir son entreprise.
Monsieur Daouda Sidibé est un homme marié de 41 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle élargie à Bougouni, dans le quartier Faraba (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, dès son jeune âge il commença les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son père.
Depuis  maintenant 10 ans, il mène les activités de fabrication de marmites, de louches etc. Il maîtrise bien son activité et est très sollicité à Bougouni et dans les villages environnants.
Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers un autre client de l’institution, il décide de collaborer avec cette dernière (avec qui il est à  sa première expérience) pour acheter, une grande quantité d'aluminium et 15 sacs de charbon de bois.
Il s’approvisionne en aluminium à Bougouni et quelques fois à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali) et quant au charbon de bois, exclusivement à Bougouni auprès des paysans producteurs.                                                                                                  La vente de sa production se fait au marché de Bougouni et dans les villages environants, à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Daouda Sidibé is 41 years old, married and the father of three children. He lives with his wife and children in a traditional extended family in the Faraba borough of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He did not attend modern schools, but from an early age engaged in revenue-generating activities alongside his father. For ten years his activity has been to manufacture pots and ladles, etc. He masters well this activity and is quite sought after in Bougouni and surrounding villages. He learned of Soro Yiriwaso through another client of the institution, and decided to collaborate with the institution (this being his first experience) in buying a large quantity of aluminum and 15 bags of charcoal. He gets his aluminum supplies in Bougouni and sometimes from Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). As for the charcoal, he gets it exclusively from local producers in Bougouni. He sells his wares at the Bougouni market and in the surrounding villages, to mainly women customers. He hopes to attain monthly earnings of 40,000 FCFA he will use to expand his business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy aluminum

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley is a 45-year-old married man with four children aged 20, 14, 7 and 3. He makes jikos (energy-saving cookers) and metallic suitcases. He has been in the business for 15 years. He has managed to employ one person in his business. He also does farming to supplement his family’s income. He appreciates Faulu Kenya because he can now save his money. He has requested a loan of 56,000 Kenyan shillings to buy metallic sheets. He hopes to have a mega workshop in the future.

loans.use: To buy metallic sheets

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina P. is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 38 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Florentina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Florentina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Florentina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This will be the second loan that Florentina has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
