*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: G.s Mexico Group

texts.es: La señora Yamileth C. tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 13 años respectivamente. La señora se dedica a la producción y comercialización de pan, al por mayor y al detalle. Ella ya tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual nació debido a la falta de empleo que aquejaba a la familia y ya que su mama tenía el horno, ella decidió emprender en esta actividad. Ella solicita este préstamo con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de más materia prima, a ser invertido en la producción de pan. Otra integrante del grupo es Sicry Sandy, la cual tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y habita con su esposo trabaja como albañil. Ella además tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 8 años respectivamente. Sicry se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan simple, al por mayor y al detalle. Ella empezó con este negocio desde hace 3 años, que fue una época dura ya que su esposo en ese tiempo no encontraba trabajo por lo que decidieron dedicarse en ese tiempo al negocio. El negocio ella lo aprendió de su mama, la cual toda la vida se dedico a esa actividad. Ella solicita el crédito con el propósito de comprar insumos para la elaboración de pan, buscando como vender más.
texts.en: Mrs. Yamileth C. is 31 years old, married with two children of 5 and 13 years. She is devoted to the production and sale of bread, in wholesale and retail. She has been working in this activity for 3 years already, which she decided to do because of the lack of jobs for her family and because her mother had an oven. She is requesting this loan with the goal of investing in the purchase of raw material, used to produce bread. Another member of the group is Sicry Sandy, who is 27 years old, married and lives with her husband that works as a construction worker. She also has two children, 5 and 8 years old respectively. Sicry is dedicated to making and selling simple bread, in wholesale and retail. She started in this business 3 years ago, a hard time for her because her husband couldn't find a job then, so they decided to devote their time in this business. She learned the trade from her mother, who did this activity all her life. She is requesting this loan to purchase raw material for the production of bread, to try to sell more.

loans.use: to purchase raw material for making bread

loans.name: Carlos Mnauel

texts.es: Carlos Manuel tiene 28 años, su actividad económica es la venta de bananos y naranjas. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que es una persona muy responsable ya que tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo, el siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos pues para él es muy importante proporcionarle a su hijo alimento, vestimenta y estudios. Es por esto que solicita este crédito con el fin de incrementar su inventario como frutas, banano y naranjas.
texts.en:
Carlos Manuel is 28 years old and his economic activity is selling bananas and oranges.  For more than 3 years he has had this business and he is a very responsible person who has 1 minor child in his charge.  Carlos is always looking for a way to improve his income, since it is very important to provide his child with food, clothing and schooling.

This is why he is soliciting this loan, for the purpose of increasing his inventory of fruit, especially bananas and oranges.

loans.use: INCREASING HIS INVENTORY OF FRUITS, BANANAS, AND ORANGES

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a twenty-two-year-old married man, with one child. He lives in his semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Moses is very hardworking; he is charged with the responsibility of looking after his child and wife. His desire is to buy a car. He runs a boutique with an experience of four years in this business which is very feasible. He has been able to reap profits and wants to have a modern boutique in town.

He intends to invest the loan in buying trousers, shirts, dresses, shoes to sell at his shop.

loans.use: Buying trousers, shirts, dresses, and shoes to sell at his shop

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia M. D. A. D. 62 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad, donD. vive junto a su extensa familia, la cual esta conformada por cuatro hijos y dos nietos. Alicia  posee una tienda en la que comercializa productos D. primera necesidad, así mismo se dedica a la venta D. ropa, estos negocios son D. mucha importancia para ella debido a que es gracias a estos como Alicia cuenta con todo lo necesario para tener una vida estable y así mismo para aportar para el hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir la tienda y así mismo comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, lo cual es muy vital, ya que Alicia no posee competencia en el lugar, los cual es muy beneficioso para ella y debe aprovechar al máximo.
texts.en:
Alicia M. D. A., 62, lives in La Libertad department with her extensive family composed of four children and two grandchildren.

Alicia has a store where she sells basic need items.  She also sells clothes.  The businesses are very important for her because thanks to them Alicia has everything she needs to have a stable life and as well as to contribute to the home.

She is asking for funds to stock the store as well as to buy a quantity of clothes.  This is vital because Alicia does not have any competition in her area which is very beneficial for her and she must take advantage of this to the maximum extent possible.

loans.use: To buy clothes and basic need items to sell.

loans.name: Laura

texts.pt:
LAURA T. nasceu na cidade de Maputo,  capital de  Mocambique casada e mae de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola. Fez apenas 5ª classe nao continuou devido a gravides indesejada.  Vive  na casa propria com sua familia e nao sustenta mais ninguem.
Com o credito conseguiu comprar  todo o material acordado com a Hluvuku ainda foi possivel pagar a mao de obra aos pedreiros. Conseguiu pagar de acordo com o calendario estabelecido e sem nenhuma dificuldade, com o presente emprestimo de 16.000.00mt pretende comprar material de construcao (cimento, chapas de zinco, barrotes e outros) para proceder com os acabamentos da sua casa. 
Projectos pessoias  ‘e poder um dia solicitar mais um credito para construir um estabelecimento comercial dentro do seu quintal para puder vender produtos alimentares para o seu beneficio e dos seus filhos que ainda vao a escola.
texts.en:
LAURA T. was born in the city of Maputo, capital of Mozambique. She is married and has 2 children who attend school.  She only attended school through the 5th grade and did not finish due to an unplanned pregnancy.  She lives in her own home with her family and does not support anyone else. 

With a loan she was able to purchase all of the materials agreed upon with Hluvuku and was still able to pay for construction labor.  She was able to make payments on schedule without any difficulties.  With her current loan for 16.000.00mt, she plans to purchase construction materials (cement, zinc panels, iron bars, etc.) to complete her home.  

Her personal project is to one day be able to request an additional loan to build a business on her land to sell food items to support herself and her children who are still in school

loans.use: purchase construction materials (cement, zinc panels, iron bars, etc. )

loans.name: Pho

texts.en:
Mr. Pho P. and his wife, Mrs. Navy Touch, have been married since 1990 and have five children, all of whom are in school. The family lives along National Road Number 6, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Pho sells recycling materials; he also supplements this with a new tuk-tuk (auto rickshaw) business. His wife is now a garment factory worker. He hopes to support his children's further education and have a good job when they finish their studies. Pho is asking for his second loan of $200 to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: El señor Iván dedicado al servicio de transporte urbano con  mini bus se dedica a esta actividad  hace bastante tiempo realiza este trabajo rutinario  durante todo el día para así cubrir los gastos de la familia, ya trabajo anteriormente con la institución esta es su segunda secuencia demostrando responsabilidad con el pago de sus cuotas, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito, solicito este  crédito para poder cambiar todo el interior de su mini bus  para así otorgar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros, es una persona muy amable y muy trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado, en la foto el Sr. esta acompañado con su esposa.
texts.en: Iván works providing urban transport services with a minibus. He has pursued this activity for a long time. He carries out his work routine all day, so that he can cover his family's expenses. He has already worked with the institution in the past, and this is his second loan cycle. He has demonstrated responsibility in making his payments. He reports that his previous loan was helpful for him. He is requesting the current loan so that he can replace the entire interior of his minibus, in order to provide better service to his passengers. He is a very likable and hard-working person, and he is grateful to the institution for the support provided to him. In the photo, he is accompanied by his wife.

loans.use: Repairing the interior of his vehicle

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
José Elías, de 26 años de edad, reside en Puerto el Triunfo departamento de Usulután, vive con su familia, padres y hermanos, él es empleado y también vende comida rápida como tortas mexicanas, tacos, hamburguesas, este negocio tiene 5 años de existir, la idea surgió cuando ya tenía su empleo en FOSALUD como auxiliar de servicios, ya que su necesidad de prosperar y tener una vida más estable, decidió atender un negocio al mismo tiempo.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para instalar la energía en el local donde tiene el negocio, pero de alcanzar para más, espera comprar mercadería para seguir preparando comida para los clientes.
Esta inversión mejorara el negocio, ya que las instalaciones estarán en condiciones más adecuadas con la energía, al mismo tiempo tiene como propósito cancelar oportunamente el préstamo. Su aspiración es mejorar la condición económica tanto personal como en familia.
texts.en:
26 year-old José Elías lives in Puerto el Triunfo, in Usulután department, with his parents and siblings.  He is an employee and also sells fast food such as 'tortas mexicanas' (a type of sandwich), tacos and burgers.  He has been in this business for 5 years.  He came up with the idea when he was working at FOSALUD as a service assistant.  He wanted to do well and lead a more stable life and so he decided to run his business at the same time.

He is currently requesting a loan to install electricity in his business premises and he also hopes to buy supplies so that he can continue preparing meals for his customers.

This investment will improve his business since his premises will be in a more suitable condition with electricity.  He intends to pay back his loan at the correct time.  His goal is to improve both his own financial position and that of his family.

loans.use: To install electricity in his business premises

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association SIGUIDIYA du FILABOUGOU de Ouelessebougou. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans. Constitué de mariées et veuve ayant au moins deux enfants, ce groupe de femmes mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’habits et de légumes à l’image de MARIAM D.. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou dans la préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel, elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
MARIAM D., qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à Ouelessebougou, excelle dans l’achat vente de légumes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, plusieurs paniers de légumes de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon, choux, etc.).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes  et vend ses articles à Ouelessebougou et dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of the Siguidiya Association in the Filabougou neighborhood of Ouelessebougou. It brings together four women who know one another through family and neighborhood ties. They have an average age of 30 years. Made up of married women and widows with at least two children, this group of women heads different businesses, such as the purchase of clothing and vegetables, like Mariam D.. They live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou in the prefecture of Kati (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

These women have been running their small businesses for several years and their services are highly sought-after.

In the hope of meeting the growing demand of their customers, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program, with which they're taking their first group loan.

Mariam D., who is the group's president and very well-known in Ouelessebougou, excels in the purchase and sale of vegetables. She plans to use her loan to buy several baskets of different types of vegetables (pepper, tomato, onion, cabbage, etc.). She supplies her business from wholesalers in Bamako and sells her goods retail in Ouelessebougou and at the various weekly markets, for cash and credit, to a customer base made up mostly of women.

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs, a figure that will allow her to repay the loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary was born in 1964. She is a widow and blessed with four kids, none below 15 years of age. She is a hard working lady and has faced many challenges in life, such as being a widow at a young age, ill health and being unable to take care of her children. Due to all of these challenges, she made up her mind to become a GHAPE member in the year 2009.

In this same year, Mary received her pioneer loan of 40,000 XAF, and the repayment was done promptly. With her new loan of 75,0000 XAF, she plans to buy seedlings. She is sure the business will succeed because she has been doing this business for a long period of time. She has good land for farming.

Her neighbors are happy for the business she is doing because it will reduce their distances to the market and because they will be able to buy from her at a cheaper cost. She plans to use the profit from the business to plow back into the business, care for her son and provide good medical attention for herself and her son. She prefers borrowing from GHAPE because of the social services GHAPE offers, and because the method of repayment is comfortable. 

About GHAPE:  
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy seedlings

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es: La señora Giovana dedicada a la venta de productos varios ya que ella tiene su tienda de barrio  en una zona muy transitada en la ciudad esta actividad lo realiza por la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos ya que  ella es madre soltera y sola corre con los gastos del hogar . Durante el día ella sale a su venta en compañía de sus hijos, el crédito que solicitan es para poder comprar mercadería como ser: Arroz,  azúcar, refrescos, dulces, galletas y otros productos para surtir su tienda, el deseo de la Sra. Giovana es el poder ver a sus hijos profesionales y personas de bien, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Giovana works selling various products, since she has a neighborhood store in an area of the city with a lot of people. She does this activity out of necessity to support her children, since she is a single mother and pays all of the household expenses alone. During the daytime she sells with her children. The loan she is asking for is to be able to buy merchandise, such as: rice, beverages, candies, cookies, and other products to supply her store. What Giovana wants is to be able to see her children have professions and be well off. She is grateful to the institution for the support it has offered.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as: rice, sugar, beverages, candies, cookies and other products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 55 años, es una mujer muy alegre y sincera, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos menores Jorge de 21 y Miguel de 23 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente, María ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora para llegar a sus tierras, donde tiene sembrado papa, maíz y habas, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso, lleva 36 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda de abarrotes, las cual les pueda ayudar a mejorar su economía. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, está muy feliz de poder acceder a este crédito y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harán posible que obtenga el dinero que necesita. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas semillas para sembrar, además comprará abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
55 year-old María is a very cheerful and sincere woman.  She lives in her own home together with her two beloved children: 21 year-old Jorge and 23 year-old Miguel, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Through her hard work, María has managed to ensure that her farm provides her with the produce she needs to support her family.  Before the sun is up, she leaves home and walks for almost an hour to reach her farmland where she grows potatoes, corn and beans, products which she later takes to sell in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.

What María most enjoys about her work is cultivating her land since she feels that she is putting it to good use.  María has been in this business for 36 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her produce to Tarma since the sacks are very heavy and they tire her out.  Over time, María would like to set up a grocery store which would help her to improve her finances.

This is María's ninth loan through MFP.  She is very happy to be able to access this loan and she would like to thank all the people who will make it possible for her to obtain the money that she needs.  María is a very well-respected member of her community bank because of the order that she brings to their meetings.  She will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles that she has requested to buy new seeds to sow.  She will also buy manure and insecticides.

loans.use: to buy manure and insecticides

loans.name: Kakoro

texts.en: Kakoro is currently in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. She is a 39-year-old widow, with 3 children, two of whom go to school. Kakoro borrowed a loan to stock more fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes to build a house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el municipio de Tierra Blanca existe una comunidad llamada El Jicaro que se encuentra a 20 minutos de la vidriera en esta comunidad vive la señora maria del carmen que tiene la edad de 54 años, solo estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor Gonzalo ell cual trabaja en el campo como jornalero, ella nos dice que actual mente solo vive con su esposo ya que sus hijos estan casados.

Doña maria nos platica que hace mas de tres años tuvo la inquietud de trabajar en su propio negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella vende pollo de lunes a domingo en casa de su suegra ya que esta mas en el centro de la comunidad, Doña maria tiene en su casa su propio corral en el cual ella cria sus pollos y posteriormente cuando ya estan grandes los vende.

ella nos dice que necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos y alimento para poder continuar con sus ventas, ella desea que con esta inversion su negocio prospere y deje buenas ganancias ya que le gustaria agrandar su corral para poder criar mas pollos. Doña maria es una señora muy alegre y trabajadora ella se leventa todos los dias a las cuatro de la mañana para aliniar sus pollos y poder venderlos.

ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion por el prestamo que le ha otorgado.
texts.en:
In the town of Tierra Blanca is a community called El Jicaro, located 20 minutes from the glass plant.  Maria del Carmen lives in this community.  She is 54 years old, has an elementary school education, and is married to Gonzalo who works as a field hand.  Since her children are married, she and her husband live together.

Maria tells us that three years ago she was restless to work in her own business in order to help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells chickens out of her mother in law’s home Monday through Sunday.  This home is located closer to the city center.  Maria has her own corral where she raises her chickens.

She tells us that she needs this loan to buy more chickens and feed so that she can continue her sales and so that he business will prosper and bring in a good income.  She wants to expand her corral to be able to raise more chickens.  Maria is very happy and hard working.  She rises at 4:00 am every day to feed her chickens so she can sell them.

She is grateful to the foundation for granting this loan.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: EL SEÑOR MIGUEL LABORA COMO  OPERARIO ,ES ACOMPAÑADO,TIENE UNA PERSONA A SU CARGO,ES LE PRIMER CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, DA GRACIA A ESTA INSTITUCION POR BRINDALE  ESTE DESEMBOLSO QUE SERA UTILIZADO PARA COMPRA DE MATERIALES  DE CONSTRUCCION  COMO ARENA, CEMENTO, BLOQUE, HIERRO,ESTRIBO, CLAVO,MANO DE OBRA PARA REPARAR PARED DE SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en: Miguel works as an operator; he has a partner and one person in his care.  This is the first loan that CEPRODEL has granted to him.  He gives thanks to this institution for providing him this disbursement, which will be used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, cinderblocks, iron, supports, nails and manual labor to repair the wall of his house.

loans.use: buy construction materials to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
Reinaldo  vive la comunidad de Mollejones en Perez Zeledon.
El es uno de los miembros de la junta Directiva de de la empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce S.A, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
El solicita un préstamo de ₡358 000 (trescientos cincuenta y ocho  mil colones) para la compra de una computadora portátil  que es para el manejo de Empresa de Crédito Bancruce S.A
 En este momento es de mucha importancia ya que necesitan mejorar  el servicio al cliente, y así aumentar sus ingresos, esto impulsara  el crecimiento de la Empresa.
texts.en:
Reinaldo lives in the community of Mollejones in Pérez Zeledón.  He is one of the members of the board of directors of Bancruce S.A Communal Bank, one of EDESA’s 110 social enterprises in Costa Rica.

He is asking for a ₡358 000 (three-hundred and fifty-eight thousand colones) loan to buy a portable computer which will be used in the management of the Bancruce S.A. communal bank.

At this moment, this is very important because they need to improve customer service in order to increase income.  This will propel the enterprise’s growth.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a carinderia (local eatery) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients to produce food for her carinderia (local eatery) business.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. Josephine earns more income from raising pigs.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to support her family and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 38 years year old.  He is married and has 2 children aged 6 and 10. In 1996, he established his second hand bags/shoes business. He started his business because he wanted to educate his children, maximize profits and establish savings. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month. 

He would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. He has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan. He now requires a new loan to pay for 5 bundles of used bags/shoes.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, he plans to expand his trade, educate his children to university level, buy land and open another stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for bundles of bags and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cabinet to display her products.  She will also use part of her money to pay to complete the necessary paperwork to receive her degree

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy earns a living by selling bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week, selling her products at the retail level at the market. Her main business challenges include defaulters, transportation costs, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only and to provide for the education of her children up to university.

Prossy and her husband rent a home without access to electricity or to piped water. Their major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and medication. They have six children, all of whom are in school.  

Prossy has requested a loan in the amount of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas to offer for sale

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 6 y 3 años D. edad, los dos dependen D. ella, administra un cafetín, inicio por su suegra quien le enseño a trabajar con el negocio, tiene casi 14 años D. estar atendiendo el negocio, su horario es D. 5:00am a 12:00md.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería, pues quiere surtir el negocio comprando gaseosas y jugos al por mayor, también boquitas, pan, galletas y dulces, contando con esta mercadería espera generar mayores ganancias por sus ventas.
La aspiración D. ella es estabilizar el negocio, generar ganancias que le permitan tener un negocio auto sostenible.
texts.en: Rosa lives with her husband and two children of 6 and 3 years old.  She runs a small cafeteria which her mother in law started and who showed her how to manage the business.  She has been running the establishment for almost 14 years.  Her hours are from 5:00am to midnight.  She is applying for a loan to be able to purchase merchandise because she wants to keep her business well stocked with the purchase of sodas and juices in bulk, and also snacks, bread, cookies, and sweets.  She hopes that with these products, she will be able to increase her earnings.  Her aspiration is to stabilize her business by generating enough income so that it is self-sustainable.

loans.use: purchase sodas and juices in bulk, bread, snacks, cookies, and sweets.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru:
Дилшод добросовестный и образованный человек.  Он женат и ответственный отец 2 детей. С детства он хотел иметь свой собственный бизнес и стать богатым человеком. Он идет вперед по этой линии, который он мечтал всегда.  Дилшод открыл свой собственный бизнес 2 лет назад и успешно продолжает. Дилшод занимается купля продажей запчасти для автомобилей. В настоящее время Дилшод хочет расширить свой бизнес. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ США. Он надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать его. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Dilshod is a conscientious and educated man. He is married and is responsible for his 2 children. Ever since childhood, he has wanted to own his own business and become a rich man. He continued along the path he always dreamed of. Dilshod opened his own business 2 years ago and has successfully kept it going. Dilshod buys and sells auto parts. At this time, Dilshod wants to expand his business. To do so, he is requesting a loan of $3000. He hopes that lendors will support him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase auto parts

loans.name: Giscard Poget Floden

texts.fr:
M
Client âgé de 31 ans, marié et sans enfant. N’ayant pas de soutien pour la poursuite de ses études supérieures, il s’est lancé dans la fourniture des cartes prépayées et l’installation d’une cabine téléphonique.
Ses recettes sont de 50.000frs a 80.000frs par jour, 
L’octroi du crédit lui permettra de renforcer sa cabine, l’épargne et la bonne gestion sont les  stratégiques qu'il  met en œuvre pour assurer la croissance de son activité. Très optimiste, il entreprend des relations de bonne coopération avec son environnement.
texts.en: The Client is 31 years old, married and has no children. Not having the support for the pursuit of his higher education, he started in the supply of prepaid cards and the installation of a telephone booth. His receipts are from 50,000 - 80,000 frs a day. The granting of the loan will allow him to strengthen his booth. Savings and good management are the strategies that he implements to ensure the growth of his business. Very optimistic, he fosters good collaborative relationships within his environment.

loans.use: To buy prepaid cards from de MNT, AZUR, AIRTEL, WARID

loans.name: Erick

texts.en: Erick is 32 years old, married, and has four children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living for his family. He has been in the business for ten years and has employed one person. He works hard in his business to provide for his family, which includes educating his children. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money. His desire is to open a supermarket in the future. Erick has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar and maize flour

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina, 42-year-old married mother of five, is a farmer who has been growing and selling rice in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato for quite some time now. Cristina works hard to help her husband provide for their needs and send their children to school. She has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs, and hopes for their business to grow bigger.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rosemarie Group

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 32 years old and lives in Nangcaan, Rizal. She is married with two children. 

To earn a living, Rosemarie has a business making and selling bread. She earns about PHP 3600 each month doing this type of work. Rosemarie has a requested a loan of 14,000 to purchase 5 sacks of flour and other ingredients for bread-making. Rosemarie has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save her income for the future of her children.

Rosemarie is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase 5 sacks of flour and other ingerdients for breadmaking

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita is 29 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 6.  In 2004, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business.  In the future, Sunita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets and store owners sell materials and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's "kurta surwal" and men's "daura surwal".  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth, other materials, or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Domingo Antonio

texts.es: Don Domingo, tiene 60 años de edad, casado, padre de dos hijos independientes, originario de la ciudad de Estelí. El es panadero, antes de dedicarse a elaborar pan el era sastre pero un día vio que el negocio de panadería generaba mejores ingresos, pues un día se puso a probar el mismo hacer pan, con la esperanza de lograr tener su panadería, y poder cambiarles el nivel de vida a su familia y lo logro han pasado 5 años. Hoy en día su panadería es un negocio que es rentable, su esposa lo ayuda en el negocio. Es por ello que solicita el préstamo para comprar harina, aceite, levadura, manteca, azúcar , compra de sartenes y parrillas para colocar el pan, la inversión le será de mucha ayuda pues podrá tener material suficiente para los pedidos de Diciembre y aumentar su producción. Su próxima meta es comprar maquinas revolvedoras de pan , hacerles reparaciones a su panadería y lograr contratar a personas para ayudarlo en su negocio ya que en lo futuro desea ampliarlo.
texts.en: Domingo is 60 years old, married, father of two adult children, and a native of Estelí.  He is a baker.  Before he began baking bread, he was a tailor but one day he realized that the bakery business generated higher income.  So one day, with the hope of having his own bakery and being able to improve the standard of living for his family, he began trying to make bread. He achieved his goal five years ago.  Today, his bakery is a profitable and his wife helps him with the business.  He is requesting the loan to buy flour, oil, yeast, butter, and sugar as well as pans and bread racks on which to place the bread.  The investment will be a great help as he will have enough ingredients to fill December orders and increase his production.  His next goals are to purchase a dough mixer, make repairs to his bakery, and hire people to help him in his business as he wishes to expand in the future.

loans.use: to purchase flour, oil, yeast, butter, and sugar as well as pans and bread racks on which to place the bread.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a resident of Murang'a in Central Kenya. He is 48 years old and married with 2 adult children. He has been farming for 20 years. His farm produces milk and tea, which go to the local market. For additional income, he also runs a retail cereal business at the market.

Stephen has made a loan request of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to enable the purchase of a motorcycle so he can venture into the transport business. He says the business will help him market his farm produce and increase his sales thereby  increasing his income in turn. He expects his high transportation costs to go down with the funding from Juhudi Kilimo.

He mentions that transportation is very costly for farm produce, so the motorcycle will help him with cheaper delivery of his produce to the market.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sa'eda

texts.en:
Sa'eda is a 33-year-old young woman. She is married with two sons and three daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Sa'eda wants to make some home decorations such as paintings and also wants to purchase some necessary home furniture such as living room furniture and a kitchen table, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of amount $1,000 from FATEN. When Sa'eda gets the loan, she will pay to change her house by making necessary decorations and purchasing some new home furniture. This will offer her family better home living conditions. 

Sa'eda is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the picture.

loans.use: to make home decorations and purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 37 years old married man with six grown up children. He has been engaged in the farming business for seven years. He is a very responsible and loving father.

Samuel has requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer for his business. In the future, Samuel hopes that his farm business will expand to give the quality of life needed for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Fanis Maritza

texts.es:
Fanis, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 12,15 y 18 años de edad, ella junto a su esposo se dedican a  la siembra de hortalizas como: pipián, ejotes, chiles, el oficio lo empezó hace diez años debido a la necesidad y todos los días trabajan de lunes a sábado, no tienen un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes como: abono, semilla y herbicidas, para las plagas de esa forma podrán tener mejores cosechas este año.
El sueño de Fanis es tener mejores resultados en sus cosechas y mejores ganancias para poder darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Fanis lives with her husband and three children who are 12, 15, and 18 years old. She and her husband work growing vegetables like squash, green beans, and peppers. Out of necessity she began this job 10 years ago. They work every day between Monday and Saturday, and they don’t have fixed hours. 

She needs the loan to buy fertilizers like manure, seeds, and herbicides because of pests. In this way they can have better harvests this year. 

Fanis’ goal is to have better results with her harvest and more income to be able to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy manure fertilizer, seeds, and herbicides.

loans.name: San

texts.en: San, 26, is married and resides with his wife and a child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker. Additionally, he is a rice farmer. His wife is a garment worker. San requests a loan of USD 700 to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer to grow rice in the dry season. In the future, he plans to purchase clothes to resell at the factory and to send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer to grow rice in the dry season

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья с мужем и дочерью живет в Запорожье. Она занимается рыночным предпринимательством, торгуя разными товарами в розницу на Крытом рынке в своем родном городе. Наталья реализует тапочки, подарочные наборы и декоративные украшения. На рынке у нее немного конкурентов, что только способствует развитию бизнеса. У Натальи – два прилавка. Чистый доход составляет 8 000 гривен.  

Наталья планирует вложить кредит в 10 000 гривен в приобретение дополнительного количества тапочек для последующей реализации. Тапочки всегда хорошо продаются в холодное время года, поэтому Наталья хотела бы не упустить возможность заработать дополнительные средства в сезон. В следующей году Наталья планирует еще одно торговое место, если удастся получить дополнительную прибыль от реализации товара.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Natalya, her husband, and her daughter live in Zaporozhye, Ukraine.  She sells various items at the indoor market in her hometown. Natalya sells slippers, gift sets, and decorative knickknacks. In the market she has very little competition, which helps her to develop her business. Natalya has two shops. Her net income amounts to 8,000 hryvnia.

Natalya plans to invest the money from a 10,000 hryvnia loan in purchasing more slippers for resale. Slippers always sell well in the cold season, so Natalya would not like to miss the opportunity to earn extra money during the season. Next year, Natalya plans on opening another retail space if she can earn enough extra income from sales.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to sell during winter.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 36-year-old, married man with children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He first worked as a hawker, but he now owns a retail shop that sells clothes and dressmaking supplies. He has run this business for more than 5 years. His goals are to educate his children and diversify his business to include shoes. 

Ibrahim needs the loan to buy clothes for sell at his retail shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell at his retail business.

loans.name: Iradah- Caretar Group

texts.en:
This group is called Iradah-Caretar and it consists of five ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Najiba is a hardworking woman. She is married and lives with her family in their own house in a poor area. She is the leader of the group. Najiba started her business of selling blankets and curtains for the local customers in her area four years ago. She started her business with a small capital. Year by year her business has improved and most of what she earns from profits goes to the expenses of the family. She has good experience in the business. Thanks to the experiences, she deals with her own business easily. Unfortunately, the income of this business is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family, and she wants to improve it. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more blankets and curtains to resell them to her customers.

Najiba looks forward to expanding her business, and she hopes to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase more blankets and curtains for resale

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a 56 year-old married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Juanita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Juanita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Juanita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old, married with six children. Three of her children are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for twelve years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Fidencia Rossana

texts.en:
Fidencia has three childrena and lives with her partner in a small house in the city of Monclova, Coahuila. They are currently going through very difficult times as they now face a serious economic crisis. The household costs and the necessities of their children cannot be covered with the couples\' salary. Fidencia, for some time now, has been selling ceramics to alleviate the situation, and she has managed to remain stable for more than three years now. But today she needs a loan in the amount of $250 that she will repay in a term of 3 to 6 months.

With this loan she will be able to vary the merchandise she offers her clients, and this will in its turn help obtain greater earnings and therefore alleviate some of the difficulties present in their home. Fidencia and her family require your generosity, help them. You have the ability to do so. Do not doubt it any longer, they will thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Fidencia tiene 3 hijos y vive con su pareja en una pequeña casita de la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila. Ellos actualmente están pasando por momentos muy complicados, ya que atraviesan por una mala crisis económica, pues los gastos del hogar y las necesidades de sus hijos no se alcanzan a cubrir únicamente con el sueldo de su pareja. Fidencia desde hace tiempo se dedica a la venta de cerámica por la misma situación, y a logrado ser constante por ya más de tres años, sin embargo hoy necesita un crédito por la cantidad de $250 DLLS, mismo que piensa cubrir en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses.

Con este préstamo ella podrá surtir más mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes, y esto a su vez le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos para poder sanar un poco las dificultades que se encuentran presentes en su hogar. Fidencia y su familia requieren de tu generosidad, apóyalos, tu tienes la posibilidad de hacerlo, no lo dudes más, ellos te lo vana agradecer.

loans.use: PURCHASE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Mirabel Manka

texts.en:
Born in 1986, Mirabel is a mother of two, having had her first child at fourteen when she dropped out of school for lack of sponsorship. Married to a man who is also a struggler, she took her first loan in 2003 and started a koki business then later on started second-hand clothes selling, which her husband was very supportive of.

Given a loan of $800, she plans to buy in bales and sell in bulk to traders with limited capital, and continue to retail in flea markets. Her husband is determined to support her in selling some of the dresses in neighboring villages. She plans to pay loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Trading

loans.name: Estanislaa

texts.en:
Estanislaa is 46 years old. She is separated and has 7 children. She is a hardworking woman who knows no rest. Rain or cold, she gets up at 4:00 in the morning to go to the wholesale market to buy merchandise for her fruit and vegetable business. She has sacrificed much, given that despite her separation she has had the difficult job of raising her 7 children. She has put them through school, but she deeply regrets that they only completed high school, since she didn't have enough money to send them to university. All of her children help her run the business. She says that she began with a small stand, but due to her hard work and dedication, and her family's help, the business has grown. She plans to build another room in her home, since her family is very large and it's too small for them. She admits that while her business generates income, it's not enough for the construction project. The only way they can build the room is through a loan.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Estanislaa tiene 46 años, es separada con 7 hijos. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que no conoce D. descanso. Llueva o haga frío, siempre se levanta a las 4 D. la madrugada para ir al mercado D. Abasto a comprar mercaderías para poder surtir su negocio D. venta D. frutas y verduras. Es una mujer muy sacrificada ya que a raiz D. su separación tuvo la difícil labor D. criar a sus 7 hijos. Ella los hizo estudiar pero se lamenta enormemente D. que solo pudo lograr que terminen la secundaria debido a que el dinero no alcanzaba para darles una educación universitaria. Todos sus hijos colaboran con ella en el negocio. Comenta que comenzó con un pequeño puesto pero que gracias a su trabajo y dedicación y a la ayuda D. su familia logrò agrandarlo. Planea construir una habitación más en su casa debido a que su familia es muy numerosa y la casa ya les resulta pequeña. Afirma que aunque el negocio le genera ganancias, no le alcanza para dicho proyecto. La única oportunidad que tiene para llevarlo a cabo es obteniendo un préstamo.

loans.use: Build a room in her house.

loans.name: Boltaboi

texts.ru:
Boltaboi and his wife have been retired for a long time, but they can’t sit at home doing nothing. Boltaboi is 60 years old and his wife is 56 years old, they have 4 children. Boltaboi and his wife have been selling at the markets for several years. They sell onions, potatoes and carrots. These products are in high demand as they are a necessity. Boltaboi brings the products and his wife sells them. During one market day Boltaboi sells up to 150 kilograms of potatoes, and 200 kilograms each of onions and carrots. Profits are small, but they have no other source of income.

Boltaboi is a recent client of MicroInvest, but he has already shown himself to be an exemplary client. He plans to use the requested loan to purchase potatoes and onions.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Болтабой и его жена уже давно на пенсии, но они не могут сидеть без дела дома. Ему 60 лет, его жене 56 лет. У них 4 детей. Уже несколько лет Болтабой и его жена выходят торговать на базары. Ассортимент товаров – лук, картошка и морковь. Спрос на них высокий, ведь это продукты первой необходимости. Товар привозит он сам а жена торгует. За один базар Болтабой продает до 150 кг, картошки, по 200 кг. лука и моркови. Прибыль небольшая, но другого дохода нет. В Микроинвест Болтабой кредитуется недавно, но уже показал себя как образцовый клиент. Новый займ собирается потратить на закупку картошки и лука.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and onions

loans.name: Idelio

texts.es:
Idelio is 35 years old he is single and he’s a baker. He lives with his parents. More than a year ago he started his own bakery. Before opening his own business he worked at a bakery in Asuncion where he learned the trade. Currently, two of his neighbors work as his apprentices working for him and gaining money to sustain their families. Idelio needs the loan to buy flour, baking powder, and vegetable fat that are his main ingredients, for the great demand he has.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Idelio tiene 35 de edad, soltero, de profesión panadero, vive con sus padres. Hace más de siete años que habilitó su propia panadería, anteriormente estuvo trabajando en Asunción en una panadería por más de 15 años donde aprendió el oficio. Actualmente trabaja con él dos vecinos a quienes les enseña el oficio y al mismo tiempo son remunerados para el sustento de sus familias. Necesita el crédito para la compra de harina, levadura, manteca que son materia prima, por la gran demanda en el mercado.

loans.use: Compra de  harina, levadura, manteca.

loans.name: Júlia Francisco

texts.pt:
Júlia Francisco D. is a 46-year-old single mother of 4. She lives in the Infulene “A” neighborhood of the city of Matola. She is new to the program. She is a teacher and runs a business selling linens (used clothing) from her home, instead of traveling. She plans to take a loan of 5,000 MT, to be repaid in 6 months, in order to strengthen her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Júlia Francisco D. tem 46 anos de idade e é mãe solteira de 4 filhos. Vive no bairro de Infulene "A" no Município da Matola.É nova no programa. É professora e tem um negócio de venda de lençois(roupa usada) em sua casa , para além de praticar o mesmo negócio de forma ambulante.Pretende tomar um empréstimo de 5.000MT a pagar em 6 meses para reforçar o seu negócio.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira belongs to the Señor del Cautivo II Communal Bank, and she sells leather jackets, keychains, and other products. Her place of sale is beside the Banco de la Nación in the Huaraz province in Ancash. She doesn't have a defined sales stand, that is to say, she travels around.

With this loan of 1,300 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 1 dozen women's jackets, 1 dozen men's jackets, and 5 dozen leather keychains. Elvira is 54-years-old, is married, and has 4 children, all of whom are independent. Her income goes towards covering the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Elvira pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor del Cautivo II , se dedica ala venta de casacas de cuero, llaveros y otros productos. Su lugar de venta es al costado del Banco de la Nación de la provincia de Huaraz, Departamento de Ancash. No tiene un puesto de venta definido, es decir, es ambulante.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará 1 docena de casaca para damas, 1 docena de casacas para caballeros y 5 docenas de llaveros de cuero.

Tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, todos independientes. Sus ingresos son para solventar los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of leather garments and keychains

loans.name: Cristian Javier

texts.es:
Cristian Javier is 27 years of age, he is single and is a young, hardworking entrepreneur. Today he works in the transport of passengers, but he studied drawing, painting and ceramics. He now owns a motorcar which helps with successfully sustaining his home's expenses. For him, nothing is impossible. He dreams of finishing building his farm and ultimately putting in a drawing and painting workshop for children. But now he is requesting capital for the purchase of spare parts. With your support we will fulfill this young man's dreams as soon as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Cristian Javier de 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, es un joven emprendedor y empeñoso, en la actualidad se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, pero estudió dibujo, pintura y cerámica, ahora es propietario de un motocarro el cual lo ayuda con el sostenimiento satisfactorio de su hogar.Para él no existe nada imposible ya que quiere terminar de construir su piscigranja y muy a la postre poner su taller de dibujo y pintura dirigido solo para niños, por lo que él necesita de un capital para la compra de repuestos.Con tu apoyo haremos cumplir el propósito de este joven activo a la brevedad.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his motorcar. (Compra de repuestos para su motocarro.)

loans.name: Bulumagi East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Nalongo M.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to build a poultry house. Nalongo is 48 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 20 to 30, and her children go to school. Each week, Nalongo makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a new house. Nalongo has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy a cow and the loan was paid back on time.

Nalongo is joined in her small group by Suzan N., Aidah N., Resty Namudu, and Elisa G.. Suzan N. has a business in poultry farming and wants to buy poultry feed. Aidah N. is currently operating a farming business and wants a loan to buy more seed and expand the plantation area. Resty Namudu operates a farming business and wants to boost business. Elisa G. is currently in the business of rearing cows and is requesting a loan to buy another cow.

loans.use: To boost poultry business and make more profits

loans.name: Luz Aurora

texts.es:
Señora Luz belongs to the communal bank called "Women Leaders" which is located in the district of Yarinacocha in the city of Ucayali. She's 41 years old and she's a mother of 4 children. Her husband drives a moto-taxi.

She currenly has a small place where she sells home cooked meals. She gets up at dawn to prepare the dishes she will sell during the day, and then in the evenings she takes care of her children and her home.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase more basic supplies such as rice, sugar, flour, eggs, cooking oil, chicken, refreshments, etc.

Luz is very happy since her business keeps growing daily. She can provide for her children with the basic necessities. Her family is very happy for her.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Lideres, ubicado en el Jr Prolongación Tupac Amaru Mz 185 Lt 7, del Distrito de Yarinacocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un pequeño puesto de venta de comida, se levanta en la madrugada para preparar las comidas que llevara a vender a su puesto, y por las tardes se dedica a sus hijos y su hogar. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de víveres como: arroz, azúcar, harina, huevos, aceite, pollo, gaseosas, etc. Luz esta muy feliz, su negocio crece cada día, ahora puede dar a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan, su familia esta feliz por ella,

loans.use: To purchase basic ingredients to prepare home cooked meals

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu T. A. is a dealer of electrical products. He is married and has 6 dependents. Demand for his goods has increased, but he lacks enough capital to purchase goods to meet the demand of his customers.

He is asking for $525 as additional capital to purchase more goods to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: As additional capital to purchase more goods to meet the demand of his customers

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet K. is forty one years old. She is married and has four children who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking woman, who is able to combine numerous household demands with pressure from her business. She sells smoked fish in one of the busy local markets. Many homes enjoy her fish because it has a good taste and is moderately priced. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fish to make increased sales and income to support her children’s education and business. She belongs to the community group called Shepherd Trust Group. Members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish

loans.name: Phary

texts.en:
Mrs. Phary M., age 24, and her husband, Mr. Vutha Teb, age 39, who live along National Road Number Two about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2006 and have 1 son.

Mrs. Phary has been selling grocery items and vegetables for 1 year. She bought them from Ta Kmao market for resale in her home district. Mr. Vutha has been a soldier for 5 years. Currently, Mrs. Phary has a very small number of grocery items to sell, and she needs to purchase more grocery items such as wine, noodles, candy, sugar, pepper, and fish to sell to the villagers who don’t want to waste the time traveling to the market.

So she is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase more grocery items to increase her inventory for resale at her shop.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale

loans.name: Mariela Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa will finish her higher education studies this year. She is 21 and currently lives with her partner who is also studying. They rent a house and have basic services. They live in the district of Jr Grau in the province of Yunguyo.

She has been a member of the group Banco Comunal Winay Marca for 3 years, and has a loan of $300 new soles with which she bought a tricycle to rent out.

She now has a stationary store and with the credit of $1000 new soles which she will pay back in 4 months she will buy notebooks, pencils, pens, paper and ink pens. She will also offer a photocopying service.

Her vision is to work in her chosen profession, buy a house, start to rent out motorbike taxis and to open a bigger stationary store.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariela Luisa concluirá sus estudios superiores este fin de año, tiene 21 años de edad, actualmente convive con su pareja, quien también curso estudios superiores, el domicilio donde viven es alquilado, cuenta con servicios básicos, esta situado en el Jr. Grau del Distrito, Provincia de Yunguyo. Hace un año atrás llego a ser socia de banco comunal Wiñay Marca, teniendo un préstamo de S/: 300.00 nuevos soles , con lo que compro un triciclo, para que lo pueda alquilar. Actualmente tiene una librería y con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará cuadernos, lapiceros, papelería en general, plumones. Además prestará servicio de fotocopiado. El gran sueño que ella tiene trabajar en su profesión, comprar una casa, dedicarse al alquiler de moto taxis y apertura una tienda más grande de papelería.

loans.use: To buy stationary in bulk/Compra al por mayor de artículos de librería.

loans.name: Palabra De Mujer Group

texts.en:
Gelene D. is a young and spirited 18-year-old woman who lives in a very impoverished community on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo. Gelene has applied for her first loan with Esperanza International for the amount of roughly $150 USD; she’ll be using the money from this loan to go to a local flea market where she can purchase used and new clothing in bulk.

The extra capital helps her not only to purchase more at once so she doesn’t have to spend money on the transportation for return trips, but it also decreases her overall costs, which will in turn slightly increase her profit margin.

Gelene says that it is very hard to maintain a successful business where she lives, but that she is willing to work hard and never give up. With the help and guidance she receives from her loan officer she will be given new tools and skills that will help her manage her business, savings, profits and merchandise better.

Gelene is an immigrant from Haiti and had to give up school a long time ago. She hopes that with the help of this loan her business will allow her to make enough money to pay for night classes at a local school so that she can learn to read and write. One day she also hopes to be able to own her own home and land where she can raise a family.

Gelene and her story represent the Palabra de Mujer Bank of Hope; she belongs to a group of 5 women who are taking out their first micro loan with Esperanza. Each of these women has taken out a similar loan to Gelene’s, and they will all be using them to invest in businesses that range from small corner grocery stores, to clothing sales, to raising pigs and goats—on behalf of all of them, and our team here at Esperanza, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more used and new clothing for re-sale in her community.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentín M.  tiene casa propia en la zona de Munaipata, ladera norte de esta ciudad. Valentin es casado y tiene 3 hijas.

Su ocupación laboral es la de albañil en obras particulares de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja junto a su esposa que también es ayudante.
Con anteriores préstamos realizaron la construcción de una loza de hormigón armado y la estructura para una habitación nueva en planta alta. Ahora solicita crédito  para la construcción de una habitación de ladrillo sobre la loza ya construida.
Esta es la séptima vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente.
texts.en:
Valentín M. has his own house in the Munaipata zone on the north side of the city. Valentín is married and has three daughters. His job is as a bricklayer in certain jobs in the city of La Paz. He works with his wife who is also a helper.

With previous loans, they completed the construction of a reinforced concrete floor and the structure for a new room on the second floor. Now he requests a loan for the construction of a room made of brick on the already constructed floor.

This is the seventh time that he has asked for loan and the completed socio-economic analysis qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Silvana Ericka

texts.es:
Silvana de 28 años pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres empeñosas de Patay” ella desea abrir una tienda de abarrotes y verduras para poder mantener a sus dos menores hijos ya que en estos momentos se ha separado de su conviviente.
Una de sus peores dificultades ah sido superar la infidelidad de su conviviente y la enfermedad de su hijo de un año que sufre con problemas en el hígado; ella se dedica a dar pensión a estudiantes universitarios, desde hace 11 meses en su casa alquilada que se encuentra en el jirón Sebastián de aliste del distrito de independencia, de la ciudad de Huaraz.

Con este préstamo de s/. 500.00 soles que pagará en 4 cuotas, ella se abastecerá de víveres para su pequeño negocio donde comprará un saco de arroz, azúcar y una caja de aceite.
texts.en:
Silvana is 28 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank “Hard Working Women of Patay” She hopes to open a grocery store in order to support her youngest children now that she has separated from her husband. One of the most difficult things that she has had to overcome was the infidelity of her husband, and the illness of her one year old son who suffers from liver problems. She has been dedicated to renting rooms to university students for 11 months. She does this from the home she rents in the city of Huaraz. With this loan of 500 soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will supply the tenants with a bag of rice, sugar, and a box of oil.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of consumables and living necesities at whole sale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph U. owns a restaurant where he sells different cooked foods like eba, rice, amala, and drinks. He has a large number of customers who patronize his restaurant; demand runs very high for his cooked foods. He needs a loan of 81,000 N to buy more inventory which he can cook and sell to his customers. He is 31 years old and married with five children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun E., 41, and her husband, Mr. Sarin Ros, 47, live about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have eight children; four sons and four daughters. Four of them study in local school. Two of their sons are assisting their father in driving a moto-remoque taxi and cutting grass to sell as cattle feed. One daughter is working in a garment factory. The youngest one is seven months old.

Saroeun is a housewife and takes care of her children. Closer to Phnom Penh, National Road Two is lined with garment factories. At each shift change, thousands of workers, mostly women, need to be ferried to and from the surrounding villages. Cambodians use the moto-remoque, a very economical combination of a trailer pulled by a 100 or 125cc motorbike. They typically hold as many as eighteen or more people. Saroeun is requesting a loan of US$200 to level up her house foundation.

loans.use: To level up her house foundation.

loans.name: Sao's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sao Y. is group leader of five who all live in Sre Sa village in Kampong Chhnang province. She has 1 hectare where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Yong Pho, is a firewood seller in the local village. Although they try to work hard, they still live in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve this, Mrs. Sao Y. decided to ask for a loan, to add to her savings, to build a new house for her family. Mrs. Sao Y. is 40 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom work in a garment factory, while the others attend the local school. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The three members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel runs a local restaurant that provides her community with Dominican and Haitian food.  Her business is extremely successful, and she enjoys serving her satisfied customers.  This loan will allow her to build a new kitchen to expand her restaurant and provide more seating for customers.  Isabel is wonderful woman with a loving spouse.  Please help us finance her kitchen and expand her business!  Thank you!

loans.use: a new kitchen

loans.name: Rey Isabel

texts.es:
El señor Rey Ruíz es originario del municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega donde se dedica a su actividad de ganadería por medio de la compra de novillos para su respectivo engorde. Todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana el señor Rey se prepara para comenzar la ardual labora del día trasladando el ganado de un lado a otro y dedicando su tiempo a la crianza, alimentación y cuido de los animales.

Actualmente la razón por la que ha buscado el crédito en Ceprodel es para la compra de novillos de engorde. Por medio de los anteriores créditos que ella ha obtenido le han ayudado a crecer el hato ganadero y aumentar la producción.
texts.en:
Rey is originally from the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega, where he still makes a living in livestock by purchasing calves to raise and fatten. Very early every morning Rey prepares for his arduous work of moving the cattle from one side to another and dedicating his time to raising them, feeding them and caring for them. Currently, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ceprodel to purchase young bulls and heifers to fatten. Previous loans he has obtained have helped him grow his cattle herd and increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase young bulls and heifers to fatten

loans.name: Lemapu

texts.en: Lemapu F., 31, is single and has one child. She has just started planting, harvesting, and  selling bananas and taro. She sells to the village people and general public three days a week. This is her first loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (about $104 USD). SPBD loans are Lemapu’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Lemapu is focusing on improving her business so that she can better the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, chemicals, and equipment for the business

loans.name: Perfecto

texts.es:
El señor Perfecto vive en casa de sus padres con su esposa e hijos en la calle Inca Roca de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene una pequeña tienda alquilada en el edificio de la Normal Superior de Estudios de la ciudad de El Alto, donde allí instaló una tienda donde ofrece servicio de fotocopias. Con esta actividad el mantiene a su familia y puede cubrir las necesidades de su familia. El crédito que solicita será destinado a la compra de papel, tinta y otros insumos necesarios para manejar su negocio.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2007 y ya fue parte de kiva con un préstamo anterior el cual  pagó muy puntualmente, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Perfecto lives in his parents' house with his wife and children on Inca Roca street in the Tacagua zone of La Paz city. He has a small photocopy store set up in rented space in the building of the technical college, Normal Superior de Estudios, in El Alto city. With this work he supports his family and can cover their basic needs. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy paper, ink, and other supplies necessary to run his business. Perfecto has been a client of Impro since 2007 and has worked with Kiva on a previous loan, which he repaid punctually in order to be able to access additional loans.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paper, ink, and other supplies for photocopy service

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is 37-years-old and married with four children. She sells bags and clothes. She hopes for a loan of 70,000 nairas to purchase more bags and clothes to sell.
She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and bags to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
In the little town of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Carmelita T., 57 years old, operates a snack-vending business. She supports the education of her only child with the profits from her business. Carmelita has been interested in business and she wants to continue her passion while supporting her husband. Their primary customers are their neighbors. Paglaum MPC came as a financing partner for their capital needs. They have applied for a PHP 20,000 loan to purchase additional ingredients for the snacks she will sell.
Carmelita and her husband have a big wish for their child to finish studies and, above all, for their business to flourish with a permanent additional store to display their snacks.

loans.use: To purchase additional capital for snack vending business.

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr: Alassane G. âgée de vingt cinq (25) ans est une commerçante au marché central de Mbour, ville touristique située à 70 km de Dakar. Elle vend des chaussures, des effets de toilette et autres objets pour femmes. Elle marié et mère de famille  est fait ce travail depuis plus de cinq (5) ans. Avec les revenus tirés de son activité, elle participe à la dépense quotidienne au même titre que son mari ainsi elle s’affranchie de la tutelle maritale. Avec le prêt qu’elle sollicite est veut diversifier le type de fruits qu’elle  vend pour accroitre ses revenus et affirmer ainsi son rôle de chef de ménage.
texts.en:
Alassane G., age 25, is a merchant at the central marketplace of Mbour, a tourist city located 70 km from Dakar. She sells shoes, toiletries, and other goods for women. She is married and the mother of a family. She has been in this business for five years. With the revenues derived from her work, she helps meet day-to-day expenses just like her husband does, and thus, she frees herself from marital supervision. With this loan she's requesting, she wants to diversify the types of fruit she sells in order to increase her revenues and therefore to assert her role as head of household.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gilberto Antonio

texts.es: Gilberto Antonio M. en el departamento de Morazán ubicado en la zona de oriente del país.
