Gilberto tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su abuelita doña Maria de 71 años de edad, Gilberto trabaja para sostener a su pequeña familia, el se dedica a su negocio que es un taller de reparación y mantenimiento de aires acondicionados; en la zona donde Gilberto tiene su negocio la demanda es mucha, ya que a los alrededores no hay ningún otro negocio ofreciendo los servicios de Gilberto, es por ello que Gilberto tiene un clientela muy estable e ingresos diarios, Gilberto solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como gas, válvulas y compresores.
texts.en:
Gilberto Antonio Martinez lives in the department of Morazan located in the east side of the country. Gilberto is 25 years old, lives with his grandmother Mrs. Maria, who is 71 years old. Gilberto works to support his small family, he repairs and provides maintenance for air conditioners. There is a lot of demand for his services in the area where his business is located, because there is no other business offering the same services; this is why Gilberto has very stable customers and daily income, Gilberto is requesting a loan to buy materials like gas, vales and compressors.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Odsuren

texts.en: Odsuren L. is a 64 year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. All her children are grown up and live with their own family. L. and her husband Davaa are both retired. Since their pension amount of 280,000 tugrugs (equal to $ 200 USD) is not enough to live by, they have been running a retail business in selling food products through a small food booth they own. in 2001, when she began to run her tiny business, her working capital was 100,000 tugrugs. Now her working capital has increased and reached 1 million tugrugs. Odsuren purchases a variety of food products such as candy, biscuits and tobacco at wholesale prices from the local market to resell them at retail prices. With this loan, she will buy food products to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. de Guadalupe”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Rosita, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas y pollos  a la brasa, en un local  muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en el Mercado Central de la Ciudad, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 10:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papa, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Nuestra Sra. de Guadalupe Community Bank in the Bellavista district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She is 30, in a common law marriage, and she has two dependent children who go to school. Rosita decided to sell prepared meals and grilled chicken in a well set up location, which is in the Central Market in the city. She has very good daily sales because of the good flavor she gives her meals. Her stand is well known and very well received. She currently continues with the same business, and she is very happy with the work she does day to day. She sells in the mornings from 10:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. She personally waits on her customers with her characteristic charisma. With this loan for 1,000 PEN, she will buy supplies for the daily preparation of her food. She will buy things like kilos of rice and sugar, gallons of oil, sacks of potatoes, crates of chicken, vegetables, and some utensils to use in her business and give her customers better service. She feels full of life with the desire to get ahead. She has a lot of dreams and goals in her life. She would like to set up her own well equipped grocery store. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the start of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for the daily food preparation

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca runs a restaurant called 'El Rocoto' in the city of Pucallpa. The restaurant is named after a type of very hot chili pepper. 'El Rocoto' specializes in ceviche, a typical regional dish consisting of fresh fish marinated in lemon juice and spices. The restaurant is open for breakfast and lunch, Monday through Saturday. Francisca does the cooking and her adult daughter and another employee serve the customers. Francisca eventually hopes to begin serving dinner as well.

Francisca has been working with Kiva partner, Manuela Ramos, for about four or five years. She used her very first loan of 300 PEN to purchase candy and soft drinks for sale. She plans to use this loan of 1000 PEN to purchase soft drinks, tablecloths and some other goods needed for her restaurant.  

Francisca was widowed 15 years ago and has had to work hard to raise her three children, now aged 26, 23, and 21.  Only the youngest still depends on her. Francisca is very appreciative of her loans from Manuela Ramos. Her credit has helped her to expand her business.  

Francisca's dream is to set up a beauty salon (for haircuts and manicures/pedicures) in the front part of her home, which is located next door to her restaurant. She has studied cosmetology in the past and has knowledge of how to run such a business. Francisca has already purchased some of the necessary materials and hopes to open her salon before the end of the year.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, tablecloths, and other goods

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is a member of the Purple Christ communal bank. She is 45 years-old, single, and has four children. Her two youngest children who are 28 and 14 years-old live with her the her youngest goes to school at the local public school. 

Soledad works out of her house and has several different trades making sacks, weaving sweaters, making woodcrafts, and selling fabric. She began her business selling sheets and comforters with money borrowed from FINCA. Her neighborhood is dangerous and says she is constantly cautious. Her greatest enjoyment is spending time with her kids. She says FINCA has been a tremendous help to her economically and that she is learning the value of saving. 

Soledad needs a loan for 1,200 soles to buy 10 more comforters and sheets. Her dream is to open a kindergarten for children on the land she has already bought.

loans.use: 10 more comforters and sheets

loans.name: Elimenesi

texts.en:
Elimenesi is a member of the Msagara borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro, She is 42 years old woman,She is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 15,13,11,and 9 years old .

Elimenesi has owned crops business for 6 years,She works 12hours a day and earns monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Elimenesi`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania. She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more crops like maize.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,ELimenesi hopes to save more money, get more food for her family  and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more cros for sale

loans.name: Redempta

texts.en:
Redempta U. is 36 years old and is married with two children: one is 10 years old and the other one is 6 years old.

Redempta has owned her grocery store for eight years and has created jobs for two people working fourteen hours a day.

Redempta is not earning enough profit from her business. So, for that reason, she needs a loan from Vision Finance Company to expand her business by buying more lemonade, mineral water, sugar and rice in order to earn more profits than before.

Through the use of this loan, Redempta hopes to earn more profit. Then, with that profit, she plans to help her husband to build their own house and pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
A grandmother to eight and a mother of ten, Anna is a 65 year old businesswoman who manufactures and sells sisal ropes wholesale. She sells her products to retail shops that deal with ropes and has been in this business for 18 years. She is requesting for a loan of Kes. 15,000 to add stock of raw sisal. She hopes to be the main supplier of ropes in the region, and to raise enough money out of her business profits to build her family a home and a premise on which to run her business. She describes herself as hardworking.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy raw sisal.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is thirty-five year old Mohamed K.. Mohamed K. was born in a place called Rothombal, near Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. Mohamed is married with four children. All of his children are attending school, three of whom are in secondary schools and one in primary school. Mohamed is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 from Kiva lenders. This will the first loan he will access from SMT/Kiva. Mohamed wants this loan in order  to pay school fees and other school related charges for his children. Mohamed will also use part of the loan to buy house building materials.

loans.use: Pay school fees and other school related charges for his children

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita C. is from the village of Miputak. She is 54 years old. Marita is married and has 7 children. Five of them are adults and the remaining two are school-aged. To make a living, Marita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Marita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP on average per month for these activities.

In 2006, Marita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Marita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Marita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 36 years old and has been married for 10 years. She has three children, ages 12, 10 and 2. Like many of CIDRE's borrowers, Miriam is a dairy cow farmer. Her farm is located in the Mantecato-Machamarca district outside of the city of Cochabamba.

Miriam is a very hard worker because, when she was little, her father died and she was left alone with her siblings in the care of her mother. Because of the financial strain, she and her siblings never finished high school. This was really hard for Miriam because her whole life she had dreamed of becoming a primary school teacher. She loves working with children and she has a lot of patience around children. She loves her own children so much – they are her reason for working. Miriam and her husband work hard to make sure that their children have a good education and will be able to finish high school and attend university.

With this loan from CIDRE, Miriam will purchase construction materials to build a stable for her livestock. Miriam hopes that this loan will help her to increase her milk production and protect her cows from illness, as they currently do not have a place to stay dry when it rains.

loans.use: Construction of a stable for dairy cows

loans.name: Munat

texts.en: Munat sells clothes and underwear at retail and wholesale prices to her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in future. She has been in this business for 5 years. Munat is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She is a hard-working woman. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers.She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en: Agartha is twenty-eight years old and a mother with three girls. The children are currently in school. The selling of used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically-active poor; therefore, selling used clothing has created a market for many women like Agartha. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her save for her children’s future and also to rent a store to trade.

loans.use: To purchase assorted used clothes.

loans.name: Vannsy

texts.en:
Mr. Vannsy P. (pictured here), age 41, and his wife, Mrs. Sarun Ung, age 40, have been married since 1990 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of them attend school and the other two stay at home. The family lives approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Vannsy has been a construction contractor for 27 years and his wife has been a farmer for two years. He doesn’t have enough construction materials to operate his business and he wants to purchase more. So, he is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,200 in order to make the purchases.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una casa arrendada en la ciudad de Huancayo.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica a vender granos, los cuales compra al por mayor en las zonas rurales de su zona, directamente a los agricultores, y durante los fines de semana los lleva a las ciudades aledañas para comercializarlos. Así obtiene ganancias semanales que le permiten abastecerse de nueva mercadería constantemente.
Para Antonia su negocio es rentable porque lleva productos alimenticios que son escasos y muy demandados en las zonas a donde viaja, y esto la alienta para seguir trabajando por un mejor fututo.

Esta es la segunda oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con el crédito que recibió la primera vez. Con el dinero que ahora solicita seguirá invirtiendo para potenciar su negocio, incrementará su mercadería comprando más granos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Antonia is 49 years old, she lives with her husband and their three children in a rented house in Huancayo city. For the past 5 years she has been selling grains. She buys them in bulk in the rural zones in her area, straight from the farmers, and during the weekends she takes them to the nearby cities to sell them. That way she obtains weekly earnings that enable her to stock up with new merchandise constantly. For Antonia her business is profitable because she deals in scarce food products which are in high demand in the areas she travels to, and this gives her the impulse she needs to keep working for a better future. This is the second time in which she has a loan from MFP, which shows she was a very responsible person with the loan she got the first time. With the money she now asks for she will continue investing to boost her business. Se will increase her merchandise buying more grains wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory: grains

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en: JalA. has owned a car electricA. systems repair shop in his town since 2005. He’s 23 years old and single. This young man caters to a wide range of clientele in his village and surrounding neighborhoods.  He has a great demand for his shop because he's very talented in his occupation and clients trust him. That’s why he is asking to borrow US$ 1,200 to buy more tools because his business operation is remarkably developed. He wants to better satisfy the needs of his clients.

loans.use: buy more tools

loans.name: Sinatou Laure

texts.fr: A. Sinatou Laure est née en 1945 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Mariée à SOHE Wassi, Sinatou Laure est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés.  La famille vit ensemble au quartier SENADE à Cotonou.  Sinatou Laure n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Sinatou Laure vend des sacs de charbon à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Sinatou Laure s’approvisionne.  Sinatou Laure a 20 ans d’expérience dans ce domaine.  Sinatou Laure n’a encore jamais bénéficié de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité afin de mieux satisfaire la demande nombreuse des clients, Sinatou Laure sollicite un premier prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sinatou Laure A. was born in 1945 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Wassi Sohe, Sinatou Laure is the mother of three children, all of whom went to school. The family lives together in the Senade quarter of Cotonou. Sinatou Laure never went to school. To meet her needs, she sells sacks of charcoal from her home. Sinatou Laure gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has 20 years of experience with this type of work. Sinatou Laure has never before been the recipient of a loan from ALIDé. With the goal of expanding her work and better satisfying the numerous demands of her clients, Sinatou Laure is asking for her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Mr. Sorn Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan extends to seventeen people who are villagers in Krarng Roluos village in Kandal province. The group members will use their portion of the loan for many different purposes, and they have selected Mr. Sorn S., a village bank president, as the group leader for the loan. 
  
Mr. Sorn S. and his wife, Mrs. Sor Oriem, are farmers who own 1 hectare of land to cultivate rice for supporting their family. In the rice field, they have some problems because the field has infertile soil and is far from irrigation system. Thus, in order to improve rice production, Mr. Sorn S. is seeking a loan to purchase fertilizer and gasoline. Through their farming, the couple supports five children, four of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the fifth helps the parents with the farming.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Nazarova Buzaynap`s Group

texts.ru:
Главной особенностью данной группы является то, что все участники работает в сельской больнице. 
Бузайнап является лидером данной группы. Ей 55 лет, она замужем. Ее супруг работает автошколе инструктором. У нее 3 сыновей. Старший сын помогет по хозяйству, младший сын школьник, а второй сын находится в России на заработках. Сама клиент работает массажисткой. Кредит запрашивается для закупа одной коровы для откорма.

Айгуль, 28, замужем.  Ее супруг находится на заработках в России. Старшие двое детей школьники и помогают по хозяйству своей матери. Клиент сама работает медсестрой. В данное время она проживает с детьми в недостроенном доме, в планах полностью закончить стройку дома. Кредит запрашивается для закупа одного теленка.

Урмат 45 лет. Она разведена, у нее двоей детей: сын и дочь. Она работает медсестрой. Кредит нужен для купить коз и начать бизнес по откорму и перепродажи скота. 

Темиркан 50 лет. Она также разведена, у нее два сына. Оба находятся в Бишкеке, старший работает специалистом по компьютерной диагностике авто, а млдший учится в юридической академии. Она также работает медсестрой. В прошлом году она начала бизнес по откорму живности.За это время она смогла увеличить поголовье скота, сейчас у нее имеется корова с теленком. Кроме этого она обеспечивает себя и соседей молоком. Кредит запрашивается для закупа 2 овец.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
The main distinction of this group is the fact that all of its participants work at the village hospital. Buzaynap is the leader of this group. She is 55 years old and married. Her husband works as an instructor at a driving school. She has 3 sons. The oldest son helps with the household, youngest is a school student, and the middle son works in Russia. Buzaynap works as a massage therapist. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of one cow to fatten. Aygul is 28, married. Her husband is in Russia for work. Two of the oldest children are school students and help their mother with the household. Aygul works as a nurse. She currently lives with her children in an unfinished house and plans to complete the construction of the house. She is requesting the loan to buy one calf. Urmat is 45 years old. She is divorced and has two children: son and daughter. She works as a nurse. Urmat needs a loan to buy goats and start a business of raising and selling livestock. Temirkan is 50 years old. She is also divorced and has two sons, both of whom are in Bishkek. The oldest son works as a specialist in automotive computer diagnostics, and the youngest attends a law academy. Temirkan also works as nurse. Last year, she started a livestock fattening business. Since then, she was able to increase the livestock headcount and now has a cow with a calf. Besides, she also provides milk to herself and her neighbors. She is requesting the loan to buy 2 sheep.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Don Ricardo S. se dedica a la venta de repuestos de bicicleta y a su vez reparación de las mismas desde hace 9 años. Anteriormente trabajaba para la Compañía Licorera pero a él lo sacan y con su liquidación decide poner su propio negocio, don Ricardo es casado y con 3 hijos los cuales están edad escolar, su esposa es profesora de educación primaria desde hace 20 años. 
A don Ricardo se le han otorgado 31 créditos desde el año 2004 trabaja con Ceprodel para invertir más en el negocio, ya que el vende repuestos y él mismo las repara.
texts.en:
Don Ricardo S. se dedica a la venta de repuestos de bicicleta y a su vez reparación de las mismas desde hace 9 años. Anteriormente trabajaba para la Compañía Licorera pero a él lo sacan y con su liquidación decide poner su propio negocio, don Ricardo es casado y con 3 hijos los cuales están edad escolar, su esposa es profesora de educación primaria desde hace 20 años. A don Ricardo se le han otorgado 31 créditos desde el año 2004 trabaja con Ceprodel para invertir más en el negocio, ya que el vende repuestos y él mismo las repara.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de Repuestos de Bicicleta (rines, tuercas, asientos, manubrios, llantas, rayos, etc.)

loans.name: Enelyn

texts.en:
Enelyn owns a store that sells farm supplies. She also manages a rice field in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. It’s her only way of earning an income for her family. Her businesses are improving with the help of micro-finance. She requested a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to help finance her businesses. 

She is a mother of 2 children and wishes them to earn a degree. She’s asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos to support her businesses.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Ngariba Ole

texts.en:
Ngariba Ole N. is 41 years old. He is married to Nataana N. and he is the father of two school-going children. 

Ngariba is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last seven years.

Ngariba was introduced to KADET by colleagues who are already KADET registered clients. This will be his second loan. He is planning to plant twenty acres of wheat which has proved to be doing very well in this area and keep some sheep for fattening to sell later.

With the profits Ngariba hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and sheep rearing.

Ngariba’s future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can be planting more wheat for commercial purposes.

Ngariba’s hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer both in wheat farming and sheep rearing. He is a hardworking man and, with the right resources, he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To plant twenty acres of wheat and raise sheep

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma G. is 38 years old and lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband and four young children.  To supply additional income for her family, Vilma has opened a food vending business in her neighborhood.

She has enjoyed profits from her food vending business, and so she has been able to sustain the needs of her four children and improve their lives. With that, Vilma is encouraged to work harder and aim further for her business, partly using the loans she can access to support her business. Therefore, Vilma wants to take this opportunity to grow her business by requesting for another loan of 15,000 PHP from our Kiva lenders for an additional business capital. She wants to buy a larger volume of supplies for her food vending business so as to attract more clients and secure the loyalty of her regular customers.

Her long term goals are to have a successful food vending business, help fund the college education of her siblings, and support her family financially.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve business success with her new entrepreneurial endeavor. Vilma’s desire to give her children a brighter future fuels her dedication to her business.

loans.use: To buy a larger volume of supplies for her food vending business

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Shamim Akhtar lives in a mid-sized city called Vehari, Pakistan. Her husband works in the fields while her son runs a grocery shop at the market. He started the grocery shop ten years ago to financially support his family, leaving his education. He spent his time growing his business. His family appreciates his struggle and caring attitude towards them.  

These days, his shop needs renovation and more stock to fulfill the needs of the clients. Shamim has applied for a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) for her son. With the loan amount he will buy the necessary items such as rice, lentils, and cooking oil, and renovate his grocery shop.   

Shamim is applying for a loan for the first time and is hopeful that her son’s income will increase and her family will be able to enjoy a better standard of living. 

Note: In this photo, Fatima, a group member of Shamim's, is showing off her washing machine which she bought with the profit from the first loan which she received from Asasah.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for her son's grocery shop

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 61 años reside en municipio El  Divisadero departamento de Morazán, vive con su hijo Israel y su sobrina Carolina, tiene su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortilla de maíz. 
Ella aprendió el oficio muy joven y con su venta de tortillas le ayudado a su hijo a estudiar hasta 9° grado ya que después ellos tenían que dedicarse a trabajar por la condiciones económicas para ayudar a los gastos familiares, Gloria necesita un préstamo para compra de materiales los cuales obtendrá a un precio más bajo, ella compraria, Maíz, leña, cal, gas, esto contribuirá a continuar con la  venta y obtener ingresos para solventar las necesidad básicas.
Las aspiraciones de Gloria son ayudar a su sobrina para que termine sus estudios, para que tenga una mejor oportunidad en la vida, y ayudar a mejorar la calidad vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria is 61 years old and lives in El Divisadero, a municipality in the department of Morazán, with her son Israel and niece Carolina. She runs a business making and selling corn tortillas. She learned the trade when she was very young. By selling tortillas she helped her son to study as far as the 9th grade, after which time he had to start working to contribute to the household costs, due to the economic conditions. Gloria needs a loan to buy materials at a lower price – she would buy corn, firewood, lime and gas. This will help her continue selling her tortillas and make an income to cover their basic needs. Gloria hopes to help her niece finish her studies, so that she can have better opportunities in life, and to help improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, wool, firewood, lime and gas.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra.  María Teresa T. madre  de familia  de dos  hijos  y estos  se encuentra en edad escolar.
El préstamo solicitado es para  utilizarlo en la compra de materiales de construcción: piso, cemento, arena y mano de obra.
Doña María dice que toda la plata  que ha trabajado  con Ceprodel  la ha utilizado en el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación, y ha mejorando su hogar de acuerdo a sus posibilidades de sus ingresos y los prestamos brindados.
texts.en:
María Teresa T. is the mother of two children who are currently of school age. She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as flooring, cement, and sand, as well as labor. María says that she has used all of the funds she has received from Ceprodel to improve the house where she lives; she has improved her home in accordance with the opportunities provided by her income and the loans granted to her.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving her home and replacing the floor

loans.name: Blessing Development Group-Kampala

texts.en: It is good to know that one can make decisions running their own business, which is what 27-year-old M. Stephern discovered five years ago when he started a secretarial bureau. Prior to that, he was like many other young jobless Ugandans who spend their days looking for jobs. He did secretarial studies as a course at the university. His customers are mostly students around Mpigi Town. In a week, he makes as much as 200,000 shillings and also ekes out more profit from selling crops like maize. Happily married, he has no children yet so his responsibilities are limited. With this loan, he will be able to buy one more computer to make his work easier.

loans.use: The purchase of  a new computer

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita G. is from the town of Talibon. She is 46 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she operates a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish at the market. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over twelve years.

Lolita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to repair the fishing boat. This will be her 1st loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to repair the fishing boat

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag is 35 years old and lives with her husband, son and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They own a plot of land and a small house in the suburb of Ulaanbaatar. Two children attend a local secondary school. Tungalag and her husband have run a building material retail business since 2006. Once a month she or her husband travel to Ereen, the Chinese city on Mongolian border, and buy necessary building materials to resell in Ulaanbaatar city for a profit. In the off building season (winter time), she just orders the essential materials from her sister to bring from China. They also buy plumbing materials, 2 to 3 times a week, from a wholesale point and resell them. They rent a stall in Hermes Center, one of the biggest and most crowded building material retail and wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar. 

Tungalag future plan is to extend her business as a wholesaler and to build a bigger house for her family. The reason she is asking for this loan is to increase her working capital, which will bring more profit for the business and family.

loans.use: To increase her working capital and buy more inventory for her stall

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie F. is from the village of Talic, Oroquieta City. She is 46 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling biscuits, candies, toothpaste, shampoo, soap and other dried goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $92 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Rosie is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 5th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anara

texts.en:
Anara B. is 39 years old. She has three children: two sons, the elder of which is serving in the army, and one daughter of school age. Her husband works as an electrician at the state power plant. In 2005, in order to support her family, Anara began her business of selling lingerie with the initial capital of 15,000 KGS. She worked hard and managed to expand the range of goods and raise her floating capital. With the revenues, she was able to pay for education for her second son. 

Anara will use this loan of 52,000 KGS to broaden the range of products she sells. With the revenues, she plans to give a good education to her daughter. Anara dreams of buying a car for her family in the future. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase goods for reselling

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 47 años de edad, es viuda y reside junto a una de sus hijas en el distrito pesquero de San José, una zona que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad, prendas de vestir y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Ella se vale de este negocio para solventar sus gastos y sacar adelante a su familia. Juana es una mujer que se ha mostrado optimista ante la adversidad y ha decidido dar todo su esfuerzo para salir adelante. Su esposo era pescador y falleció junto a otros pescadores en un accidente en altamar.

Actualmente el negocio cuenta con una clientela estable que siempre prefiere comprar los productos en su establecimiento debido al buen trato que suele brindar a sus clientes. Ella desea seguir creciendo como empresaria. Por ello ha decidido ampliar su bodega para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Siguiendo su objetivo ha ceído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Las personas que la conocen le tienen mucha estima y respeto. Juana es una mujer tranquila y bastante honrada.
texts.en:
Juana is 47 years old, she is a widow and she lives together with one of her daughter in the fishing district of San Jose. It is a region within the province of Lambayeque, more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

For the past 5 years she has been selling general store products, clothing items, and grocery store items from a store located in a section of her home. She values her business very much because she is able to cover her expenses and she is able to provide for her family. Juana is a woman that has demonstrated to be an optimist in the face of adversity, always willing to do all she can to make it through. Her husband was a fisherman but he passed away along with other fishermen in an accident in the high seas. 

She has earned on a stable client base who always patronize her to purchase the products in her store, especially for the excellent customer service. She wishes to keep growing as a small business owner. To reach her goal she wants to expand her general store and meet the client demand. She has requested a first time loan of Edpyme Alternativa for a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. 

Those who know her respect her and care of her very much. Juana is a very calm and honest person.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Chicas Poderosas De Puente Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Chicas Poderosas D. Puente,  se ubica en L. comunidad D. puente D. ixtL. en el estado D. Morelos  en México. Esta comunidad se distingue por su historia, en el siglo XVI se construyó el puente que aún existe a un lado del palacio municipal y que servía para comunicar el puerto D. Acapulco y L. Ciudad D. México,  D. ahí que esta comunidad tiene el  nombre D. puente y el grupo también lo retoma para su denominación. El grupo está conformado por  11 integrantes. Cabe mencionar que recientemente se descubrió una zona arqueológica en esta misma localidad. Araceli F.  es L. tesorera del grupo, elL. se dedica a L. venta D. hilos, estambres y servilletas bordadas, negocio que inicio hace 11 años, solicita el préstamo para comprar estambres y teL. para L. elaboración D. servilletas. Araceli tiene 34 años, estudio L. licenciatura D. español, es soltera, no tiene hijos, al momento D. solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta, ya que va a poder comprar estambres que le hacían falta, quiere este crédito para tener mayor surtido D. mercancía y poder bordar mas servilletas, con las ganancias que obtenga espera ayudar a L. manutención D. sus padres ya que sólo dependen económicamente D. elL..
texts.en:
This group is called Chicas Poderosas D. Puente. The women live in the community of Puente D. IxtL. in Morelos state, Mexico. 

The community is well known because of its history. In the XVI century a bridge was built which used to link the port of Acapulco and Mexico City. It still exists today on one siD. of the Palacio Municipal. The community took its name from the bridge as did the group. 

The group has eleven members.

It should be noted that the an archeological site has recently been discovered in this area

Araceli F. is the group’s treasurer. She earns a living by selling thread, yarn, and embroidered napkins, a business she started eleven years ago. Araceli is seeking a loan to buy yarn and fabric to make the napkins. She is 34 years old, studied Spanish at university, is single and doesn’t have any children. She is happy right now as she is going to be able to buy yarn with the loan, have a greater range of stock, and be able to embroider more napkins. With the money she earns, she hopes to proviD. financial support for her parents. She is their sole means of support.

loans.use: to buy yarn and fabric for her embroidery business

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en: Priscah is 26 years old. She sells fish in one of the largest markets in Nairobi. She employs two people and her customers are reliable and loyal. She has been in this business for seven years and hopes to diversify into selling kerosene in the future. She describes herself as hardworking and determined to succeed. Priscah is married and a mother of five. She plans to be selling fish wholesale in five years time. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to add stocks of omena (baby fish) and tilapia to her business.

loans.use: To add stock of omena (baby fish) and tilapia

loans.name: Lourdes Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lourdes de 23 años,(en la foto esta en una peluqueria ofreciendo sus productos) es comerciante informal de venta de ropa y cosméticos. Vive con su hijo en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores.  

Ella tuvo que conseguir una actividad económica para general dinero y así poder mantener a su hijo. Fue entonces que decidió invertir sus ahorros en ropa y cosméticos para venderlo a sus vecinos y conocidos. Poco a poco con esfuerzo ella ahora tiene una cartera de clientes definida a quienes les reparte la ropa y  cosméticos. Tiene distintos horarios de trabajo y en ocasiones da crédito para vender los cosméticos.

Para seguir con la venta de su mercadería ella quiere comprar ropa y cosméticos para incrementar su capital de trabajo. En el futuro quiere incrementar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 23 years old. In this photo she is in the beauty parlor selling her products. She is a roving businesswoman who sells clothes and cosmetics. She lives with her son in a city called Orquidas (Orchids) because when the city was discovered there were a lot of flowers there. They now have a park with these varieties of flowers.
Lourdes had to find a way to make money in order to support her son. This is why she decided to invest her savings in clothes and cosmetics. She has different work hours and, at times, she gives out credit in order to sell her cosmetics.
In order to continue to sell her merchandise she would like to buy more clothes and cosmetics in order to increase her working capital. In the future she would like to increase her inventory.

loans.use: Cosmetics, clothes

loans.name: Machaj Mara Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “MACHAJ MARA” está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de VILLA EXALTACIÓN. Cuenta con nueve integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, la señora Dionicia, por la tesorera, la señora Leonarda y como secretaria de actas Wilma.  Los negocios de las señoras están relacionados con el comercio, producción  y servicio, como ser: venta de vísceras y otras menudencias de vaca, venta de fruta, venta de CD`s, confección de poleras, tienda de pastelería, venta de comida, venta de medias.

La señorita Dionicia presidenta de la asociación “Machaj Mara”, es una mujer joven de 27 años soltera.  Ella comenta que su negocio consiste en la venta de fruta desde hace mas de cinco años, su madre fue quien le enseñó. Es más no sólo vende la fruta sino que también viaja a Nor yungas para traerla. Realiza las ventas de lunes a domingo desde la 1 de la tarde hasta las 6 de la tarde, en la zona de Villa Dolores.  Ella cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita crédito, con ese dinero espera comprar mayor cantidad de fruta.
Cuando le consultan sobre  qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde con prudencia “recién voy a saber”, por lo pronto el crédito es lo que le ha hecho formar parte de su banca comunal.
texts.en:
The Village Bank "MACHAJ MARA" is entering its first cycle in the coordination center VILLA EXALTACION.  It has nine members. The board is composed of the president, Mrs. Dionicia,  the treasurer, Mrs. Leonarda and as recording secretary Wilma. The women's businesses are related to trade, production and service, such as: sale of internal organs and other offal from cows, selling fruit, selling CD`s, making shirts, pastry shop, selling food, selling means of communication.

Miss Dionicia, president of the association "Machaj Mara", is a young woman 27 years old and single. She says that her business is selling fruit for over the past five years. Her mother taught her how to do this. Moreover, she not only sells the fruit but also travels to Nor Yungas to bring fruit back. She sells from Monday to Sunday from 1 pm to 6 pm at the Villa Dolores. She has the help of her sister.

This is the first time she applies for a loan.  With the money she hopes to buy more fruit. When asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded with caution "I will know soon", for right now the loan is what has made her become part of the community bank.

loans.use: Purchase Fruits

loans.name: Loem's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan includes nine members living in Run village in Kandal province. The members selected Mrs. Loem S. M., a 33-year-old married woman, as the village bank president. The members of this group hope to increase their income and improve the family living through these loans. 

Mrs. Loem S. M. stays at home, cooking and caring for her family. Her husband, Mr. Bun Vorn, is 46 years old.  He works as a motorbike taxi driver, earning a small income to support his family.

In order to increase their income and improve the family’s conditions, Mrs. Loem S. M. would like to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.
 
This couple has three children: one is a seamstress in a garment factoR. and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Henrry Marcelino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES  UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Henrry Marcelino; el tiene 36 años de edad es conviviente; el socio se dedica a la construcción él trabaja en cada diferente obra que le solicitan y de esta manera el socio saca a su familia adelante, es la única actividad que realiza el socio por el momento y espera aperturar un nuevo negocio que signifique un nuevo ingreso para el futuro, por ahora está trabajando duro para ahorrar algo más de dinero. 

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar una mezcladora para su trabajo y algunas veces alquilarlo a alguna obra.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Mujeres Unidas" ["United Women"] communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr Henry Marcelino. He is 36 and lives with his partner. He works in construction, on every job that is offered. This is how he supports his family. This is his only source of income at the moment, and he hopes to open a new business as a new source of income in the future. At the moment he is working hard to save more money.

He is requesting this loan to purchase a mixer which he will use for his work and also rent out sometimes.

He is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of the quotas.

loans.use: to purchase a mixer for his work, and also for renting out sometimes.

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es:
Doña Aura Lila S. L., es trabajadora de una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillado, desempeñando el cargo de Analista de Reclamo, desde hace un año y un mes.

Es Soltera, de 30 años de edad, no tiene ninguna persona a cargo, ella vive en la ciudad de Managua, en el Municipio de Managua.

Este es el primer crédito que está solicitando a CEPRODEL, el cual lo necesita para cubrir gastos universitarios. Agradece a CEPRODEL ya que este préstamo le permitirá salir de estos gastos universitarios.
texts.en:
Aura Lila S. L. has been working for a year and month as a customer service representative for a company that manufactures water pipes and plumbing fixtures.

She is 30 years old and single, with no dependents and lives in Managua.

This will be her first loan through CEPRODEL, which she needs to cover her university expenses.  She is grateful to CEPRODEL because this loan will allow her to pay her expenses.

loans.use: Tuition

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en:
Maginga M., who is in his late forties, is married with 7 children. He has been running a bar business for 5 years. He works from 4pm (afternoon) to 10pm.  He works for 6 hours and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Maginga's 6th loan from Tujijeng Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy chairs and tables, and he expanded the bar hall.  He has paid back the loan successfully.  He wants a loan to top up the products which are out of stock, and the drinks especiA. because they sell out fast. His dream is to open a hardware shop.

Maginga will share this loan with the Ulezi loan group, which has a total of 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the picture, Maginga is the first man on the left.

loans.use: To increase stock for bar business

loans.name: Santa Rosita De Huaytara Group

texts.en:
The rural community bank “Santa Rosita Huaytara” is in its 3rd loan cycle. The group is located in the Huaytara community of Huancavelica province in Peru. Some of their members have stores where they sell a range of products, some sell dairy products, and others are dedicated to livestock. 

Solange is a member of the bank and has 2 children with her live-in partner. Her children are both studying. She works as a secretary for the local government and also sells cosmetic products. She will be using her loan of 1,000 PEN to buy cosmetic products and find outlets to sell them. 

Solange wants her children to continue studying, and to grow her business. Since becoming a member of FINCA Peru she has learned to save and to work harder, moving forward in her business. She would like to find a spa to sell her cosmetic products.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Alicia Stella

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” COMUZONE III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia; la socia tiene 28 años de edad, casada y tiene 1 hijo; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida ella tiene su puesto en el centro comercial confraternidad esto se encuentra ubicado por el centro de la ciudad ella realiza lo que son almuerzos y algunos platos extras, la socia a la vez vende productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar de insumos para la comida que vende como arroz, aceite, fideos entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Her name is Alicia and she is a member of the communal bank, Comuzone III.  This bank is located in the Cusco District, pertaining to the Province and Department of Cusco.  

She is 28 years old, married, and has 1 son.  She alternates between her food business and her cosmetic business.  She has a food stall in a shopping center located in the center of the city where she makes lunches and other plates.  She also sells beauty products, such as creams, perfumes, and colognes.  She is a very cheerful person with a great desire to move forward.  

She is seeking a loan in order to be able to purchase supplies to make the food that she sells, like rice, oil, and noodles amongst other items.

She is happy about the credit and promises to fulfill all of the payments.

loans.use: To purchase supplies needed to make and sell food, such as rice, oil, and noodles amongst other items.

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es: Roger Antonio tiene 34 años, es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de su trabajo. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de costura, hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, desde joven él se dedicaba a un taller y le pagaban por producción, pero como no ganaba suficiente para sufragar los gastos decide establecer su propio negocio. Este financiamiento es para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas, tijeras, aceite, herramientas ya que actualmente tiene pedidos de faldas, pantalones, vestidos, trajes y camisas. Sueña con agrandar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en: Roger Antonio is a 34-year-old man who is very responsible and enjoys his job. He has been providing sewing services for a living for over 10 years. Ever since he was young, he worked in a factory where he received output-based pay. However, because he did not earn enough to cover his costs, he decided to set up his own business. This loan will be used to purchase fabric, thread, needles, scissors, sewing machine oil, and tools because people have ordered skirts, pants, dresses, suits, and shirts. He dreams of expanding his business and improving the quality of his products.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, needles, scissors, sewing machine oil, and tools.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Riza works hard to support her family.  She has a crab business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending & food vending.  Riza is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase more crabs to sell for her business.

Riza has sustained her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more crabs to sell

loans.name: Santos Prisila

texts.es:
Santos Prisila de 44 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa ubicada en Playas. 

Ella tiene la tienda hace 20 años atrás, comenzó comprando bebidas, confites, azúcar. Desde ese tiempo ella ha continuado trabajando para mantener a sus dos hijos de 4 y 10 años, vendiendo toda clase de víveres. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder incrementar su mercadería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo bebidas, lácteos, verduras. En el futuro quiere ampliar y surtir mas su tienda para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos Prisila is 44 years old; she is a hardworking woman that has a small supply store in the front of her home, located in Playas.

Santos has had the store for over 20 years and began by buying beverages, candy and sugar to sell. Since that time she has continued to work to support her two children of 4 and 10 years of age by selling all types of supplies. She works from 6:00 a.m. until 8 p.m. everyday.

To be able to increase her merchandize, Santos, wants to buy beverages, dairy products and vegetables with the loan. In the future she would like to expand and stock her store to give her children a better future.

loans.use: buy beverages, rice, dairy and vegetables.

loans.name: Virma Cumanda

texts.es:
La Señora Virma es socia del banco comunal Poloma vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus bellos paisajes y naturaleza, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura. Mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.
 
Doña Virma tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 10 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en escuela. Su esposo labora en un taller de carpintería, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia. 

La Señora. Virma se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y cuida de sus hijos. También se dedica a la cría pollos y cuyes que son para la venta y para su consumo.

En el banco comunal esta hace 10 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento.
 
Su meta es comprarse un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Virma is a member of the Poloma community bank.  She lives in the community of the same name which is located in El Valle parish.  This parish is noted for its landscapes and natural beauty.  The locals work in sales, raising animals and farming.  They maintain their culture and traditions.

Virma is 36 years old, married, and has three children aged 14, 10 and 9.  Her eldest son is in high school and her two younger children are in elementary school.  Her husband works in a carpentry workshop.  Together they have managed to build their own home.

Virma looks after her housework and takes care of her children.  She also raises chickens and guinea pigs.  Some of them are sold and others are eaten by the family.

Virma has been a member of her community bank for 10 years and she will invest her new loan in buying chickens and feed.  Her goal is to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Rosa Ivania

texts.es: Rosa casada su esposo trabaja como conductor de transporte urbano, su hijo lo tiene estudiando, que se prearan es el mayor deseo. Mujer emprendedora tiene su propio negocio venta de cosméticos desde hace tiempo ha sido un ingreso económico para la familia, lo inicio con fondo propios y ahora tiene los planes que con el préstamo invertirlo en la compra de mercadería: perfumes, crema de mano, pinturas de labios, uñas, sombra, marbellí y entre otros productos.  Ofreciendo a sus clientes mayor variedad, aumentando su venta y sus ingresos mejorando su nivel de vida. obteniendo beneficio para su familia.
texts.en: Rosa is married.  Her husband works as a urban transportation driver.  Her son is in school, and her greatest desire is that he is prepared.  Rosa is an enterprising woman who has her own business selling cosmetics.  For some time, this has been a source of income for her family.  She started the business with her own funds, and now has plans to use the loan to purchase merchandise: perfumes, hand cream, lipstick, nail polish, eye shadow, and other products.  She will be able to offer her customers a larger variety and will increase her sales and her income, which will improve her quality of life and benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional stock of Avon products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for rubber buckets and sets of pans and bowls.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pasto, ella vende pasto desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, ella quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de pasto y también quiere que sus hijos terminen de estudiar ya que uno de ellos estudia la carrera profesional de ingeniería civil. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar las mensualidades de estudio de su hijo.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) Communal Bank, located in Cusco district, province, and department.

She is 54 years old, married, and has 6 children. She sells animal feed every day from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm, in the streets.  She wants to expand her feed business and, also, she wants her children to complete their education. One of her children is already studying for the career of civil engineer.

She requests the loan to make monthly payments for her son's studies.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to make monthly payments for her child's education.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 36 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 9 and 16. She runs a small restaurant, in which she sells food to the local people. Her business is located near Wilson airport, and she is served by the Kitengela branch. She has been running this business for six years now and employs five people. She plans to use her loan to purchase meat, rice, cooking flour, and other ingredients to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. 

Nancy plans to use the profit from her business to buy a car and a plot of land on which she will build rental houses. She describes herself as honest, reliable and visionary.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meat, and other ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Maria Berta

texts.es:
María, es madre soltera de dos hijos, quienes ya no viven con ella, pues son mayores y tienen sus propios hogares, María vive sola y se dedica a la venta de alborotos, lleva 11 años en el negocio, esta actividad la aprendió por iniciativa propia, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 3:00pm.
Actualmente necesita comprar maicillo, leña y dulce, para elaborar los alborotos, por eso solicita un préstamo que le ayude a tener los materiales necesarios para continuar en su negocio, pues estas ventas le ayudaran para generar ganancias y cubrir los gastos económicos.
Para ella su único objetivo con el negocio, es tener una fuente de ingresos permanente, para poder cubrirse por sí sola las necesidades que atraviesa en el día a día.
texts.en:
María is a single mother of two children who no longer live with her because they are adults and have their own homes.  María lives alone and sells popcorn balls.  She’s been in business eleven years.  She learned this activity through her own initiative.  She works every day from 7am until 3pm.

At present, she needs to buy popcorn, firewood and caramel to make the popcorn balls so is asking for a loan that will help her have the necessary materials to continue in business because sales help her earn income and cover expenses.

For her, her only objective with the business is to have a permanent source of income so that she, herself, can take care of her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy popcorn, firewood and caramel to make popcorn balls.

loans.name: Try Hard Group

texts.en: Sia, the leader of this group of entrepreneurs, was born in the town of Kailahun 39 years ago. Married to a tailor and the mother of seven children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools, Sia sells clothes for babies. In business for many years now, she has requested this loan in order to buy a large quantity of baby clothing to resell.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes in large quantity to resell.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “FRATERNIDAD DE URUBAMBA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Urubamba, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Hilaria; tiene 50 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 2 hijos de 31, 22  años de edad;  La socia se dedica al comercio minorista de verduras, la socia tiene su puesto en el mercado modelo de Urubamba y la socia trabaja en un stand vendiendo verduras todos los días de la semana, la socia compra de los proveedores a la semana y lleva sus verduras a vender en su stand, la socia vende tomate, lechuga, brócoli,  cebollas con cola y sin cola, habas, arvejas, zanahorias. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de verduras y el pago adelantado a sus proveedores.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Hilaria is a member of the "FRATERNIDAD DE URUBAMBA" ("Urubamba Fraternity") communal bank, based in the district of Urubamba, in the province of  Urubamba, department of Cusco.

Hilaria is 50 years old and lives with her partner. She has 2 children aged 31 and 22. She works in retail selling vegetables. She has a stall in the local Urubamba market and works there selling vegetables every day of the week. She buys from her suppliers once a week and sells the vegetables from her stand. She sells tomatoes, lettuce, broccoli, two kinds of onions, beans, peas and carrots. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables and to pay her suppliers in advance. 

She is grateful for the support received and is committed to repaying the loan as agreed.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and to pay her suppliers in advance.

loans.name: Sainte Marie Agla Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SAINTE MARIE AGLA est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même maison au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Emé Lucia est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Emé Lucia est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Emé Lucia est mariée à un hôtelier du nom de Guy. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont deux restent encore à leur charge. Emé Lucia et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble aux diverses charges de la maison. Emé Lucia a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Emé Lucia vend depuis six ans des produits cosmétiques et des savons. A côté de cette activité, Emé Lucia vend des tissus. Emé Lucia s’approvisionne dans l'un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Emé Lucia sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SAINTE MARIE AGLA, un troisième crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Sainte Marie Agla group is made up of three people who live in the same house in Benin. The representative of the group, whose name is Emé Lucia, is the lady who has her hand raised in the photo. Emé Lucia is 36 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a hotel manager called Guy. The couple has four children, all of whom are studying and two of whom are still in their care. Emé Lucia and her husband live with their children and cover the various household expenses between them. Emé Lucia attended school very little. In order to provide for her needs and those of her children, she has been selling cosmetics and soaps for the past six years. Alongside this activity she also sells fabric. Emé Lucia gets her supplies in one of Benin's largest markets. With a view to satisfying customer demand and in order to increase her turnover and income, she is requesting a third loan together with the other members of the Sainte Marie Agla group. The previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, soaps and fabric

loans.name: Lloyd

texts.en:
Lloyd is a 27-year-old farmer from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He is still single but hopes to have a family in the future.

Lloyd primarily grows rice crops to sell. He has been in this business for 5 years. Lloyd also started raising pigs to augment his income. He requested this loan to purchase piglets, feeds, and fertilizers. Lloyd hopes that his ventures will succeed.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, age 41, is married and a father who has lived in Ornlong Veng, Odor Meanchey, Cambodia for a long time. 

Chea strives to provide the best for his family and works hard for them as a rice and banana farmer.  He’s been a farmer for a long time and his wife Phearom works with him. 

They have three lovely children who live under their care; all attend school.  

He lacks fertilizer and his crops are infested with insects.  He requests a loan through HKL to purchase fertilizer and insecticide.  He says that the loan will be very useful for his business. 

Chea and Phearom hope to send their children to study at a high degree so they can get good jobs and have comfortable houses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep is a 47-year-old hardworking woman from Siem Reap province in Cambodia. She was married but divorced her husband many years ago. She lives with three single children. 

To earn a living, Tep is involved in the business of selling breakfast food including pork porridge and Chinese noodle in her community. She generally earns about US$3 per day from her business. Her two children also help support the family by working in various jobs.

As shown in the photo, Tep’s house is built on the water, therefore it’s really hard to live during the rainy season. She wants to build a new house higher than the water level, but she doesn’t have enough money to do this. So she decided to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva in order to build a new house that can provide her family with a comfortable living.  For her prospects, she’ll expand her selling business and maximize her profit.

loans.use: build a new house

loans.name: Norma Amparo

texts.es:
Norma es una emprendedora que a sus 50 años de edad trabaja con tenacidad para sacar su negocio adelante, día a día se levanta con la ilusión de mejorar la difícil situación económica, y para ello es conciente que debe generar ingresos para lograr un punto de equilibrio.

Su negocio es una tienda en la que vende productos en general, pero como ingreso alterno presta el servicio de mensajería a sus clientes y vecinos, es una luchadora incansable y su mayor sueño es posicionar su negocio, generar empleo e incrementar sus ingresos, y es por este motivo que hoy solicita un préstamo que le permita invertir en el negocio de las encomiendas así éste progresará, las utilidades serán mejores y su calidad de vida se verá beneficiada.
texts.en:
Norma is an entrepreneur, who at 50 years of age works with tenacity in order to succeed in business.  Day after day she gets up with the dream of making a difficult economical situation better, and she is mindful that she must generate income in order to reach a break-even point.

She has a general goods store, but as an alternative income she provides a courier service to her customers and neighbors. She is a tireless fighter and her biggest dream is to develop her business, create work and increase her profit, and this is why she is asking for a loan to permit her to invest in her courier business and thus it will progress, her profit will increase and her quality of life will be better.

loans.use: to have working capital to invest in her courier service

loans.name: Hapizahon's Group

texts.en:
Hapizahon is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a constructor, who earns about 5000 soms per month. Together with her husband she brings up two sons and two daughters. The sons work in construction, the first daughter is a farmer and the youngest daughter studies at school. In 1993 with an initial investment of 4000 soms Hapizahon purchased a calf and since that time she breeds cattle. She always has feed for cattle, because she grows agricultural products such as: cabbage, corn and potatoes.  Selling the dairy products and some part of the harvest she earns additional 3000 soms to family budget. At the moment the family plans to celebrate the daughter’s wedding. Hapizahon applies for the loan because she needs additional financial funds to prepare a weeding dowry for her daughter.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to prepare a wedding dowry for the daughter

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 27 years old and married with one child living in Hioma, Uganda. She deals in brewing local beer and has been in this business for 5 years. She is faced with the challenges of finding customers and of dealing with seasonal weather. Her business goal is to expand the business into new markets/areas, and her personal goal is to build a permanent home. Grace needs a loan to buy millet for brewing local beer.

loans.use: to buy millet for brewing local beer.

loans.name: Aesok Group

texts.en:
Olivia, 44, is a married woman. She lives in Kwekwe with her husband and three children, ages 26, 21 and 15. Two of her children are still going to school. Olivia also looks after her late sister’s son, who is 25 years old.

She is into the business of poultry and peanut butter making. She operates from her home in Redcliff Kwekwe. Currently she employs no one, only being assisted by her family. On a monthly basis, she gets about $750. She has a loan which she used to buy 350 chicks and five bags of chicken feed and baking ingredients, as she is also into baking of birthday and wedding cakes. Olivia is also a youth trainer under the ministry of youth, where she gets other income.

The client faces the challenges of high mortality rates of chicks, electricity cuts and proper chick feed.

She sees herself with a bigger project with more than 1,000 chickens and more than five employees in the next five years. The project will certainly improve her standard of living since her disposable income will have increased.

loans.use: to buy chick feed, as well as baking ingredients.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Uganda. She is married and has 7 children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Sarah lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

Sarah has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Sarah sells her products from home, by means of retail. She also generates additional income through selling piped water and houses for rent. The main business challenges for Sarah include seasonality and thieves.

Sarah has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are seeing her business grow big and start selling wholesale and also to start going to villages for charcoal.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 5 children. 

Fernando has run a shop for 30 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Fernando is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a single woman. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a beauty salon where she provides services of plaiting and blowdrying  and also sells hair oil. She has been involved in this business for four years and employs two staff members. Her business is located in a convenient and conducive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate labour. 
Gladys will use her loan of 20,000 KES to buy weaves, hair oil and braids. Her business goal is to run at least two salons within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy weaves, hair oil and braids.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Fabiola es maestra de educación secundaria y es algo que la satisface plenamente. Vive con sus padres y el sueño de su madre, y el suyo también, es tener una casa bonita y funcional; ya que ahora el espacio es reducido.

Aparte de ser maestra, Fabiola comparte un taller de maquila de ropa con su mamá que atiende cuando tiene tiempo. Este préstamo le proporcionaría las herramientas que necesita ahora para cumplir el sueño de su madre y el suyo; ampliar su casa. 

Fabiola no tiene deudas y no ha tramitado tarjetas, porque cree que sólo en casos de urgencia se deben usar; el único crédito que tiene está en ceros.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:

Fabiola is a secondary school teacher and this is something that fully satisfies her.  She lives with her parents.  Her mother's dream, as well as her own, is to have a beautiful and functional house because right now the space is limited.

Apart from being a teacher, Fabiola shares a clothing workshop with her mother which she tends to when she has time.  This loan will provide the tools that she needs now in order to complete her mother's and her own dream of expanding their home.
