Fabiola has no debt and has not applied for credit cards because she believes that they should only be used in cases of emergency.  The only loan that she has taken out has been depleted.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 55 years old and has two children. Loreta is married woman.

Loreta is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Loreta requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Loreta has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Loreta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Madam Mary L. buys fish in cartons from the harbour and fries and sells them. She does this on a retail basis but wishes to operate on a larger scale, that is distributing her fried fish in kilogram baskets to interested persons. She however lacks the capital to do so. She is therefore seeking a loan of $750.00 from Kiva to make this a reality. She believes in hardwork and knows with this loan, business will indeed grow.

loans.use: working capital to expand her fish selling business

loans.name: Munaya

texts.en: M. is 33 years old and is married with three children, aged 14, 6 and 3. She sells fish crackers and chips whereas her husband, Ma’ruf, sells waste and scrap materials. She was very glad to hear about MBK and decided to become a member. She sells the crackers and chips by consigning them at the small shop in her village. She could earn $5 - $10/day. Now she can live better than before, she can save some money and send her children to school. She is expecting the bigger loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur M. (his father is pictured) sells shoes at the local bazaar in the town of Khachmaz which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Elnur is looking for funding in order to increase the quantity and variety of his inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of his inventory.

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. Him S. is 38 years old and lives in Prey Veng Province with her husband and their 7 children.  She currently works selling sugar cane juice at the market, and can earn $2/day.   Her husband is an electrician and earns $2.5/day.  The family would like to use this loan to build a store for the electrical business, because the husband and three of their children are all electricians.  They hope this loan will help to start their business where the entire family can work together.

loans.use: To build a store

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
Pablina is 58 years old; she’s married to Felipe Vargas who works on agriculture. They have a daughter and a son, he’s a policeman and she’s a teacher, they both have professions because of their parents hard work and effort. Pablina learned how to work with her mother, who taught her to manage the business and with the help of her husband they could expand to meet the client demand and this way get more income to help her mother out and give a better life to their children. Now her children are independent thanks to the help she gave them before. Pablina needs the loan to buy oil, sugar, noodles, flour, dairies, breads, beverages, and other products now that she has a solid client base.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Pablina tiene 58 años, es casada, su esposo se llama Felipe Vargas quien se dedica a la agricultura. Tienen dos hijos, uno es policía y la otra docente, ambos ya cuentan con profesión gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres. Pablina aprendió a trabajar con su madre, quien más adelante le cedió la administración del negocio y con el aporte de su marido pudieron crecer para satisfacer la demanda de los clientes y de esa manera obtener más ingresos para mantener a su madre y brindarle una vida mejor a sus hijos, que actualmente ya se independizaron de ellos, gracias a la formación que les brindó. Necesita el crédito para la compra de aceite, azúcar, fideos, harina, lácteos, panificados, bebidas y otros productos, ya que cuenta con una clientela formada.

loans.use: Compra de aceite, azúcar, fideos, harina, panificados, etc.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old. She is married and has two children. She has two sisters, and they have been living with her since her mother died. She has a small sewing shop in her house, and she applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and new fabric. She also wants to paint the shop and renovate it; make some advertising for the shop; and hire one unemployed person to help her in work. She wants to increase her income and save for a better life for her big family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Makerita Talosaga

texts.en: Makerita enjoys running her fast food stall to sell food to the public.  She has curry, chicken fried rice, and umu (talo, banana, and luau with turkey tail). Her stall is open Monday, Tuesday and Friday only.  Makerita earns a profit of $330 WST ($132 USD) per week.  Makerita will use her loan to buy ingredients for her fast food stall and also to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients for her fast food stall

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Mrs. Soung U., age 58, is a widow with eight children, four sons and four daughters. Four of her children are married and living elewhere, and the other four are living under her custody. Soung and her family live along National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been selling fish since 1982. She also does farming.

Soung is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, in the amount of $1,000. She will use this money to expand her fish-selling business, as well as to buy farmland on contract.

loans.use: To expand her businesses of selling fish and farming

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en: Mrs. Kuch B., 33, a fish seller in the market, earns an average profit of $3 a day. Her husband, Mr. Yan Mab, 39, is a coffee seller who earns around $1 a day. They have two children, both of whom are students. Mrs. Kuch   would like a loan from Kiva of $600 to purchase a motor-bike, as she wishes to buy large amounts of fish from the river and transport them to a small booth in the market.  Doing this will allow her to increase her profit and enable her child to earn a bachelor's degree in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to transport  fish

loans.name: Klut

texts.en: Mrs. Klut M., 50, is married with seven children and is sometimes hired by the Villagers as a farmhand making $1.50 a day.  Her husband, who is also farmer usually earnsaround $1 a day of profit. Two of their children are married and live separately from home. Moreover, three of their children work as garment workers in Phnom Penh city with a salary $70 to $80 every  month. This couple requests a loan from Kiva to purchase good rice seed and fertilizers to put on the farm. Any leftover will be used to renovate their house as now they face a difficulty with a leaking roof during the rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase good rice seed and fertilizers and to fix the leaking roof.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina M. Shahuano is a member of Banco Comunal "Los Angeles." She lives in the Picota district, Picota province, San Martin region. She runs her grocery store from home which is located at Jr. San Martin No. 274. She also runs stand No. 35 in the "La Marginal" market. With a loan of 2000.00 sols, which will be repaid in 6 months, she'll buy staple products such as: sugar, bags of rice, boxes of soap for different uses, packages of toilet paper, and bottles of oil as these goods are much needed in the area. She also wants to stock her shelves with carbonated beverages and candies. Ernestina, 62, is married with three children who live on their own, but she does pay for the education of one granddaughter. She considers herself to be a responsible, hard-working woman with a great desire to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ernestina M. Shahuano, es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Ángeles” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia Picota y distrito de Picota su bodega está ubicado en su propia casa situado en el Jr: San Martín Nº 274, también tiene un puesto en el mercado “La Marginal” puesto 35 de la misma localidad tiene. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como: azúcar, arroz en sacos, jabón para diferentes usos en cajas, papel higiénico en paquetes, aceite en botellas de ha litros debido a que estos alimentos son muy requeridos en la zona, además de surtir su estock de bebidas gasificadas y golosinas. Tiene 62 años de edad, es casada con tres hijos independientes pero con una nieta a la cual esta apoyando en sus estudios, se considera una mujer responsable, trabajadora, sus deseos de salir adelante han hecho de ella una mujer de.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Ms. Celia lives in the Manual Cossio Street in the area of September 14th in the city of La Paz. She rents and lives by herself. She has a food business in which she has rented a store in the area of Valle Hermoso where she sells 20 lunches per day since she does not have the money to expand her business. The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy supplies and merchandise in bigger amounts that will allow her to prepare special meals so that she can improve her earnings since she has nobody that can support her. She has no loans with IMPRO; this is the first time that is requesting a loan, but the economical and cash flow analysis done qualify her to obtain one.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Celia vive en alquiler en la calle Manuel Cossio de la zona 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz, vive sola y la actividad que realiza es la venta de comida en una tienda que alquiló en la zona de Valle Hermoso lugar donde al día vende 20 almuerzos debido a que no cuenta con mucho dinero para ampliar su negocio. El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos en mayor cantidad y poder preparar platos especiales y así mejorar sus ingresos ya que no tiene quien le mantenga. No tiene créditos en Impro; es primera vez que solicita crédito pero el análisis económico y flujo de caja la califican para obtener uno.

loans.use: To buy supplies to prepare and sell more food in her business.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
The Chilito Dining Room is the name of the business to which señora Maria Auxiliadora has been dedicated for 16 years, offering all kinds of dishes for her clients.

Señora María Auxiladora is a single mother and with a son and two grandchildren that she supports because they are under age. It is necessary to emphasize that her efforts are so great that, upon doing the role of both father and mother, she has always managed to offer the children the necessary conditions so that they develop.

Nowadays the pressing need that has arisen is to obtain the money for the purchase of the commodities needed to prepare the food. For that reason she has requested of Ceprodel to obtain the necessary loan for its respective purchase.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Comedor Chilito es el nombre del negocio al que se dedica la señora Maria Auxiliadora desde hace 16 años ofreciendo todo tipo de platillos para sus clientes.

La señora María Auxiladora es madre soltera y con un hijo y dos nietos que mantener por ser menores de edad. Es necesario destacar que sus esfuerzos son tan grandes que al hacer el papel de padre y madre siempre ha logrado brindarles las condiciones necesarias para que ellos se desarrollen.

Hoy en día la necesidad que atraviesa es que le urge obtener el dinero para la compra de su materia prima para preparar los alimentos. Por este motivo acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para su respectiva compra.

loans.use: To buy the materials needed to make the foods that she sells in her restaurant.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, age 45, is the mother of 4 children, 3 of them being independent and her youngest daughter at home. Her youngest daughter is the reason Julia continues moving forward. For some time, Julia has been selling water, which she distributes to the people living in her area. Julia is very active and hardworking, therefore she wants to continue with this business which has proven very profitable. Aside from this business of selling water she is also contracting the construction of rooms for rent, and all of this is done for the well-being of her daughter, to whom she wishes to give everything needed to get ahead. Julia wants to provide water to a large sector of people through a network of tubing for which she needs two generators and for which also requires some capital which will help her complete her proposal. We support this mother, who, with care and dedication is working hard to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Julia de 45 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, siendo 3 de ellos ya independientes y quedando la última de sus hijas quien es la razón de seguir adelante, ella desde hace tiempo se dedica a la venta de agua, que distribuye a las personas que colindan por su alrededor, la señora Julia es muy activa y trabajadora, por eso quiere continuar en este negocio ya que le parece muy rentable. Aparte de su negocio de venta de agua está mandando a construir habitaciones para alquiler, y todo esto lo hace por el bienestar de su hija, a quien quiere darle todo lo necesario para que salga adelante. Julia quiere brindar agua a un gran sector de personas por medio de red tubular por lo que necesita de dos generadores y para ello requiere de un capital el cual ayudará a cumplir con su propósito. Apoyemos a esta madre que con esmero y dedicación lucha duro por salir adelante.

loans.use:
Purchase of 2 generators in order to provide water to a greater number of people in her area.

Compra de dos generadores para brindar agua a más cantidad de personas de su localidad.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is 45 years old and a mother of five children. Her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling foodstuff, such as maize, plantains, beans, ground nuts and gari, in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says selling these products is very lucrative, and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to support her family. Akosua is a member of the group called First King Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee loans for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro lives in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. He and his partner have four children, who are 14, 11, 8 and 3 years old. Pedro has been working as a gardener and growing fruit for about 20 years. He works out of his home, and his partner sells his fruit according to the season. He has many clients who know of his work, and he is easy for them to find since he is always working from the same location. He has been able to position himself well in the market thanks to his partner, who has been selling fruit for a long time and is very experienced.

Pedro will use this loan to buy some machinery that he needs for gardening. This is his third loan from AgroCapital, and he has always been very punctual with his repayments. Pedro only has loans out with our institution, according to his credit report.

loans.use: Buy machinery for gardening

loans.name: Valeria

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Valeria from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children between the ages of 7 and 11. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting three dependents who are orphans. Valeria has been running a business selling traditional Arican cloth called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric, often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile--the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people. Valeria works at the business for 13 hours per day, seven days a week. Valeria currently earns about 200 USD from her business, and she is requesting a loan of 250 USD to buy additional traditional African cloths. In the future, she plans to increase the amount of commodities in her business. Valeria thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase traditional African cloth in bulk

loans.name: Jamila Riaz Masih Group

texts.en:
Jamila baji is the wife of R. M. and resides in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 20 years. She is the mother of two sons. Her elder son has a saloon. Her younger son has a donkey cart which he uses to deliver different items (wheat, fruits and vegetables) from one place to another.

Jamila baji’s husband has a leather-selling business. He has been selling leather for the past 10 years. Jamila baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She has successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more leather to expand her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Rani baji and Shakeela baji and Taj baji each want a loan to buy leather to re-sell. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy wooden beams for her shuttering business. Rashidan baji wants a loan to buy milk for her milk-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy leather to re-sell

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov S. is a villager in Prey Ta Kap village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. Because she has to hire a laborer to plow her field, she is requesting a loan to buy two oxen for breeding and plowing. This will reduce her expenses and increase her earnings. Her husband, Mr. Rim Ry, is a construction worker. Mrs. Pov S. is 27 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To purchase two oxen for breeding and plowing

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Mrs. Yong C. is a villager in Thom Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who now faces a small problem because her field is infertile. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Yong C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to amend the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Sem Suon, helps her in their plantation. Mrs. Yong C. is 52 years old and she has five children, two whom are working in a garment factory while another one is a grocer. The remaining two are attending the local school.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced. She sells women's clothing and shoes at the central market in Beregovo. Her income is about 2,500 UAH per month.

Irina has been in this business for 10 years already. She likes selling women's clothing and likes working with customers. Irina's customers like buying from her as well. Besides that, her good location at the central market provides stable income.

Irina is asking for a loan of 8,500 UAH to increase the assortment of her goods. Irina hopes to increase her sales and spend the extra profit to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of her goods

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
ROSSANA pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”, ubicado en Jr. Los Mangos Nº 447 – San Fernando, Distrito de Manantay, tiene 36 años de edad, 04 hijos, su esposo es carpintero y es socia hace 16 meses de Manuela Ramos.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con los cuales compró 100pies de madera de la especie Capirona, para fabricar muebles de diferentes modelos con la ayuda de su esposo, ella se encarga de vender ya que tiene mucha habilidad en las ventas. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, compró materiales para ambientar su local propio y  aperturarlo  en el mínimo plazo para mostrar a sus clientes la variedad de modelos de muebles que fabrica, ella trabaja en conjunto con su esposo. 

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, por darle la confianza a pesar del poco tiempo de socia. Esta contenta por el trabajo que tiene, y nos dice que siga apoyando a las mujeres que de verdad quieren trabajar y tiene talento.
texts.en:
Rossana is a member of the community bank “Las Triunfadoras” (The Winners) located at Jr. Los Mangos, number 447, San Fernando, in the Manantay district. She is 36 years old and has four children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has been a partner of Manuela Ramos for 16 months.

The first loan she received was 300 Nuevos Soles (about $90 USD), with which she bought 100 feet of Capirona wood to make furniture with the help of her husband. She looks after the sales, since she is very competent in sales.

With this loan of 1,200 Nuevos Soles ($375 USD), she will buy materials to set up her own shop and open it as soon as possible to show her customers the variety of furniture that she makes. She works together with her husband.

She thanks Manuela Ramos for their trust despite her short time as a partner. She is happy for the work that she has, and tells us to keep helping women who really want to work and are talented.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to set up and open her own shop

loans.name: Lima

texts.en:
Lima T., 64, is married and has 4 children. She has two years of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the school, villagers and public three days per week. 

She has had two previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 tala (~$83 USD). SPBD loans are Lima’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the rest of the loan to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make pancakes and to purchase building materials for home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy thread and yarn

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Hà Nguyễn Thi is a 49 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  She is married and has 3 adult aged children.  Hà owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  However, the primary source of income for the business comes from raising a variety of seafood for sale.  Hà has been involved in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2003, Hà joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and engage in business activities.  Hà has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Hà is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Hà from TYM Fund.  Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of  her family.

loans.use: Raising livestock and seafood

loans.name: Olushola

texts.en: Olushola sells kerosene in bottles and gallons. She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. Olushola is 27 years old and married with a child. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia B. is the 50-year-old mother of five children. She is very supportive to her husband in taking care of the children in school. Through her business, she has paid for three children to graduate from tertiary education.

Felicia is a seamstress and has operated a seamstress shop for the past twenty years. She trains seven young ladies in sewing to equip them with her skills and experience for their future careers. She sews all forms of female wear with various kinds of styles like kaba and slit, wedding dress, funeral clothes, etc.

She wants to use the loan to buy more sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings to pay for the rest of her children to graduate from school.

She is a member of the community group called “Ahobrase” (translated: “Humility”) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline A. is from the City of Carmen, Cagayan de Oro. She is 49 years old and married with eight school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a food stall selling snacks, viands, and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell so she can generate a much higher income. This loan will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Matilde Antonia

texts.es: Matilde Antonia B. reside en Tepetitán en el departamento de San Vicente. Matilde tiene 36 años de edad y vive con su pareja José y sus tres hijos Stanley de 17 años, Jessica de 18 años y Efrain de 7 años de edad, todos asisten a la escuela. José la pareja de Matilde se dedica a la profesión de albañil que le deja 200$ mensuales mismos que son de aporte para la familia, Matilde se dedica a la venta de huevos de gallina y a la elaboración de tortillas; Matilde solicita un crédito para comprar más huevos para aumentar su inventario.
texts.en:
Matilde Antonia B. lives in Tepetitán in the state of San Vicente. Matilde is 36 years old and lives with her partner José and their three children: Stanley, seventeen, Jessica, eighteen and Efrain, seven. The children all go to school. Jose, Matilde’s partner, is a bricklayer. He earns $200 per month that goes towards the support of his family. Matilde sells chicken eggs and tortillas. Matilde seeks a loan in order to buy more eggs and increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of chicken eggs.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Teresa de Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Futuro”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 62 años y no tiene hijos.

Se inicio con la venta de golosinas; hace muchos 09 años atrás, nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 210.00 y ahora le va muy bien en sus ventas de golosinas, se siente muy bien y tranquila, ya que tiene muy buena acogida. Se encuentra ubicada en la misma esquina de su casa, donde ofrece sus productos.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, comprará golosinas como: chocolates sublimes, cañonazo; chupetines, chicles y caramelos en diferentes sabores y marcas; así satisfacer a sus clientes. 

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa de Jesús belongs to the communal bank group "Mujeres del Futuro", which meets in the Bellavista District of Bellavista Province, Department of San Martín. She is 62 years old, single, and does not have any children.

She has been selling candy for 9 years. Her business started with a loan of 210 soles, and it continues to do well. She is a good-natured and calm person, and everyone enjoys being around her. Sra. Teresa displays her products on the street corner in front of her house.

With this loan of 1200 soles, she will buy a variety of candies to satisfy her customers’ tastes: premium chocolates, cañonazo (a popular brand of candy bar made of chocolate covered wafers), lollipops, caramels, and different flavors and brands of chewing gum.

Her work gives her much satisfaction. She believes it is worth the sacrifice to fulfill the dreams and goals one has in life. At the same, she expresses her thanks to Manuela Ramos for helping her and other women who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different types of candy

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A., who received no formal education, is divorced with four dependants. A fish seller at Nyayeye near Elmina  since 2001, Mary uses her income to pay for bills, and she will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more fish for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to educate her children.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Rafaela M. dedica su tiempo a atender su negocio de venta de bisuterías tales como colas, aretes, prensadores para el cabello, pinturas de uña, entre otros.

Este negocio actualmente tiene ocho años de existir y en este lapso ella lo ha logrado suplir logrando la satisfacción de sus clientes. Es de importancia destacar que actualmente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de solicitar un crédito para la compra de las bisuterías y así continuar con su actividad.
texts.en:
In the District of León, Sra. Rafaela M. tends to her business selling various sundries such as costume jewelry, hair extensions, earrings, curling irons, nail polishes, and other items.

She has been in business for 8 years and managed to satisfy her customers. It is important to note that Sra. Rafaela has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to purchase costume jewelry so that her business can continue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase costume jewelry

loans.name: Ramal

texts.en:
Ramal was born in 1981. This young man is married. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP)from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli region, now settled in Absheron region.

He is enjoying with his business. He has been in this business for 7 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary materials for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials for improving his business

loans.name: Ntease Group

texts.en: Lympia is fifty – one years old. She is divorced and has give birth to three children, all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. She is a seamstress and the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ntease’, meaning understanding. The group members are engaged either in farming and/or trading activities. They sell/supply in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Maingi

texts.en:
A father of six, Maingi is a Makueni-based businessman who runs a butcher shop. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 to add stock of meat to his butchery. He has three employees and hopes to grow his business into a meat supply business. He has successfully repaid three loans in the past. He describes himself as determined.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add stock of meat to his butchery.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni L. is 30 years old. She is married with 4 children, all of whom attend school. Her husband works as a driver.

Poni is currently in the business of selling bedsheets and used clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase saddles to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by stocking shoes and socks for sale.


About BRAC

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase saddles to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a resident of Santiago, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. She is 25 years old and she operates a general store. She has two children named Marvin and Princess. Marvin is in Grade I, while Princess is in nursery school. Evelyn's husband, Bobby, is 35 years old and works as a farmer in their village. Evelyn has operated her business since she has been married, but there are times that they closed the store because of lack of capital.

Evelyn would like to borrow 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to have additional capital for her store. The capital that she wants to borrow will be used to buy some goods that she has never tried to sell in her store. She will have more income if she adds more goods in her store.

loans.use: To increase inventory and variety of goods

loans.name: Andrew Mulandi

texts.en:
Andrew is 29 years old and married with two children. He shows videos and offers video games at a fee to children in a small makeshift room in Kawangware. He has been in the business for about seven months now with a profit of about 7,600 Kenya shillings a month. 

He has never borrowed from another MFI and this is his first loan from KADET. He was introduced to KADET by a friend. He wants to use the loan to get a more spacious room and buy more household items and home electronics for sale. 

He hopes to expand his relatively new business to a level that can give him sufficient returns to support his family.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To get a spacious room for video shows and buy household items to sell

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: La sra. Filomena tiene su tienda D. barrio ubicada en la Calle 18 D. Mayo D. la zona D. San Antonio Alto, su esposo se dedica al rubro del transporte, tiene su propia movilidad con la cual trabaja como taxi. Sus hijos ya son independientes y le colaboran con los gastos D. la casa, es una cliente muy antigua y muy puntual, el crédito que solicita ahora es para comprar panetones, pan dulce y chocolates ya que se acercan las fiestas naviD.ñas.
texts.en:
Filomena has a neighbourhood store located in Calle 18 D. Mayo in the San Antonio Alto zone. Her husband works in transport and has his own business as a taxi driver. Her children are already independent and help her with the home expenses. Filomena is a long term client and very punctual in her repayments. The loan that she is applying for now is to buy panetones, sweet bread and chocolates, as it is getting close to Christmas time.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE PANETONES, PAN DULCE Y CHOCOLATES

loans.name: Maria Sandiego

texts.es:
La señora María llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla desde  Sincé - Córdoba  donde vivía con sus padres, a casa de un hermano en la busqueda nuevos horizontes para poder ayudar a sus padres, inicialmente trabajó en oficios varios y simultáneamente se capacitó para poder superarse; así realizó cursos de primeros auxilios, actividad que le facilitó posteriormente su trabajo cuidando adultos mayores,  como su salud se deterioró por su ritmo de trabajo, debió buscar otra actividad que le generara ingresos y adaptada a su recuperación, es así como desde hace tres años, se inicia en la venta de productos a través de catálogos  que promociona a clientes del barrio Carlos Meisel y sus alrededores, sitios destacados por su amplia gama de negocios informales; ella, realiza una visita de preventa persona a personas,  exhibiendo sus productos mediante guías especializadas que le suministra la empresa a la cual está afiliada, conoce y explica las bondades de cada producto para generar la compra de ellos. Su dedicación  le ha generado un importante número de clientes a los que vende a crédito y recupera su cartera en plazos quincenales aunque también vende de contado de acuerdo al monto del pedido.

Una de las dificultades que manifiesta es que su capital de trabajo no responde al numero de pedidos requeridos por su clientela, por eso recurre a la financiación pues conoce su probabilidad de acceder a créditos porque ha construido una buena historia crediticia en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con quien viene trabajando desde  el año 2007. María manifiesta que con los créditos y el control de su endeudamiento, aprendido en la capacitación empresarial, ha logrado estabilizar sus ingresos. 
Su próxima meta es adquirir vitrinas, diversificar su mercancía y poner una miscelánea, pues considera que es bien reconocida en el suroccidente de Barranquilla y sus clientes necesitan un sitio fijo donde ubicarla, para ello se prepara observando su mercado  y estando atenta a nuevas oportunidades de productos que le generen mayor margen de utilidad. Su máximo desafío es tener una casa propia para independizarse, pero es una meta a largo plazo en la que no deja de pensar. Ella reconoce que desarrollar un negocio ha ido de la mano con su crecimiento personal, el cual se ve reflejado en la seguridad de si misma. 
 
El crédito inmediato, por valor de $500.000 lo va a emplear en surtir el negocio con cosméticos, multiusos, lencería  acordes a los pedidos de su clientela,  de esta manera  es oportuna y ofrece  un mejor servicio manteniéndolos satisfechos.
texts.en:
María left Sincé – Córdoba, where her parents lived, and went to her brother’s house in the city of Barranquilla to look for new horizons to be able to help her parents. She started working different jobs, and at the same time she received training to be able to improve herself. She took first aid courses, which later helped her get work taking care of elderly people. As her health deteriorated because of her work schedule, she needed to look for other work that would generate income and accommodate her recuperation. That is how she started selling products by catalog three years ago. She sells to customers in the Carlos Meisel neighborhood and the surrounding areas, which are known for their wide range of informal businesses. She makes pre-sales visits from person to person. She shows her products through specialized guides provided by the business she is affiliated with. She knows and explains the benefits of each product to generate its purchase. Her dedication has generated an important number of customers. She sells to them on credit, and she collect payments biweekly. She also sells for cash depending on the amount of the order. One of the difficulties she has is that her working capital does not correspond to the number of customer orders. That is why she turns to the loan. She knows her probability of getting loans because she has built a good credit history with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She has been working with them since 2007. María demonstrates with her loans and the control of her debt that she has learned, through her business training, to stabilize her income. Her next goal is to get display cases, diversify her merchandise, and establish a general store. She is well known in the southwestern part of Barranquilla. Her customers need a fixed place to find her. To that end, she prepares by observing her market and being attentive to new opportunities for new products that will generate a larger margin of profit. Her biggest challenge is to have her own house to become independent. It is a long term goal, which she does not stop thinking about. She recognizes that the development of her business goes hand in hand with her personal growth. That is a reflection of her self-confidence. She will use the loan for 500,000 COP to stock her business with cosmetics, multipurpose items, and lingerie according to customer orders. This is expedient, and she will offer better service, which will keep her customers satisfied

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics, multipurpose items, and lingerie

loans.name: Phoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoeun Y. is group leader of a group with five members who are all in the village of Prey Chheu Teal in Takeo province. She is 50 years old, lives with her husband, Mr. Khoeun Phork, and they have one child who is attending a local school.

Mrs. Phoeun Y. is a silk weaver. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand her business. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy more silk: with the remainder of the loan she would like to buy seed rice and fertilizers to support a 0.6 hectare field.

loans.use: To buy more silk, and seed rice and fertilizers to support a 0.6 hectare field

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: La señora Blanca A., es madre soltera con dos hijos menores de edad, uno de los cuales está estudiando en la primaria. La señora  tiene una pequeña pulpería localizada en su casa de habitación, en la cual vende desde golosinas hasta granos básicos y le sirven para mantenerse ella y sus hijos. Hace más de tres años que se dedica a este negocio, el cual inicio como una alternativa,  debido a que tenía a sus hijos que alimentar, por lo que se armó de valor y decidió establecer la pulpería. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de mercancías de la pulpería, principalmente desea invertir en útiles escolares que es lo que más están buscando sus clientes actuales. El deseo por el momento es trabajar duro para capitalizar el negocio, de tal forma que pueda en un futuro realizar mejoras a su casita, y brindarles mayores comodidades a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca A. is the single mother of two minor children. One of them is attending elementary school. She has a small mini-market in her home. She sells things from sweets to basic grains. This business allows her to support herself and her children. She has been in this business for three years. She started it because she had to feed her children. She armed herself with courage and decided to establish the mini-market. The loan will be used to buy merchandise for the mini-market. She wants to invest primarily in school supplies, which is what her current customers are looking for the most. For now her wish is to work hard to reinvest in the business. That way in the future she will be able to make improvements to her house and give her children more amenities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Helena Eduardo

texts.pt:
Helena nasceu em Gaza tem 42 anos de idade, é viúva mãe de dois filhos a primeira de 22 e o segundo de 20 anos o mais novo é que vai a escola, para além dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pelos seus dois netos que vivem com ela em sua casa. Consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00MT

Helena sai de Gaza quando seu marido é transferido para vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia como Guarda Fronteira. Anos depois seu esposo perde a vida deixando-a com dois filhos por criar, a vida fica muito difícil para Helena então seu genro da lhe um fundo para iniciar o seu próprio negócio. Dá inicio de um negócio de troca de latas vazias adquiridas na Capital Maputo e revendidas na fronteira, em troca ganhava lagerins, sandálias plásticas e cestos, fazia a revenda na capital e vice versa.

Seu negócio foi crescendo e resolve mudar de actividade, pois aquela era muito cansativo, em 2000 consegue arranjar uma banca no Mercado Central onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade. Tem como melhor produto amendoim, tomate, coco, e o óleo alimentar adquiridos na Swazilândia, o saco a 1.320.00MT a caixa a 500.00MT, o saco 500.00MT e a caixa a 450.00MT. Tem viajado duas vezes por semana porque para além de vender no Mercado Central tem vendido também no Mercado Informal (shoprite) nas quartas e sábados, tem um lucro de 3.000.00MT. 

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Helena na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva. O primeiro de 7.000 foi usado para recomeçar o seu negócio, o segundo de 8.000.00MT foi usado para aumentar o volume dos seus produtos. Estes 13.000.00MT serão usados para o mesmo fim esta confiante que vai reembolsar sem nenhum problema porque para além de ser negociante é secretaria do Bairro 25 de junho onde recebe algumas propinas em cada três meses, e pretende construir sua própria Barraca na sua residência.
texts.en:
Helena was born in Gaza. She is 42 years old and is a widowed mother of 2 sons, ages 22 and 20. Her younger son attends school. In addition to her sons she also supports two grandchildren who live with her. She is able to save 1.000.00 MT per month. Helena left Gaza when her husband was transferred to Vila de Namaacha on the border with Swaziland as part of the Border Patrol. Years later her husband died, leaving her with two children to raise. Life was very difficult for Helena. Then her son-in-law gave her money to start her own business. She started a business exchanging empty cans acquired in Maputo and reselling them on the border. In exchange she received lagerins, plastic sandals and baskets, which she resold in the capital and vice versa. Her business was growing and she decided to change activities, as that one was very tiring. In 2000 she was able to set up a booth in the Central Market where she sells basic goods. Her best products are peanuts, tomatoes, coconut, and cooking oil obtained in Swaziland for the following prices: a sack for 1.320.00 MT, a box for 500.00 MT, a sack for 500.00 MT and a box for 450.00 MT respectively. She travels twice a week because in addition to selling in the Central Market she sells in the Informal Market (shoprite) on Thursdays and Saturdays. She makes a profit of 3.000.00MT. This is Helena's third loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva. The first loan for 7.000 was used to restart her business. The second for 8.000.00MT was used to purchase more merchandise. This 13.000.00 MT will be used for the same purpose. She is confident that she is going to pay back the loan without any problems. In addition to being a businesswoman she is the secretary of the Bairro 25 de junho neighborhood, for which she receives tips every three months, and she is hoping to build her own sales counter at her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of vegetables, grains, and other merchandise

loans.name: Tarimaya

texts.en:
Mrs. TariMaya D., a resident of Chappagaun, lives with her husband and two sons. Chappagaun is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur, and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Her husband works in a private office. Her older son has a small business, and her younger son is in grade 11.

Mrs. D. is engaged in goat farming. At this time she has five goats on her farm, and she sells the goats in the local market. This business helps her contribute something to improve the living standard of her family. Now she is requesting a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy a few more goats and grain to feed them.

loans.use: To buy baby goats

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a 45-year-old married woman. She has a life partner in her husband who is a disabled person from the civil war. She is a Khmer professional teacher in the public high school located in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. S. relies on other income from her two single daughters: one is an employee in a casino and one has a cloth sale shop. She also has a child who is married and lives away from home. S. finds it hard traveling to the school or anywhere else because she has no vehicle. She is applying for a loan to buy a new motorbike and the rest of loan will be used for her daughter’s cloth sale business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem K. is married and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its plantations.

K. produces traditional baskets and sells her products for an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband operates his motorbike with a trailer attached, earning an income of USD 6 per day.

K. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a new trailer for her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to purchase a truck.

This is K.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new trailer for her husband's business

loans.name: Fátima Yesenia

texts.es: Fátima Yesenia P. D. M. D. 29 años D. edad, ResiD. en la zona D. Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil, y junto a sus dos hijos D. 14 y 11 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Fátima posee una venta D. platillos típicos, los cuales son hechos a base D. maíz, productos tales como: atol D. elote, tortas D. elote, atol D. maíz tostado y un sin fin D. productos más. Así mismo comercializa cosméticos como maquillaje, perfumes y cremas para el cuerpo y rostro. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos. Fátima solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. maíz y cosméticos D. manera que pueda aumentar sus ventas y brindarle mayor ayuda a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Fátima Yesenia P. D. M. is 29 years old and lives in the Lourdes Colón area, located in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband, who works as a bricklayer, and their 2 children: aged 14 and 11, who are in school. Fátima has a business selling food. She makes traditional dishes based from corn, including items such as: atol D. elote (a corn drink), tortas D. elote (corn cakes), atol D. maíz tostado (roasted corn drink) and an endless number of other products. In addition, she sells cosmetics such as makeup, perfumes, and body and face creams. She is a very responsible and hardworking woman, who has very good references from her neighbors. Fátima requests a loan to buy a large quantity of corn and cosmetics, so that she can increase her sales and proviD. a more help to her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corn and cosmetics

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Liliane

texts.fr: S. Liliane est née en 1973 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à MIWAKOUNOU Moïse, Liliane est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Liliane vit avec ses enfants et son mari à Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. C’est depuis huit ans environs que Liliane vit dans ce quartier. Liliane n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis six ans environs, Liliane vend divers produits (biscuits, savons, huile, cahier, farine de manioc, riz, etc.) à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Liliane achète ses produits. Liliane est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre prêts qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. Liliane désire augmenter davantage le stock de ses produits et accroître sa part de marché ; raison pour laquelle Liliane  sollicite un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Liliane S. was born in Cotonou in 1973, Benin's economic capital. She is married to Moïse Miwakounou and they have five children. A few of the children attend school. Liliane lives with her husband and her children in Agblangandan in the village Sèmè-Podji. She has lived there for eight years. Liliane never went to school. However, for six years, she has been selling a variety of products (cookies, soaps, oil, notebooks, manioc flour, rice etc.) from her home. Liliane buys her products in the international market in Dantokpa. She is a former client of ALID, and she has already recieved four loans that have been repayed in full. Liliane would like to stock her products and expand her sales, which is why she is applying for another loan.

Translated from French by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of products (pastas, cookies, soaps, manioc flour, oil etc.)

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en: Ramon E. is from the village of Naconal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 44 years old. Ramon is married. To make a living, Ramon operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products, such as noodles, vinegar, ketchup, shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Ramon has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Ramon joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for his business. Ramon is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Ramon from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small-scale entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aclia

texts.en:
Aclia J. is currently in the business of selling clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes and bed sheets to sell.  Aclia is 41 years old and is married to a businessman. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a permanent shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more clothes and bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Pet

texts.en:
Pet S., 31, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. S. sells Chinese noodles and cakes for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Jose es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el sector La Campana del distrito de Pitipo, una zona rural cuyos pobladores se dedican netamente a la agricultura. Pertenece a la provincia de Ferreñafe y se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en labores relacionadas a la agricultura, inició sus labores trabajando como obrero agrícola en los C. de cultivo de la zona y luego pudo adquirir un terreno agrícola en el cual suele sembrar granos y con esta actividad solventa los gastos familiares.

Actualmente el ha instalado un cultivo de maíz y está trabajando arduamente para que este cultivo pueda desarrollarse de buena manera, el ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan adquirir abonos para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo.

José es un hombre entregado a su familia y que gusta mucho de su trabajo, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder sacar adelante a su familia. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le estiman mucho.
texts.en:
Jose is a 32 year old dad that lives with his wife and two children in La Campana, district of Pitipo in a rural area where the inhabitants work in agriculture. Pitipo belongs to the province of Ferreñafe and is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. He started working on agricultural activities since he was very young, first as a worker in the fields and then for himself after being able to acquire land, he grows grains and is able to cover the family expenses with this activity. He currently has a corn field and is working hard so that the field can develop well, he has requested Edpyme Alternative for a 2000 PEN loan to allow him to buy fertilizer to maintain the crop. Jose is a man dedicated to his family and a man that enjoys his work, his dream is to be able to keep working to get his family ahead. in the area where they live his neighbors and acquaintances really like him.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for corn field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of frozen meat and pepper

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San B., age 30, is the village bank president, having been selected by its ten members who are located in Preak Toch village, Kandal province. Each member of this village will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses. 

San and her husband are fishermen who earn a small income to support their family.  San will use the loan to buy a fishing boat and fishing machine. They work very hard to support their six children:  Three are students and the other three are stay at home.

loans.use: Buy fishing boat and fishing machine for fishing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a new workshop at home

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn S., 44, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. sells vegetables for an income of USD 2.5 per day.  Her three children are employed at the garment factory in the city  and earn an income of about 2 each to help cover the family expenses. The family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 15 on electricity supply.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. appears in the photograph with her mother.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of a water tank and more spare parts for resale

loans.name: María Olinda

texts.en:
Maria is twenty-three years old.  She lives five minutes outside of the town of Morrope, a small rural village to the north of the cities of Lambayeque and Chiclayo.  The population is primarily of low income and works in agriculture.

Maria participates in two income generating activities.  She raises animals in the yard behind her home and she also produces artisan goods.  Her animals include chickens, ducks and sheep.  She raises them to the appropriate size and then transports them to the wholesale market of Chiclayo.  The market is approximately forty minutes from her home, but is where she finds the most demand and best prices.

The current credit has been requested in order to purchase additional animals and feed.  Maria hopes to be able to get a bulk discount on the food and raise the animals rapidly in order to take advantage of the greater demand during the holiday season.

The community has given good references for Maria and our analysts note her hard work and stead fastness.  Edpyme Alternativa approves her request for the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of animals to expand her business raising and selling them.

loans.name: San Cristobal Group

texts.es: El grupo San Cristóbal recibe este nombre ya que se ubica en la comunidad de San Cristóbal Tepatlaxco perteneciente al Estado de Puebla México. El grupo quiso ponerle el nombre de su comunidad ya que se sienten orgullosas de haber nacido en esta tierra en la que han vivido toda su vida.La señora Isabel C. tiene 42 años y es casada. Se dedica a vender ropa a personas de su misma comunidad quienes la conocen como una persona amable y que ha trabajado duramente para sacar a su familia adelante. Requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa de temporada ya que tiene muchos pedidos de ropa de invierno, dado que sus clientes siempre le hacen pedidos anticipados en esta temporada. En el momento de recibir el préstamo se siente orgullosa de ella misma porque tiene la oportunidad de seguir contribuyendo a mejorar el bienestar de su familia, además de que se siente realizada personalmente.
texts.en:
The San Cristóbal Group received this named because it is located in the community of San Cristóbal Tepatlaxco, which is part of the State of Puebla in Mexico. The group members wanted to be named after their community because they are proud of their birthplace and have lived there their entire lives.

Sra. Isabel C. is 42 years old and married. She sells clothing to people in her community who know her to be a friendly person and a hard worker who tries to move her family forward. Isabel needs a loan to buy seasonal clothing since she has several orders for winter garments. Her customers always place their orders before the season begins. Upon receiving her loan, Isabel felt proud of herself because she has the opportunity to continue improving the welfare of her family. This moment also provides her personal fulfillment.

loans.use: Purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 32 years old. He is married with three children who all attend school. He is a farmer from Nyamira Town in Western Kenya. He has been farming  for ten years and employs six farmhands. His products are tea, milk, maize and beans which he sells locally.

He also earns money from his chemist business which he operates in the same region. 

He has requested this loan of KES 45,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him to acquire a quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to pay school fees for his children. 

His main challenges have been unreliable workers and poor weather conditions, especially hailstorms which destroy his crops.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora  Justina J. es un grupo muy bueno, con pagos excelentes , cada integrante tiene su propia actividad  ,  todas las integrantes son del barrio 8 de Diciembre de la  ciudad de Villa Elisa.
Todas las mujeres son muy trabajadoras y responsables en cuanto a su pago .
Las reuniones se realizan en el domicilio de la Señora Presidenta Justina J. , una señora muy alegre,  quien trabaja como vendedora de varias mercaderias de acuerdo a la epoca que se acerca. 
Actualmente se encuentra vendiendo todos los articulos generales  que se utilizan  y consumen en  navidad, y para esto ella solicito el prestamo ademas por que tambien quieria comprar ropas para vender.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Mrs. Justina Ramos Giménez.  It is a very good group, with excellent payments.  Each member has her own activity and all are from Villa Elisa’s 8 de Diciembre neighborhood.  All the women are hard working and responsible with respect to their payments.

The meetings take place in the group President, Justina Giménez’s, house.  She is a very cheerful woman who works selling varied merchandise according to the coming season.

She is currently selling all the general merchandise common to the Christmas season and that’s why she asked for the loan.  Besides, she also wanted to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy beverages, decorative items, clothes and other merchandise.

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana Vilma H. D. G. D. 50 años D. edad, es una señora muy trabajadora, quien resiD. en Lourdes Colón, en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Ana trabaja muy duro por sostener su propio negocio en el cual comercializa: carteras, ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, y así mismo cosméticos y cremas para el cuerpo. El negocio esta ubicado en su casa D. habitación en donD. desD. hace 5 años se dedica a este oficio, por lo que cuenta con varios clientes fijos. Ana solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo D. poder salir adelante, surtiendo sus ventas y D. esta forma contar con más clientes a los cuales pueda brindar un servicio más surtido D. manera que se encuentren satisfechos y siempre dispuestos a comprar en el negocio D. Ana.
texts.en: Ana Vilma H. D. G., 50, is a hardworking woman living in Lourdes Colón, La Libertad Department.  She lives with her husband and two children.  Ana works very hard to keep her own business going, where she sells handbags and clothing for men, women and children, as well as cosmetics and body lotions.  The business has been located in her home for 5 years, and she has regular clients.  Ana is requesting a loan with the great desire to get ahead, supplying her business in order to gain more clients to whom she can proviD. better service, so that they will be satisfied and always ready to shop in Ana's business.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and purses for sale

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Koem's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Koem S. is a widow with three children, one of whom is a farming laborer while the others are studying in the local public school. She lives in Tadak Pong village in Takeo province.

Sixteen people who make up a village bank loan chose Koem to be their bank president. The loan members will use their portions of the loan in varied ways to improve their families’ living situations.

Koem is a sugar and fruit vender as well as a farmer who owns a very small piece of land upon which she grows rice to sell to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. To do so, Koem is seeking a loan to buy more sugar and additionally, to rebuild her house.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and rebuild her house

loans.name: Martha Celsa

texts.es:
Martha nació en el Dpto. de Ancash, desde muy pequeña fue  muy trabajadora, ayudaba a su mama en todos  los quehaceres del hogar. Es soltera, tiene 2 hijos menores, vive en la Zona de Ampliación Villa el Polvorín, distrito de Carabayllo. 
Trabajó ayudando a su tía en la venta de productos de belleza, como veía que le iba bien en las ventas, decidió vendar por su cuenta, ahora lleva dos años en el negocio, gracias a esos ingresos pudo pagar sus primeros ciclos en  el Instituto IDAT.(lugar donde estudia), actualmente ella trabaja como enfermera, cuidando a un anciano.
Su sueño o meta es ser profesional para poder apoyar a sus hijos y tener su puesto para cualquier negocio. 
Con el préstamo solicitado desea cancelar su último ciclo de la Carrera Enfermería Técnica.
texts.en: Martha was born in the Ancash department. Since she was very small, she was always hard-working. She helped her mother with all the house work. She is single and has two small children. She lives in the area of Ampliacion Villa el Polvorin, district of Carabayllo. She worked helping her aunt selling beauty products. In her opinion, she did well in sales. She decided to sell on her own and now she has two years experience with her business. Thanks to this income, she was able to pay for her first cycles at the IDAT Institute (the place where she studies). Currently, she works as a nurse, taking care of an elderly person. Her dream or goal is to be a professional so that she can support her children and have a place with whatever business. With the loan she is requesting, she wishes to cancel her last cycle at the Carrera Enfermeria Tecnica.

loans.use: Complete her last stage at the Carrera Enfermeria Tecnica.

loans.name: Doricah

texts.en:
Doricah has been in the farming business for seven years now. She has a mixed farm in Nyamira town, western Kenya. Her farm produces vegetables, tea, milk, and coffee that are all sold locally. She also operates a kiosk in the same location.

Doricah is 35 years old, married, and has four children who all attend school.

She has requested a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help in paying school fees for her children. In the future, she would like to have a total of three dairy cows and acquire more land to expand her farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Tambo Group

texts.en:
The rural communal bank “Santa Rosa D. Tambo” is in its third loan cycle with FINCA Peru. Its members work in the Santa Rosa D. Tambo district in Peru's Huancavelica Province. They have businesses in livestock, agriculture and food sales.

Madeley, who is married and has a three-year-old daughter, will be using her loan of 600 PEN to buy rice, sugar, and other ingredients for her prepared foods business. Having begun the enterprise when she got married, she sells prepared foods to local municipal and hospital workers. Since engaging with FINCA Peru, Madeley has been able to save her earnings and hopes to eventually open up a restaurant in Tambo to serve more clients.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, and other ingredients

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier tiene 26 años y es soltero. Vive en el distrito D. Motupe, una zona agrícoL. que pertenece a L. provincia D. Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo. Se dedica a L. venta D. verduras y abarrotes. Cuenta con un puesto en el mercado local. Es muy conocida en su región y cuenta con una clienteL. ya establecida y fiel. Desea ampliar su negocio con L. compra D. más mercadería como papas, zanahorias y pescado. Por ello, ha solicitado un préstamo D. 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Javier es muy trabajador y responsable y posee buenas referencias personales y laborales D. su comunidad rural.
texts.en: Javier is 26 and single. He lives in the district of Motupe, an agricultural area in the province of Lambayeque which is located one and a half hour from the city of Chiclayo. He sells vegetables and groceries. He has a stall at the local market. He is well known in his region and has a stable and loyal clientele. He wants to expand his business by purchasing more goods, such as potatoes, carrots and fish. Therefore he came to the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa and applied for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles. Javier is a hard-working and responsible man with good personal and work references in his rural community.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fish for his market stall

loans.name: Keng

texts.en: From Siem Reap Province, Keng V. started her business over five years ago. She sells a small inventory of groceries from her home. She is 52 years old and a widow. Keng V. has one daughter who is married and helps her in the business. She sells food and some cooking supplies to her neighbors who live near her house. Keng V. hopes to enlarge her business and is applying for a loan of US $500, to be used to accumulate a larger number of necessary grocery items to sell. This will allow her to increase her income, ensuring that her entire family will attain a good standard of living.

loans.use: to accumulate more necessary grocery items to sell

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison K. has been a farmer for the last eight years. He is 30 years old, married and a father of three children.

He learned about KADET LTD from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area.  This is his third loan from KADET, and he plans to spend it on farm supplies.

He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm. His dreams are to be the best, and best-known, farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, de 53 años, es una mujer feliz, pues comparte su vida desde hace 30 años con Raymundo, con quien tiene 6 hijos. Pero solo vive con 3 de ellos, en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Santa Clara. El trabajo al que se dedica está trabajadora mujer es la agricultura, desde hace 25 años que comenzó con el cultivo de papa en sus 6 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas que posee, sembrando en grandes cantidades. Actualmente y gracias al apoyo de su esposo e hijos continúa en esta actividad. Además menciona que tiene 5 toros con los que ara la tierra y 13 vacas lecheras que le proporcionan cantidad de leche y con ella elabora quesos que son vendidos los días domingos en la feria que se realiza en la ciudad de Tarma, ganando un promedio de 200 soles. Ahora su motivación son sus 3 últimos hijos que están estudiando en la ciudad, por lo que tiene una casa arrendada, donde invierte la mayor parte de sus ganancias.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos unidos”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera hacer realidad todos sus objetivos. Teresa, comprará los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de queso que venderá.
texts.en:
Teresa, age 53, is a happy woman who has shared 30 years of her life with Raymundo. They have six children, but only three live with them in their own home in the rural section of Santa Clara. Teresa is a hardworking woman who has been farming for 25 years. She grows potatoes on six hectares of farmland and plants in large quantities. At the moment, she is grateful to have the support of her husband and children so that she can continue in this activity. In addition, Teresa mentions that she has five bulls to plow her land and thirteen dairy cows that provide milk that she uses for making cheeses. She sells the cheeses on Sundays at the fair in the city of Tarma where she earns an average of 200 PEN. Her three youngest children currently provide her with motivation since they are studying in the city, which is why she also has a rented house. A large part of her income is invested in those expenses.

Teresa is a member of the Communal Bank “Trabajemos Unidos” (We Work Together) and this is her first loan with MFP. She hopes to accomplish all of her goals. Teresa will buy the necessary supplies for making cheese to sell.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making cheese.

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es: EL SEÑOR VELASQUEZ LABORA COMO RECIBIDOR /ENTRGADOR,ES ACOMPAÑADO ,TIENE  DOS  HIJOS A SU CARGO,ES  EL CUARTO  CREDITO  QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE LA OPORTUNIDAD QUE LE HAN BRINDADO  ESTA INSTITUCION  CON LOS DESEMBOLSO QUE LE HAN APROBADO , ESTE CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA  COMPRAR PORTON Y VERJA,PAGO DE MANO DE OBRA PARA MURO DE SU VIVIENDAY PAGAR DEUDA CONPENDIENTE.
texts.en:
Mr. V. works in receiving and delivery. He is in a common-law marriage and has two children in his care. This is the fourth loan he has been granted by CEPRODEL. He is grateful for the opportunity offered to him by the organization that has approved the loan disbursements.
