He needs this loan to buy fencing and grating and to pay for labor to build a wall around his home, as well as to pay a pending debt.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to cover personal expenses

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luís  tiene  21 años de edad, es soltero y  vive en casa de sus padres, la misma que esta  ubicada en una zona rural llamada  la Campiña la Arenita en el distrito de Paijan.

Luis  se dedica a ofrecer servicio de transporte público en un mototaxi (moto con cabina para transportar personas), dicha mototaxi es de su propiedad.  Con esta vehiculo cubre las rutas de los caseríos mas cercanos a su localidad.

Luis está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la  reparación de su vehículo y mantenimiento de rodajes, llantas y carpas, el necesita hacerle este manteniendo a su vehiculo, para que este pueda brindar un  mejor servicio.

El tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos, es una persona trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Luís  tiene  21 años de edad, es soltero y  vive en casa de sus padres, la misma que esta  ubicada en una zona rural llamada  la Campiña la Arenita en el distrito de Paijan.

Luis  se dedica a ofrecer servicio de transporte público en un mototaxi (moto con cabina para transportar personas), dicha mototaxi es de su propiedad.  Con esta vehiculo cubre las rutas de los caseríos mas cercanos a su localidad.

Luis está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la  reparación de su vehículo y mantenimiento de rodajes, llantas y carpas, el necesita hacerle este manteniendo a su vehiculo, para que este pueda brindar un  mejor servicio.

El tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos, es una persona trabajadora y responsable.

loans.use: Realizar reparaciones a su mototaxi.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
For the last three years Samuel has been operating a retail electronic  shop in Murungaru area, Ndunyu Njeru town. He is 31 years old and married to Jane. They are blessed with one child.

Samuel was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, who is also a KADET client. This will be his third loan. He paid back his previous loan of KES 60,000 in full and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy inventory of electronic goods for his shop, to resell. 

In the future, Samuel aspires to open a wholesale electronics shop and to supply electronic goods for the whole of Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: to buy stock of electronic goods for his shop.

loans.name: Siele

texts.en:
Siele is  25 years old.  He is married and has a 1-year-old child. He has been farming for 3 years, producing milk, eggs and poultry birds in Litein, South Rift, Kenya.

Siele has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 35,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says farming has really improved his family's living standards and he wants to own more dairy cows to generate more income to pay for the education of his children in the future. He is also focusing on purchasing more land for better farming.

Siele mentions a lack of finances and animal diseases as the major challenges in his farming business.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 52 years old and married with three children. Her children are 27, 28, and 30 years old and they no longer live with Dominga. Dominga runs a small grocery store that sells all types of necessities. In her store, she also sells food that she makes.


Dominga is asking for a $300 loan in order to buy food for her store such as chicken, corn, and flour. She will also buy potatoes and sausages to make a local Peruvian dish called salchipapas. Dominga is committed to improving her business with the help of the loan and promises to complete all payments on time.

loans.use: to buy different types of food for her store

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Compone, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carlota; la socia tiene 31 años; la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, de 3, 2 años de edad;  La socia se dedica al comercio minorista la socia tiene su negocio de venta de lácteos, la socia elabora quesos, leche, yogurt natural, La socia tiene vacas lecheras y terrenos de cultivo, sin embargo lo que producen en esta zona no es suficiente para generar empresas mayoristas y ellos son minoristas, ala socia elabora sus diferentes productos y ella los lleva a vender a todos sus clientes, La socia desea invertir el crédito por el momento en la compra de ingredientes para completar con el negocio de hacer yogurt, quesos y también vender leche. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes e insumos para la elaboración de quesos y yogurt.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carlota is a member of the “Mujeres en Accion” communal bank, located in the Campone district, Anta province, Cusco department.

She’s 31 years old, is in a live-in relationship, and has two children, ages three and two.  She has a small business where she sells milk products, cheeses, and natural milk yogurt.  She has dairy cows and farmland; however items in this zone are not produced in sufficient quantities to form large companies, so they are all small businesses.  Carlota makes her various products and takes them to her customers to sell.  She would like to invest the money from this loan to complement her dairy business, and buy ingredients for making cheese and yogurt.

She is very satisfied and grateful for the support she gets through this media and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dairy business.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La  señora  Benedicta, tiene  treinta y nueve años de edad, estudio hasta la primaria terminada  casi no sabe leer muy bien, pero le gustan mucho las matemáticas.
Tiene tres hijos una mujer Maria y dos varones Daniel y Carlos quienes  apoyan en cualquier decisión que ella tome.
Ella se dedica a la venta  de carnes frías  desde  hace  nueve  años, con su esposo  Gustavo con quien lleva casada 19 años.
Sus clientes  están muy contentos por la calidad de su carne  y por la atención que les da  y por la comprensión ya que  cuando sus clientes no tienen  dinero la  señora Benedicta , les da fiado.
Ella pidio el prestamo para la comprar  mas vacas ya que entrega carne por mayoreo y asi obtiene mas ganancias para  cumplir sus sueños.
Uno de sus sueños es  tener una carnicería más grande ya  desea, darle  lo mejor a sus hijos , para que terminen una licenciatura.
 Le da las gracias a fundacion realidad por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante  y hacer  realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Ms. Benedicta is 39 years old and finished primary school. She does not know how to read very well but likes mathematics a lot.

She has three children: one girl, María, and two boys, Daniel and Carlos, who support her in every decision she makes.

She has been selling cold cuts for nine years, alongside her husband, Gustavo. They have been married for 19 years.

Her customers are very satisfied with the quality of her meat, the service she provides, and her understanding. When her customers do not have enough money, Benedicta will sell to them on credit.

One of her dreams is to have a larger butcher shop. She also hopes to give her children the best so that they can earn college degrees. She is grateful to Fundación Realidad for the support they have provided to help her get ahead and make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy and sell meat.

loans.name: Elimzar

texts.en:
Elimzar is from Teleti, Kartli Region. He is 42 years old, unmarried and lives with his father and elder brother. The main source of income for the family is dairy farming and selling bran. Elimzar’s family has two milk cows. They sell on average 150 liters of milk and 30 kg of cheese per month on the local open market. Also Elimzar sells bran. He purchases it from wholesalers and sells it in Tbilisi, as well as nearby villages. His clients are mostly farmers, who use bran for feeding their livestock and pigs. Total average monthly income of the family, including the pension of Elimzar’s father, is 685 Laris. 

Elimzar requested the credit for purchasing bran, which will be resold. With the borrowed sum he will be able to purchase a big amount of the bran at a cheaper price. It will positively impact the income of the family. Elimzar plans to reinvest most of the profit in the same business, in order to increase turnover and maximize profit.

loans.use: to purchase bran for resale.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
La señora Micaela, vive en una comunidad muy bonita, en donde las personas son muy trabajadoras ya que practican el bordado de mantas, tiene a su responsabilidad un hijo de 19 años de edad.

    Ella solito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mantas e hilos para poder elaborar las camisas y bordarla, es esta actividad lleva unos años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingresos con que ha sacado adelante a su familia.

     Su inspiración por esta  actividad inicio por su familia ya que sus padres también se dedicaban a  lo mismo  y fue como aprendió esta actividad.

    Lo que más desea es que con el préstamo y  su actividad pueda tener un mejor ingreso para ahorrar y seguir trabajando con su actividad.
texts.en:
Sra. Micaela lives in a beautiful community where the people are hard workers. They engage in the practice of making embroideries out of muslin. Micaela has a 19-year-son who is her responsibility.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of muslin and thread for making shirts and embroideries. Micaela has performed this activity for a few years and says that she has done very well. She earns a good income that enables her to move her family forward.

Her family inspired her to start this business since her parents also engage in the same line of work and were the ones her taught her this trade.

What she wants most out of this loan and her business is to earn a better income so that she can save and continue working in this activity.

loans.use: to buy muslin and thread for making shirts and embroideries.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 25 years old married to Peter and blessed with one child. Jane is a tissue seller in the area of Mwiki Nairobi.She has been in this business for the last year and gets an income of KES. 4,400 per month.

Jane has got good credit history with KADET and she is applying for her second loan of KES.20,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans usse to buy tissues for expansion of her business.She will use the extra profit to build and expand her business.

Jane, who is very hardworking. hopes to increase her business and to rent a premise for it.

loans.use: To buy tissue for sale.

loans.name: Odinahmad

texts.ru: Одинахмад житель района Яван. Он женат. Ему 39 лет. У него двое детей. Более пяти лет Одинахмад занимается торговлей на рынке. Он арендует торговую точку, где продает хозяйственные товары и электрические вещи. Он берет кредит для покупки вешалок и посуды, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Odinahmad lives in the Javan region. He is married. He is 39 years old and has two children. For more than five years, Odinahmad has been a trader in the market. He rents a stall where he sells home goods and electronics. He is requesting a loan to purchase and clothes hangers and dishware to have a wider range of goods.

loans.use: purchase clothes hangers and dishware

loans.name: Mireille C. G.

texts.fr: Mireille est mariée et mère d'un seul enfant qui est scolarisé et qui évolue dans ses études. Les charges du ménage sont partagées par le couple. Mireille est vendeuse de produits alimentaires, des tissus, des boissons en canettes et autres articles. Sa boutique est située dans une zone très favorable à son activité. La plupart de ses clients sont constitués des habitants de sa zone commerciale et de ses environs. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de Cotonou. Le présent micro crédit est sollicité et obtenu dans le but de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. Une partie du revenu supplémentaire généré par ce micro crédit sera réinvesti dans l'activité pour son renforcement et le reste lui permettra de se prendre en charge et d'aider aussi ses parents.
texts.en:
Mireille is married and the mother of one child, who successfully attends school. The household expenses are shared by the parents. Mireille sells food products, cloths, canned beverages and some other groceries. The location of her store is very favorable to her customers, who live in the neighborhood of her store or nearby. Mireille gets her supplies at the markets in Cotonou.

She applied for this microloan and it was granted to her in order to better meet the demand of her clientele. Part of the additional profit generated thanks to this loan will be reinvested in her activity and the amount left over will enable her to take care of her parents and provide for their needs.

loans.use: to buy 50 boxes of canned drinks.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is 61 years old and married. He owns a bakery, which he has run since 1993. He is well known in the region for his delicious Manakish, a  popular Levantine pastry consisting of dough topped with thyme, cheese, or ground meat.

Salah is a hardworking man with a very good reputation. He is applying for a loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to buy a bigger oven and large quantities of necessary raw materials such as flour, salt, oil, thyme, and cheese.

Salah works hard to keep his products affordable to everyone in his region. He hopes to improve his business in the future by either opening a new branch or adding items to his menu.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven.

loans.name: Aida Eugenia

texts.es:
Aida Eugenia tiene 46 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de 22 años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

LA VRC MONTE DE LOS OLIVOS, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina conformada por 14 socios y socias. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao.

Aida se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es que el hijo culmine los estudios.
En los tiempos libres le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Aida Eugenia is 46 years old, married and has a child. She lives with her husband and with her 22-year-old son in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar.

The office of the communal bank LA VRC MONTE DE LOS OLIVOS is located in the parish of San José del Tambo, about 60 minutes away, and 14 members, both men and women, formed it. This area is known for the short cycle agriculture of corn, oranges and cocoa. 

Aida works in agriculture growing corn, oranges and cocoa and buying and selling takes place in the canton of Chillanes. She is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds, agricultural supplies such as urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killers to keep the crops in good condition. 

The loan will be very helpful because she will be able to improve her quality of life. The challenges that are very frequent are competition and bug infestation. Her dream is that her son finishes his studies. She likes to spend her free time with her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, agricultural supplies such as urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killers

loans.name: Enjelesia Group

texts.en:
Amos is the facilitator of Enjelesia group. His group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Amos takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and quality maize production. In the recent 2011 season, Amos had an excellent maize yield harvesting 24 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Amos was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Amos and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance. With income from maize sales, Amos will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Enjelesia group will each plant maize plots between half and 1 acre of land.
In the photograph above, Amos is pictured with his group members

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet wants a loan to buy salt, sugar and millet flour for sale. She has been in this business for three years. 

She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of her one child. She desires to build a permanent home and diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar and millet flour for sale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in Likoni, Kenya. She is married and has one child. 
Judith owns a second-hand clothes shop, which has been in operation for one year. She was invited to join Kiva partner Milango by her friends, and she decided to join in order to access credit. She began her business, which has now grown to moderate level, from her personal savings.
Judith is applying for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy new men’s shirts for resale. The main challenge Judith faces in her business are seasonal sales periods and the high cost of goods. She plans to open a second-hand wholesale shop in the future.
Judith will use the extra income from this loan to buy charcoal, which is in high demand in the surrounding areas.

loans.use: to buy new men's shirts.

loans.name: Ai Sas

texts.en: Ai Sas, 27 years-old, is married, and resides with her husband and her mother in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband is a blacksmith who produces knives, swords and axes to sell. Ai Sas is requesting a loan of USD 600 in order to purchase more steel for her husband to produce more knives and axes to sell for his clients. In the future, she would like to expand her husband's business by investing more money to run a shop which sell knives, swords and axes. Moreover, she plans to build a new house next year.

loans.use: to purchase more steel for her husband to produce more knives and axes to sell.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is a married man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as a prayerful man. His primary activity is transportation, and he has been in this business for the last two years. His business challenge is the increasing cost of maintenance. He will use the requested loan of KES 20,000 to buy spare parts for the motorbike and to pay for the garage. In the next five years, Ezekiel plans and hopes to diversify his business by expanding his transportation services, having a garage, and running a retail shop that sells spare parts.

loans.use: to pay for garage costs and to purchase motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
This is Mrs. Sen’s third loan from Kiva. She is taking this loan to support her fish selling business, in which her fish products are currently out of stock. 

Every day Mrs. Sen sells some types of fish in a domestic market that is located in Reussey Keo commune, where she lives. She typically generates approximately $2.00 per day. 

Mrs. Sen now is 54 and a divorced mother who has been blessed with five children. Three among them are working in various careers to help their mother in earning income and to better their living conditions. 

Mrs. Sen is very thankful to our funders who always have given her constant help since the beginning. She hopes that her business will further improve through using her third loan.

loans.use: to support her fish selling business.

loans.name: Mansavo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MANSAVO est formé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Iyanatou Louise, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Iyanatou Louise est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un certain Théophile. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Iyanatou Louise vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari, et assure ensemble avec lui les différentes charges de la maison. Iyanatou Louise n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis quelques années, Iyanatou Louise exerce comme activité, la vente de divers produits ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Iyanatou Louise désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Iyanatou Louise sollicite, ensemble avec le second membre du groupe MANSAVO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
MANSAVO is a group made up of two members who live in the same neighborhood in Benin.  The group's representative, named Iyanatou Louise, is the one raising her hand in the photo.  It is the second time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé in order to raise the level of its activity.

Iyanatou Louise is 30 years old and married to a man named Théophile.  They have three children, some of whom are in school.  All three children are their dependents.  Iyanatou Louise lives with her children and husband and shares with him the various expenses of the household.

Iyanatou Louise did not attend school.  She has been selling various goods for about 20 years.  This activity allows her to meet the needs of her family without much difficulty.

Eager to better meet her customers' expectations, she would like to strengthen her stock of goods and raise the level of her activity.  To do so, she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé, along with the other member of the MANSAVO group.  Their first loan was duly repaid.

loans.use: Acheter divers produts.

loans.name: Funny Farm Group

texts.en:
Mrs Dung is 27 years old and she is married.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 5 years.
Dung lives in Tinh Gia district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Dung faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in future.
This is Dung first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Dung hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.en:
Maria del Pilar is a good working woman, that is why she has already 5 years with her very successful grocery store. She would like to extend her space and buy equipment for it, which is why she is soliciting a loan of $1,500.00 and expects to pay back in 1 year.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Maria del pilar es una mujer de trabajo, por lo que lleva ya 5 años con su negocio de abarrotes y como el negocio a marchado bien a ella le gustaría ampliar y equipar su local por lo que solicita un préstamo de $1500.00 dllrs y pretende pagarlos en el plazo de un año.

loans.use: Buy equipment and extend commercial location

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge has a farm in Santa Lucia, Ecuador. He plants rice and also raises pigs. He has been living on the lands for about 30 years. He primarily relies on rice to feed his wife and two kids, aged 15 and 9. Whenever he is in need of extra capital he goes and sells some pigs in the local market. This has been a great fallback for him and his family. He plans to use most of the money from the loan in rice production. He will purchase pesticides and invest in machinery to help in the collection process.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

Jorge is part of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. Their association works cooperatively to help in the commercialization of the product after it has grown. They will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical micro-entrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice farming

loans.name: Narinj

texts.en: Narinj N. (her employee is pictured) owns an auto paint shop in the town of Khachmaz on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Narinj is looking for funding so that she can purchase a new paint sprayer for her shop. This will be Narinj's third loan with Norwegian Microcredit, which attests to her record of reliability as a loan customer in making all her payments.

loans.use: To purchase a new paint sprayer for her business.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Mr. Eusebio A. lives with his wife in his own home in the Sopocachi neighborhood of La Paz. Eusebio is a construction worker, who depends on building jobs,and his wife runs a small grocery store from their home.

With previous loans from IMPRO, he demolished two rooms made of adobe that were in danger of collapsing, and constructed a structure of two floors with new rooms. The requested loan is to do the rough construction of two rooms using brick. Due to his payment history with IMPRO, he is considered a "preferential customer" and is approved for a new loan.

Translated by Ramon F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

El señor Eusebio A. vive en casa propia en la zona de sopocachi de la Ciudad de la Paz con su esposa. Eusebio trabaja como empleado de la construcción, dependiendo su trabajo de las obras de edificación que pueda construir, y su esposa tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Con créditos anteriores en Impro procedió a demoler dos habitaciones de adobe que se encontraban en peligro de derrumbe, y construyó la estructura en dos niveles para habitaciones nuevas. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de dos habitaciones de ladrillo en obra gruesa. Su antecedente histórico con Impro, lo califica como cliente preferencial y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: to construct 2 rooms

loans.name: Nuri

texts.ru:
Nuri R. sells clothing for women. She is married and has 4 children. Nuri has high school education. She has been in business for 9 years. In 2003, Nuri took a $70 loan from MicroInvest. She used the money to expand her store and add underwear and shoes for children to her assortment of goods. Thanks to the lenders like you, Nuri doubled her business assets. In the future, Nuri wants to open another sales location.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахмонова Нури занимается торговлей женской одежды. Замужем, имеет четверых детей, образование неполное среднее. Занимается торговлей уже 9лет. В 2003году она решила получить займ в размере 70$. После получения займа и целевого использования она добавила в свой ассортимент детскую обувь и нижнее белье, расширила место деятельности. Сейчас её активы увеличились в два раза больше. Этим она благодарна МЗФ «Микроинвест». В будущем она планирует открыть ещё одну торговую точку.

loans.use: Open another sales location
